This partnership aims to integrate Duke-designed Intelligent Grid Services software with AWS cloud technology. The goal is to dramatically reduce grid planning analysis and processing times from weeks to minutes, supporting Duke Energy's $75 billion upgrade.

title: Violations of labor law lead to Home Depot Workers Union loss in Philly
summary: A unionization vote for the independent Home Depot Workers Union in northeast Philadelphia failed, with the union attributing the loss to rampant company labor law-breaking. The union plans to file additional charges with the NLRB, potentially seeking a rerun of the election due to alleged illegal quizzing and spying on workers by Home Depot management. This event highlights growing worker dissatisfaction in retail and warehousing over low pay and poor working conditions.

title: Wayfair Still Has Its Fair Share of Issues
summary: Wayfair Inc. (NYSE: W) is struggling with significant headwinds, including a slowdown in U.S. e-commerce activity and declining customer orders, leading to its fourth consecutive quarterly loss. The company faces stiff competition from established brick-and-mortar retailers and Amazon, requiring increased marketing spend that impacts profitability. While an online shift in home goods offers long-term hope, Wayfair must reverse its revenue declines and address its growing debt to regain investor confidence.

title: Crypto, unicorns and housing bubbles: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon talks economy in Austin
summary: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon visited Austin to discuss the economy, the implosion of FTX, and the future of banking. Dimon expressed optimism for Austin's future due to its pro-business environment and growth potential. He emphasized Texas's attractiveness for business and job creation.

title: The Makers Of The SPAM® Brand Celebrate The 2022 Holiday Season with Limited Edition SPAM® Figgy Pudding
summary: Hormel Foods announced the limited-edition SPAM® Figgy Pudding, a new seasonal flavor available for the 2022 holiday season. This new variety combines savory SPAM® with warm spices and seasonal ingredients, aiming to introduce consumers to the classic holiday treat. The brand also launched an animated song to reintroduce Figgy Pudding to a wider audience, following the success of past seasonal SPAM® flavors.

title: Top 10 Oracle Competitors & Alternatives
summary: This article identifies and describes the top 10 competitors and alternatives to Oracle, a leading US-based multinational technology company providing database solutions, cloud engineering, and enterprise software products. It details each competitor's launch year, founders, headquarters, and key products/services, offering insights into the competitive landscape of the tech industry.

title: Salesforce Accessibility Execs Derek Featherstone, Catherine Nichols Talk Disability Inside And Out Of The Company In New Interview
summary: Salesforce accessibility executives Derek Featherstone and Catherine Nichols discuss the company's commitment to disability inclusion, both internally and externally. They highlight the collaborative efforts within the tech industry to promote accessibility, the role of Salesforce's Office of Accessibility and Abilityforce ERG, and the ethical component embedded in their product development. The executives emphasize that accessibility is a continuous journey and a core value for Salesforce, aiming to create a thriving environment for disabled employees and expanding their user base globally.

title: Stove Top Launches Stuffing Pants to Help You Celebrate Thanksgiving in Comfort and Style
summary: Stove Top is bringing back its popular Stuffing Pants for its 50th anniversary to offer comfort and style for Thanksgiving celebrations. These jogger-style pants feature 360-degree stuffin’-stretch technology and an extra-wide waistband, available on Amazon.com starting November 16th for $24.90. The initiative aims to enhance the holiday experience by combining comfort with the enjoyment of Thanksgiving meals.

title: Dow pops 1,200 points, S&P 500 jumps 5% in biggest rally in two years after light inflation report
summary: Stocks experienced their largest rally since 2020 following an October consumer price index report that suggested inflation might have peaked. The Dow Jones Industrial Average surged 1,201.43 points (3.7%), the S&P 500 rose 5.54%, and the Nasdaq Composite jumped 7.35%. This market reaction was driven by a lower-than-expected CPI reading, leading traders to anticipate a less aggressive stance from the Federal Reserve regarding interest rate hikes.

title: Gap Launches Collection of Family Essentials with Amazon Fashion in U.S. and Canada
summary: Gap has launched a new collection of family essential apparel, accessories, and baby gear on Amazon Fashion in the U.S. and Canada. This collaboration aims to make Gap's modern American essentials more accessible to customers through Amazon's extensive reach and fast, free Prime delivery services. The collection includes thousands of items for adults, teens, kids, and babies, along with babyGap-branded nursery furniture.

title: ‘Matter’ kicks off with a bang in Amsterdam – with Silicon Labs in starring role
summary: The new 'Matter' IoT standard launched in Amsterdam, featuring Silicon Labs in a prominent role and showcasing new smart home solutions. Silicon Labs, aiming to be "the Nvidia of IoT," predicts 40 billion IoT devices by 2030 and significant growth for smart home IoT due to Matter's interoperability. The standard, backed by nearly three hundred companies, aims to simplify smart home experiences for consumers.

title: Jumia Tumbles as Co-Founders Step Down From African E-Commerce Platform
summary: Jumia Technologies AG co-founders Sacha Poignonnec and Jeremy Hodara have resigned from the Africa-focused online retailer, which has consistently reported losses since its New York IPO in 2019. The company, often compared to Amazon.com Inc., was founded in 2012 to bring e-commerce to African markets and attracted significant international investment, with its stock initially surging 75% on its debut.

title: Jumia Technologies (JMIA) Announces Appointment of New Management Board and Acting CEO
summary: Jumia Technologies (JMIA) announced a new Management Board and the appointment of Francis Dufay as Acting CEO, with co-CEOs Jeremy Hodara and Sacha Poignonnec stepping down. The company aims to refocus on core e-commerce fundamentals, reduce operating losses, and achieve profitability. Antoine Maillet-Mezeray has been elevated to Executive Vice President, Finance & Operations, and a search for a permanent CEO is underway.

title: EBay’s focus on luxury to refurbished goods drives results beat
summary: EBay Inc. surpassed Wall Street's quarterly targets as inflation-conscious shoppers increasingly bought refurbished goods and the company expanded its luxury offerings. Despite forecasting holiday-quarter revenue slightly below estimates, investors drove shares up nearly 8% in extended trading, recognizing eBay's appeal for value in a high-inflation environment. The company acknowledged risks from a strong U.S. dollar, Europe's energy crisis, and consumer confidence but noted increased demand for home energy products in Germany.

title: Homeland Grocery Stores name Walmart, Amazon veteran as new president and CEO
summary: HAC, Inc., parent company of Homeland Grocery Stores, has appointed David Criscione, a veteran of Walmart International, Amazon, and Delhaize Group, as its new president and CEO. Criscione will oversee 78 grocery stores in four states and replaces Marc Jones. His background includes executive roles in finance, strategy, and technology, and he was involved in Amazon's launch of physical grocery stores and the potential acquisition of Whole Foods Market.

title: Regeneron turns to IT to accelerate drug discovery
summary: Regeneron Pharmaceuticals is leveraging IT, particularly cloud computing and advanced data platforms, to significantly accelerate its drug discovery process. CIO Bob McCowan has spearheaded a major digital transformation, migrating the company's data to a multicloud environment (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and developing a MetaBio Data Discovery Platform, empowering scientists with tools to experiment and test hypotheses more efficiently. This strategic IT investment aims to reduce the drug development timeline from ten years to as few as four or five.

title: Kroger-Albertsons Merger Makes Sense Operationally
summary: The proposed merger between Kroger and Albertsons, if it closes in early 2024, would create a $200 billion company with over 5,000 stores, significantly overhauling the competitive landscape in the grocery market. Kroger CEO Rodney McMullen, referencing the successful Fred Meyer acquisition, argues the merger is necessary to better compete with larger retailers like Walmart and Amazon, allowing for cost savings, price cuts, and increased investment in digital infrastructure and retail media. The deal is expected to generate $1 billion in annual cost savings and provide greater buying power to navigate rising costs and shrinking margins in the industry.

title: ESG Indexes Lifted by Carbon-Efficient Firms but Underperformed
summary: MSCI ACWI ESG Indexes underperformed during the first three quarters of 2022 despite generally outperforming from 2013-2021. While carbon-efficient firms positively contributed to performance, exclusions from the MSCI ACWI ESG Leaders Index due to ESG controversies and significant negative contributions from specific stocks like Apple and Amazon primarily drove the underperformance. Industry factors, particularly energy and aerospace and defense, saw a reversal in performance but played a lesser role in the overall ESG index underperformance compared to stock-specific exclusions and dollar strengthening.

title: Peace of Mind Shared in a Photograph: FedEx Launches Picture Proof of Delivery to Bolster E-Commerce Residential Delivery
summary: FedEx Express has launched Picture Proof of Delivery (PPOD) for express residential deliveries in the Asia Pacific region, a new service enhancement to address the growing e-commerce market. This free service provides customers with a photo of their package's exact delivery location, offering peace of mind for both consumers and e-tailers. The initiative aims to digitize services, improve customer experience, and supports the significant growth of the B2C e-commerce market in Asia Pacific.

title: Silicon Labs CEO Transforms Company to IoT Chip Designer
summary: Silicon Labs CEO Matt Johnson is transforming the company into a "pure-play" IoT chip designer, focusing solely on wireless connectivity and IoT devices. The company aims to become the undisputed leader in this space, having doubled its revenue in two years and being an early adopter in unifying various IoT standards like Matter, Zigbee, and Zwave. Despite facing competition from larger players and a recent softening of demand, Johnson sees significant growth potential, particularly in areas like digital retail labels and secure hardware.

title: Clorox recalls cleaning products that could contain bacteria
summary: The Clorox Company has recalled scented multi-surface cleaners and all-purpose cleaners due to potential bacterial contamination, including Pseudomonas aeruginosa, which can cause serious illness in individuals with compromised immune systems. The recalled products were sold nationwide at various major retailers and online, with specific date codes indicating affected batches produced between January 2021 and September 2022. Consumers are advised to dispose of the products and contact Clorox for a refund.

title: CouponFollow Celebrates Launch of its Cashback Program with Double Cashback Offers Day
summary: CouponFollow has launched a new cashback program, allowing shoppers to earn cashback at over 1,000 merchants. To celebrate, the company is holding a Double Cashback Offers Day on November 11th, coinciding with the holiday shopping season. This initiative aims to help consumers combat inflation by providing additional savings opportunities through cashback rewards alongside their existing coupon services.

title: Family Feud: National CineMedia Sues Regal For Breach Of Contract, Says Theater Chain Is “Weaponizing” Chapter 11
summary: National CineMedia (NCM) is suing Regal Cinemas for breach of contract, alleging that Regal is using its Chapter 11 bankruptcy filing to improperly terminate a longstanding agreement. NCM claims Regal's parent company, Cineworld, is "weaponizing" the bankruptcy process to resell NCM's exclusive advertising rights to a competitor, jeopardizing NCM's business model and capital structure. Cineworld, however, argues that the existing contract hinders its ability to maximize advertising revenue and that NCM's financial instability necessitates finding a new solution.

title: Creepy deepfake of Elon Musk tied up and held hostage goes viral
summary: A deepfake video of Elon Musk tied up and held hostage, created by reAlpha Tech Corp as an advertisement, has gone viral. The real-estate startup aims to get Musk's attention to join their board, highlighting the growing concern over convincing deepfakes and their ethical implications, further underscored by Scarlett Johansson's past experiences. The video also features a photoshopped Jeff Bezos.

title: Opinion: This one stock stands out when looking at key data from the FAANG+ group
summary: This article discusses the current landscape for tech-oriented stocks, noting that 2022 has been difficult for the sector. It suggests that smart long-term investors should look for bargains among quality merchandise, particularly within the FAANG group. The piece aims to identify one stock from this group that offers a good combination of low valuation and high growth, despite the challenging market conditions.

title: JPMorgan Chase teams with Vera Whole Health to open primary care clinics for employees
summary: JPMorgan Chase is launching primary care clinics for its employees in the Columbus, Ohio area, partnering with Vera Whole Health and Central Ohio Primary Care. This initiative will offer comprehensive in-person and virtual health services to over 20,000 employees and their families, with Morgan Health, JPMorgan Chase's healthcare arm, playing a key role. The move aims to provide high-quality and integrated healthcare, building on Morgan Health's prior investment in Vera Whole Health.

title: John Deere Tasks Satellite to Connect New Frontiers in Agriculture
summary: John Deere is seeking satellite connectivity solutions to provide always-on internet for thousands of its agricultural machines, especially in rural areas lacking cellular coverage. This initiative aims to unlock the full potential of autonomous farming and advanced real-time data analysis, which could represent a $150 billion incremental addressable market. The company is open to partnerships and believes the volume of machines needing connectivity could open new economic opportunities for the satellite industry, despite challenges in reducing terminal costs.

title: UPS hikes 2023 GRI by 6.9%, matching FedEx
summary: UPS announced a 6.9% increase to its 2023 general rate increase (GRI), matching the earlier announcement by FedEx. This increase applies to its U.S. air, ground, and international delivery services, taking effect on December 27, 2022. The move reflects efforts by both carriers to offset elevated cost inflation, with GRIs now serving as a key indicator for contract rates and discounts.

title: Will my grocery store close? Here’s what a Kroger-Albertsons merger could mean for California
summary: A proposed $24.6 billion merger between Kroger and Albertsons could significantly impact California grocery shoppers and workers. The deal, which involves major California brands like Ralphs, Safeway, and Vons, faces scrutiny from antitrust regulators and concerns from unions and community advocates about potential store closures, job losses, and the creation of "food deserts," especially given the troubled history of the 2015 Albertsons-Safeway merger.

title: Kroger Bets $25 Billion on Bulking Up to Be More Like Walmart
summary: Kroger is making a $24.6 billion bid to acquire Albertsons, aiming to compete more effectively with Walmart and Amazon by investing in lower prices, enhanced technology, and data utilization. The merger faces significant antitrust scrutiny from the U.S. Federal Trade Commission, as critics and analysts debate its potential effects on consumer prices, competition, and the retail landscape. Despite regulatory hurdles and immediate stock drops for both companies, Kroger asserts the deal will ultimately benefit customers through price reductions and improved services.

title: What the Kroger-Albertsons merger means for the retail media landscape
summary: The proposed merger between Kroger and Albertsons, valued at $24.6 billion, poses a significant shift in the retail media landscape by combining their first-party data and expanding their retail footprint. This consolidation could allow the new entity to challenge major players like Walmart in the retail media space, offering brands a more compelling advertising platform with a broader reach and richer data for ad targeting. Experts suggest this merger will highlight the growing importance of physical stores and data scale in the future of retail media, potentially benefiting the combined company in a challenging economic environment.

title: Kroger-Albertsons merger: Many views, many angles
summary: The proposed $24.6 billion merger between Kroger and Albertsons faces significant regulatory hurdles but is seen by some analysts as a strategic move to compete with retail giants like Walmart and Amazon. The deal has garnered diverse reactions from various stakeholders, including Wall Street analysts, independent grocers, and organized labor, who express concerns about market dominance, job security, and consumer choice. The merger, if approved, would create a supermarket behemoth with nearly 5,000 stores across 48 states and D.C., leading to potential store divestitures and increased market concentration.

title: JBG Smith Plans Mixed-Use DC Asset Near Amazon HQ
summary: JBG Smith has revealed plans for the RiverHouse neighborhood, a 36-acre mixed-use project in Arlington, Va., near Amazon's HQ2. The development will include thousands of residential units (apartments, senior living, townhomes, condos), 30,000 square feet of retail, and over 7 acres of public parks. The project plans to redevelop existing parking lots with below-grade garages and enhance connectivity with public transport access and a protected cycle track.

title: Pardon the Disruption: The digital forces driving the Kroger-Albertsons merger
summary: The proposed $24.6 billion merger between Kroger and Albertsons aims to create a new "Big 3" in the grocery industry, competing more effectively with Walmart and Amazon. Beyond increasing store footprint and negotiating power, the deal is largely driven by the need for scale in data, e-commerce, and retail media, crucial for future profitability and innovation. The merger faces significant regulatory scrutiny regarding potential impacts on competition and prices, with Kroger preparing to divest numerous stores to gain approval.

title: Gartner Top 10 Strategic Technology Trends for 2023
summary: Gartner has identified the Top 10 Strategic Technology Trends for 2023, which are categorized into four key priorities: Optimize, Scale, Pioneer, and Sustainable Technology. These trends aim to help organizations enhance resilience, improve productivity, engage customers, and pursue sustainable solutions. The article details each of the ten trends and their potential impact on business strategies over the next three years.

title: Corporate Owners of Ralphs, Vons Announce $25 Billion Merger Deal
summary: Kroger and Albertsons have announced a $25 billion merger agreement, creating a mega-chain of approximately 5,000 stores across the nation, pending an antitrust review. While the deal aims to enhance Kroger's competitiveness against Walmart and potentially lower consumer costs, it also raises antitrust concerns for federal regulators. The combined company plans to divest between 100 and 375 stores into a new standalone company to allay these concerns.

title: Target planning 525,000-square-foot warehouse facility in Metro Air Park after $32.4 million land purchase
summary: Target has acquired land for $32.4 million in Metro Air Park to develop a new 525,000-square-foot distribution center. This move follows in the footsteps of competitors Amazon and Walmart Inc., who already operate in the area. Ryan Cos. is involved in the planning of this warehouse project.

title: 5 things to know about Kroger, which plans to merge with Idaho’s largest company
summary: Kroger and Albertsons announced plans to merge, making Kroger Idaho's largest company. Kroger, the nation's largest traditional grocery retailer, operates under many different brand names and is investing heavily in e-commerce. Despite its size and profitability, Kroger has faced criticism for low wages, which it disputes.

title: Kroger to buy Albertsons in $24.6 billion deal
summary: Kroger has agreed to acquire Albertsons in a deal valued at approximately $24.6 billion, with the transaction expected to close in early 2024 pending regulatory approval. This merger aims to create a supermarket chain capable of competing with major non-grocery retailers like Walmart and Amazon, leveraging increased scale for better supplier negotiation and operational efficiencies. Regulatory scrutiny is anticipated due to significant market overlap and potential concerns about stifling competition and increasing food prices.

title: Gerbes parent company Kroger intends to buy Albertsons for $25 billion
summary: Kroger announced its intention to acquire Albertsons in a nearly $25 billion deal, aiming to create one of the largest grocery store chains in the United States and boost its scale against competitors like Amazon and Walmart. The merger, expected to close in 2024, faces significant antitrust scrutiny from regulators, consumer watchdogs, and unions, despite plans to spin off nearly 400 stores. Kroger anticipates using half a billion dollars in cost savings from the merger to invest in lower prices amid high food inflation.

title: Kroger and Albertsons Plan $25 Billion Supermarket Merger That May Face Hurdles (Published 2022)
summary: Kroger announced its plan to acquire Albertsons for $24.6 billion, creating a supermarket giant with over $209 billion in annual revenue and approximately 5,000 stores. The merger aims to compete more effectively with big-box retailers like Walmart and Amazon, potentially passing on up to $500 million in savings to customers. However, the deal quickly drew criticism from consumer advocates and politicians concerned about reduced consumer choice, higher prices, and increased corporate concentration in the grocery market.

title: Kroger, Albertsons to Merge in Bid to Create Grocery Giant
summary: Kroger and Albertsons announced a $20 billion merger agreement, including the assumption of $4.7 billion in Albertsons' debt, aiming to create a grocery giant better able to compete with Walmart and Amazon. The deal, which values Albertsons at $34.10 per share, is expected to face significant antitrust scrutiny due to concerns over high food price inflation and market concentration. If approved, the combined company would control about 13% of the U.S. grocery market and anticipates investing in price reductions, store updates, and employee wages.

title: Kroger and Albertsons plan merger to combine 2 largest supermarket chains
summary: Kroger plans to acquire Albertsons in a $24.6 billion deal, merging the two largest U.S. grocery chains. The merger is expected to face intense scrutiny from federal regulators and critics due to concerns about competition and soaring food costs. The companies plan to invest savings in price reductions for customers and increased wages for workers.

title: Kroger To Buy Albertsons, Creating Grocery Giant
summary: Kroger and Albertsons are reportedly in merger discussions that would unite the two largest supermarket chains in the U.S. Kroger announced on Oct. 14 that it is acquiring Albertsons for $24.6B, assuming $4.7B of Albertsons’ debt, in a deal that would create a grocery giant but likely face antitrust review. The companies plan to divest stores in overlapping markets to facilitate regulatory approval.

title: Albertsons merger with Kroger could be announced this week
summary: Kroger and Albertsons Holdings are reportedly in advanced talks for a merger, with an announcement potentially coming this week. The all-cash acquisition would combine two of the largest supermarket operators in the U.S. This development comes as the grocery industry faces increased competition and demand for updated services.

title: Microsoft uses strategically located subsidiaries to lower taxes more than previously known, new analysis finds
summary: A new report by the Centre for International Corporate Tax Accountability and Research (CICTAR) alleges that Microsoft uses a network of subsidiaries, particularly in Ireland and Bermuda, to significantly minimize its tax liabilities globally. While not suggesting illegal activity, the analysis raises concerns about profit shifting and its impact on tax revenues in countries where Microsoft conducts substantial business. The report points out that despite high profit margins, some Microsoft subsidiaries report much lower margins, reducing taxable income.

title: Thermo Fisher buys Mebane facility for $41M, will bring 200 jobs
summary: Thermo Fisher has purchased a property in Mebane for $41 million to establish a new manufacturing base, which is expected to create 200 high-paying jobs in Orange County. This acquisition is part of a multi-million dollar contract with the U.S. government to meet future demand for vital laboratory products. The company has a significant presence in North Carolina with existing facilities and recent acquisitions, including PPD for $17.4 billion.

title: Fox's Tubi touts over 200 streaming channels — but is anyone watching them?
summary: Tubi, Fox Corporation's free ad-supported streaming service, now offers over 200 linear content streams, including news, sports, and general entertainment. Despite an impressive roster of channels and contribution to Fox's $3 billion revenue, a survey by Interpret Research suggests only 20% of Tubi users regularly engage with its linear channels, with the majority preferring on-demand content. Tubi has aggressively pursued local news deals, a strategy differentiating it from competitors like Pluto TV and the Roku Channel.

title: Invesco Nasdaq 100 ETF: Stash This ETF Away In Your Roth IRA (NASDAQ:QQQM)
summary: This article recommends investing in the Invesco Nasdaq 100 ETF (QQQM) for a Roth IRA, especially given market turmoil. The author highlights why QQQM was chosen over the more common QQQ and discusses its appeal after significant price declines in quality tech stocks like Apple, Amazon, and Microsoft. The author also mentions a collaboration with Hoya Capital for an income-focused investing service.

title: Amazon and clean energy provider to open 19 fueling sites in North America
summary: Amazon and Clean Energy Fuels have partnered to open 19 renewable natural gas (RNG) fueling sites across North America to help reduce greenhouse gas emissions in the trucking industry. The first station opened in Groveport, Ohio, on September 28, with many more expected to be operational by the end of the year. This initiative supports Amazon's goal of using 100% renewable energy by 2025.

title: General Electric cuts hundreds of jobs in the U.S.
summary: General Electric is laying off 20% of its onshore wind workforce in the United States, amounting to hundreds of jobs, in anticipation of an economic recession. This move is part of a broader trend among major American companies, including DocuSign, Gap Inc., Meta, Google, Twilio, Patreon, Snap Inc., Apple, Calm.com, Sweetgreen, Groupon, Fender, and Robinhood, which are also reducing their workforces. Companies are citing market realities and the need to streamline operations and improve profitability as reasons for the job cuts.

title: CVS Health selling benefits technology provider bswift to Francisco Partners
summary: CVS Health is selling its benefits technology provider bswift to Francisco Partners, a global investment firm specializing in technology businesses. While financial terms were not disclosed, bswift will continue its partnership with CVS Health and Aetna. This divestiture comes as CVS Health also engages in acquisitions, such as the recent $8 billion deal for Signify Health.

title: Mizuho Securities to buy 20% of Rakuten Securities for $550 million
summary: Mizuho Financial Group's securities unit will acquire a 19.99% stake in Rakuten Securities for 80 billion yen ($552 million) from Rakuten Group. This strategic move aims to bolster Mizuho's online brokerage business by leveraging Rakuten Securities' expertise and younger clientele. The transaction, expected on November 1st, also helps Rakuten Group raise capital amid competition and significant investments in its mobile network.

title: Academy Sports’ Debt Ratings Upgraded
summary: S&P Global Ratings upgraded Academy Sports + Outdoors' debt ratings to 'BB' from 'BB-' due to better-than-expected performance, including EBITDA margins of almost 19 percent over the last six quarters. The stable outlook reflects anticipated good performance over the next 12-18 months and stable leverage, despite an uncertain economic environment and competition from larger retailers. Academy's strategic operating initiatives, including improved in-store customer service and omni-channel capabilities, are expected to support long-term growth and maintain strong EBITDA margins.

title: Management Team
summary: This article details the executive management team of Plug Power Inc., including their roles, career histories, and significant achievements. It highlights the leadership's contributions to the company's growth, strategic direction in the hydrogen economy, and operational successes across various departments.

title: Coca-Cola Opens West Coast HQ at Spectrum Terrace
summary: The Coca-Cola Co. has opened its new West Coast operations facility at the Spectrum Terrace office campus in Irvine, California. This nearly 10,000-square-foot office will serve as the headquarters for the company's West Zone operations, overseeing over a dozen states and territories. The new space is designed for "connection, collaboration and coaching" for its 125 employees and positions Coca-Cola closer to key markets and customers, including potential partnerships with companies like Amazon, which is also moving into the campus.

title: Tupperware selling at Target stores nationwide
summary: Tupperware Brands Corp. announced that its products are now available at Target stores nationwide and on Target's website. This move is part of Tupperware's strategy to "reinvent" itself and reach new customers, particularly younger demographics who may be less familiar with direct sales. The company has also made previous small-scale retail forays with Amazon, HomeGoods, and Bed Bath & Beyond.

title: Firefly Aerospace's Alpha rocket reaches orbit for 1st time
summary: Firefly Aerospace successfully launched its Alpha rocket into orbit for the first time on its second attempt. The rocket deployed three tiny satellites, including one for educational purposes and another from NASA designed for satellite deorbiting. This achievement marks a significant step for Firefly in the competitive small-satellite launch industry.

title: TTAC: Overweight Tech & Energy, Underweight Industrials & Communication
summary: The FCF US Quality ETF (TTAC) focuses on free cash flow to select approximately 150 stocks, aiming to outperform the Russell 3000. As of late August, TTAC was overweight in technology and energy sectors and underweight in industrials and communication services. FCF Advisors prioritizes free cash flow metrics, which they believe are more difficult to manipulate than GAAP earnings, especially in the current challenging investment environment.

title: Peloton taps Dick's Sporting Goods stores to sell exercise bikes, treadmills
summary: Peloton Interactive Inc announced a partnership with Dick's Sporting Goods to sell its exercise bikes, treadmills, and fitness accessories in over 100 Dick's stores and on its e-commerce platform. This move is part of Peloton CEO Barry McCarthy's turnaround plan to boost sagging sales and attract more customers, following a previous deal with Amazon. Despite the new partnership, Peloton's shares fell by about 16% due to broader investor concerns about consumer discretionary spending.

title: Auto suppliers compete for labor as new Detroit plants near production
summary: Lear Corp. and LM Manufacturing are actively recruiting employees for their new Detroit plants amid a tight labor market, with production set to begin soon. Both companies are offering competitive wages and benefits, including flexible scheduling, to attract and retain workers for the hundreds of jobs being created. The labor market in Detroit and Southeast Michigan is considered large enough to meet the demand despite intense competition from other industries.

title: Macy's launches marketplace for sellers
summary: Macy's has launched a third-party marketplace on Macys.com, echoing moves by other major retailers like Amazon and Walmart. This initiative aims to help Macy's source more products efficiently, reduce inventory management risks, and test new brands and styles. The platform allows independent sellers to submit products for approval, with Macy's managing customer visibility.

title: Clean Energy Announces Opening of Ohio Renewable Natural Gas Station for Amazon and Other Trucking Fleets
summary: Clean Energy Fuels Corp. has opened a new renewable natural gas (RNG) station in Groveport, OH, which will supply fuel to Amazon trucks and other local fleets, marking the first of 19 stations planned under an agreement with Amazon. This station will significantly reduce carbon emissions by dispensing 700,000 gallons of RNG annually. Additionally, Clean Energy is investing in local dairy farms, like South Fork Dairy, to produce RNG from organic waste, further expanding the sustainable fuel supply.

title: MGM and Lionsgate Just Decided We Need More Streamers with Plus Signs
summary: Epix is rebranding to MGM+ and STARZPLAY is becoming Lionsgate+, adding more "plus" signs to the streaming landscape. This comes as Lionsgate considers spinning off its studio business instead of selling Starz, indicating shifts in their streaming strategies and asset management. Both companies announced new programming and library titles for their rebranded services.

title: Lionsgate Targets Spinning Off Studio While Rebranding Starz Streamer Overseas
summary: Lions Gate Entertainment Corp. announced its intention to spin off its Lionsgate studio business and rebrand its Starz streaming service outside the U.S. to Lionsgate+. This strategic move aims to create two distinct companies for investors, allowing for separate valuation of Starz assets and the film/TV production studio, despite previous speculation that the streaming service would be spun off to reduce debt.

title: iStore iSend Selects Oracle Cloud Infrastructure to Meet Soaring E-Commerce Demand
summary: iStore iSend, a Malaysian e-commerce fulfillment provider, has chosen Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) to expand its operations across Asia, aiming to meet growing e-commerce demand. By migrating its critical systems to OCI, the company expects to double its cloud footprint and reduce operational costs by 30 percent while improving inventory visibility and customer satisfaction. This move supports iStore iSend's continued double-digit growth and expansion into new markets like Thailand, Vietnam, and the Philippines.

title: R2 is now Generally Available
summary: Cloudflare announced the general availability of R2, its object storage service. R2 differentiates itself by eliminating egress fees, addressing a major cost concern for developers using traditional cloud providers. The service offers S3 compatibility, automatic regional optimization, integration with Cloudflare Workers, and transparent pricing based on storage volume and operation types, with a free tier for initial usage.

title: Herbalife Nutrition Survey Reveals Top Ten Modern Day Entrepreneurs and What Traits are Needed to Join the List
summary: A Herbalife Nutrition survey identified Bill Gates, Jeff Bezos, and Steve Jobs as the top three most influential modern entrepreneurs, followed by Elon Musk and Mark Zuckerberg. The study, involving 2,750 respondents across the U.S., Mexico, and Israel, also explored traits essential for entrepreneurial success, highlighting creativity and intelligence as most important. Herbalife Nutrition emphasized the ongoing strength of the entrepreneurial spirit and the company's commitment to fostering it.

title: Walmart investing $240M to update Missouri stores
summary: Walmart Inc. is investing $240 million to update 41 stores across Missouri, including several in the St. Louis region. These updates will expand shopping options like pickup and delivery, enhance the Walmart+ membership program, and improve in-store features such as self-checkout lanes and remodeled bathrooms. This investment aims to challenge competitors like Amazon and improve the shopping experience for Missouri customers.

title: 14 best shopping apps of 2025
summary: This article lists the 14 best shopping apps for 2025, categorizing them into marketplace, clothing, social media, cashback, grocery, mystery, and car shopping apps. It highlights the growing trend of mobile commerce and provides detailed descriptions of each app's features and benefits. The article also suggests that marketers consider partnering with these apps to gain awareness and loyalty from shoppers.

title: QVC Plus, HSN Plus Streaming Service Launches on Samsung TVs
summary: Qurate Retail Group has launched its QVC Plus and HSN Plus combined streaming service on Samsung Smart TVs. This new app allows viewers to complete purchases directly within the application and offers multiple live channels (QVC, QVC2, QVC3, HSN, HSN2) along with video-on-demand content. The initiative is part of Qurate Retail's v-Commerce Ventures to expand its live-stream shopping experiences across new digital platforms.

title: Never Mind Growth vs. Value Stocks, Look to Beta
summary: This article argues that investors should focus on stock volatility, represented by beta, rather than the traditional growth vs. value distinction, especially given the current economic uncertainty. It highlights that high-beta stocks, despite their risk, are currently undervalued, particularly in cyclical sectors, presenting potential opportunities. The author also suggests that low-beta stocks can offer a haven for risk-averse investors in uncertain times.

title: Federal Regulators Request More Information on Amazon-IRobot Deal
summary: The Federal Trade Commission has requested additional information regarding Amazon's $1.7 billion acquisition of iRobot, maker of Roomba. This request extends the antitrust waiting period and effectively turns a formality into a full investigation. Both Bedford, Massachusetts-based iRobot Corp. and Amazon.com Inc. received the request.

title: Salesforce unveils Genie, a real-time data platform to power its apps
summary: Salesforce Inc. has unveiled Salesforce Genie, a new real-time data platform designed to power its entire suite of customer relationship management products. Genie aims to unify and personalize customer data in real-time, enabling highly personalized experiences across marketing, sales, and commerce, and addressing data fragmentation issues caused by numerous separate applications.

title: Colgate Marches On With AI-Infused Product Innovation
summary: Colgate-Palmolive is using AI and AR for a new tooth-whitening experience, partnering with Perfect Corp. for an AR tool that lets consumers visualize teeth whitening results on their smartphones. This innovation, focusing on the Colgate Optic White Overnight Teeth Whitening Pen, aims to enhance the consumer journey and support both online and in-store sales by making products more accessible and engaging. The company anticipates this is the first of many such partnerships as it seeks to be a leader in teeth whitening.

title: Lands’ End Announces CEO Succession Plan
summary: Lands’ End, Inc. announced that Andrew McLean, president, International, at American Eagle Outfitters, will join Lands’ End as CEO-designate and as a member of its Board on November 1, 2022. McLean will assume the role of CEO following the planned retirement of Jerome Griffith after Lands’ End’s 2022 fiscal year, ending January 27, 2023. Griffith will continue to serve as a director and executive vice chair after his retirement as CEO.

title: OCC frees Capital One from consent order tied to 2019 breach
summary: The Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC) has terminated a 2020 consent order against Capital One, stemming from a 2019 data breach that affected 106 million accounts. The OCC determined that Capital One had achieved a sufficient level of "safety and soundness" and compliance, no longer requiring additional oversight. This move follows Capital One's payment of an $80 million penalty and its commitment to improving risk management and compliance practices after the breach.

title: FedEx warning drives worst decline in stock, deepens slowdown fears
authors: Medha Singh and Bansari Mayur Kamdar
summary: FedEx Corp's shares experienced their worst day ever, closing at their lowest price since the early pandemic months, after the company pulled its forecast due to fears of a global demand slowdown. This outlook fueled investor anxiety regarding a potential recession as the U.S. Federal Reserve raises interest rates to combat inflation. The stock drop resulted in a $12.5 billion market capitalization loss and put increased pressure on CEO Raj Subramaniam for a quick turnaround amidst existing company-specific challenges.

title: FedEx warns of worsening economy and pulls forecast; shares drop 16%
summary: FedEx Corp withdrew its financial forecast due to an accelerated global demand slowdown, causing its shares to drop over 16%. The company reported first-quarter revenue and profit below Wall Street targets, primarily due to global economic activity causing shortfalls in FedEx Express and FedEx Ground revenues. FedEx announced cost-cutting measures and faces pressure to close a profitability gap with UPS amidst worsening macroeconomic trends.

title: What’s New in Artificial Intelligence from the 2022 Gartner Hype Cycle™
summary: The 2022 Gartner Hype Cycle for Artificial Intelligence highlights key AI innovations expected to drive significant business benefits and will see mainstream adoption within two to five years. These innovations are categorized into data-centric, model-centric, applications-centric, and human-centric AI, with a focus on impact on both business leaders and engineering teams. The article emphasizes technologies like composite AI, decision intelligence, edge AI, and responsible AI as crucial for competitive advantage and solving complex business problems.

title: Document
summary: Affirm Holdings, Inc. reported strong fourth quarter and fiscal year 2022 results, with active merchants increasing to 235,000 and active consumers growing 96% year-over-year. The company saw a 77% increase in Gross Merchandise Volume (GMV) and a 39% increase in total revenue for the quarter. Despite macroeconomic uncertainties, Affirm plans to maintain focus on responsible growth and aims for sustained profitability by the end of fiscal 2023.

title: Palo Alto Networks 3-for-1 stock split: What to Know
summary: Palo Alto Networks completed a 3-for-1 stock split, with shares gaining slightly on the first day of trading post-split before moving into negative territory. Shareholders of record as of September 6 received two additional shares for each one held, distributed after the close of trading on September 13. The company stated the split aims to make shares more accessible to employees and a broader base of investors, following significant stock price increases since its IPO.

title: Cloud optimization co Zesty raises $75m
summary: Israeli cloud optimization company Zesty has raised $75 million in a Series B funding round co-led by B Capital and Sapphire Ventures, bringing its total funding to $116 million. The company's automated system dynamically adjusts cloud configurations to ensure stability and optimize performance rather than solely focusing on cost reduction. Zesty has doubled its annual recurring revenue since early 2022 and employs 120 people, serving over 300 customers with most revenue from North America.

title: How Amazon’s shared network unlocks new community benefits for connected devices
summary: Amazon's Sidewalk network is expanding, offering low-bandwidth connectivity for devices and supporting services like object tracking and smart home control. New Cosmos USA, Inc. is launching the first Sidewalk-enabled natural gas alarm, DeNova Detect, which will provide real-time alerts and extended battery life without needing a power outlet. Amazon is also collaborating with Silicon Labs to simplify the development process for Sidewalk-enabled devices for other manufacturers.

title: Company created by two South Africans tops S&P 500 30-year performance
summary: Monster Beverage Corporation, co-founded by two South African WITS graduates, has ranked as the top-performing stock in the S&P 500 over the last 30 years, achieving a staggering 213,088% total return. The company, initially Hansen Natural Corporation, was acquired in 1990 by Rodney Sacks and Hilton Schlosberg and saw significant growth after launching Monster Energy in 2002. This success story highlights the remarkable financial performance of the energy drink giant, even outperforming tech titans like Amazon, Apple, and Nvidia.

title: Oracle offers its MySQL HeatWave database and analytics on Amazon’s cloud
summary: Oracle has made its MySQL HeatWave cloud database service available on Amazon's AWS cloud, allowing customers to use the service without migrating their data from AWS. This move enables Oracle to reach customers who have historically stored their data on AWS, even though Oracle directly competes with Amazon's database services. Oracle also plans to offer this database platform on Microsoft's Azure cloud in the future.

title: Under the Hood of RCD
summary: The Invesco S&P 500 Equal Weight Consumer Discretionary ETF (RCD) saw significant inflows in August, making it the most popular Invesco equal-weight sector ETF for the month. RCD offers investors exposure to the consumer discretionary sector with an equal-weighted approach, diversifying away from large-cap bias and providing a tilt towards smaller, potentially undervalued companies. This strategy aims to reduce concentration risk by ensuring each of its 60 holdings, including companies like Etsy, Tesla, and Amazon, receives approximately equal allocation during quarterly rebalances.

title: Buy stocks with wide moats to protect your profits
summary: The article discusses Warren Buffett's "economic moat" concept, highlighting companies with sustainable competitive advantages. It outlines five key characteristics of such companies—intangible assets, cost advantage, switching costs, network effects, and efficient scale—and provides examples like Coca-Cola, Salesforce, and Alphabet. The piece concludes with advice on how investors can identify and invest in these wide-moat companies, including building a personal portfolio or using ETFs and investment trusts.

title: Rivian partners with Mercedes on electric vans in Europe
summary: Rivian has partnered with Mercedes-Benz to produce electric vans in Europe, building upon Rivian's existing commitment to supply Amazon with 100,000 electric delivery vans by 2030. This collaboration aims to expand the availability of electric commercial vehicles in the European market.

title: Quantum StorNext File System Now Available in AWS Marketplace
summary: Quantum Corporation has announced the immediate availability of its StorNext™ file system as a subscription offering in AWS Marketplace. This allows for quick deployment of shared storage in the cloud, enabling remote collaboration and accelerating video post-production workflows. The offering supports hybrid and fully cloud-based models with various configurations and subscription plans.

title: Northeast Philly Distribution Center Sells for $148M to Spanish Billionaire
summary: A Northeast Philadelphia distribution center occupied by TJX Cos. has been sold for $148.1 million to Ponte Gadea Compass LLC, an investment firm led by Spanish billionaire Amancio Ortega. This represents a 53% increase from its previous sale price three years ago. The 1.015-million-square-foot facility, built in 2001, has always been leased by TJX, which extended its lease for another 20 years.

title: How Telecom Argentina is evolving its B2B segment
summary: Telecom Argentina is aggressively expanding its B2B segment, with 38% of June revenues coming from cloud, cybersecurity, SD-WAN, and IoT solutions, a significant increase from 5% two years prior. The company has invested US$5bn in digital transformation between 2017 and 2021 to become a technology company and is also pursuing international expansion of its B2B services, particularly cybersecurity under the Ubiquo brand in neighboring countries.

title: Soumya Sriraman Pops Up as President of Streaming for QVC, HSN Parent
summary: Soumya Sriraman has been appointed president of streaming for the Qurate Retail Group, parent company of QVC and HSN, in a newly created role. She will lead the company's streaming commerce business, including QVC+ and HSN+ streamers and live-streaming ventures. This new position comes shortly after her departure from Amazon's Prime Video Channels.

title: How to Buy NASDAQ Stocks
summary: This article provides a comprehensive guide on how to buy NASDAQ stocks, detailing what the NASDAQ is, who owns its shares, and the pros and cons of investing in them. It covers the steps to purchase NASDAQ stocks, from fixing a budget and choosing a broker to placing an order, and includes a brief history of the exchange. The article also mentions specific index funds and prominent companies listed on the NASDAQ.

title: Target CEO Cornell to stay three more years in bid for stability
summary: Target Corp. has waived its CEO retirement policy to allow Brian Cornell, 63, to continue leading the company for another three years. This decision aims to provide stability as Target navigates high inflation and overstocked stores. Investors reacted positively to the news, seeing it as beneficial during a challenging period for the retailer.

title: Qurate Snags Amazon, Macy’s Execs to Accelerate Video Commerce Growth
summary: Qurate Retail Group, parent company of QVC and HSN, has appointed Soumya Sriraman (formerly of Amazon) as President of Streaming and Stacy Bowe (formerly of Macy's) as Chief Merchandising Officer for QVC U.S. These strategic hires aim to accelerate the company's video commerce growth and differentiate its home shopping brands. The appointments are part of Qurate's broader restructuring efforts and Project Athens turnaround plan.

title: Qurate Retail Group Announces New Executives to Lead Streaming and QVC US Merchandising
summary: Qurate Retail Group has appointed Soumya Sriraman as President of Streaming and Stacy Bowe as Chief Merchandising Officer for QVC US to accelerate its digital streaming shopping business and enhance its merchandising strategy. These executive hires from Amazon and G-III Apparel Group aim to differentiate QVC and HSN brands, strengthen customer relationships, and drive growth in the vCommerce sector. The appointments are part of Qurate Retail Group's Project Athens turnaround plan.

title: Jim Chanos Takes Aim at Data Centers and Their High Valuations
summary: Noted contrarian investor Jim Chanos is challenging the high valuations of data center REITs, despite their apparent growth potential. He argues that major cloud providers building their own facilities pose a competitive threat, potentially limiting future growth for companies like Equinix and Digital Realty Trust. Chanos and other analysts also raise concerns about rising costs, intense competition, and opaque valuation metrics for these firms.

title: Beating Other Bidders, CVS Health Inks Deal To Acquire Dallas’ Signify Health in $8B Deal
summary: CVS Health is acquiring Dallas-based Signify Health for approximately $8 billion, beating out other bidders like Amazon. This acquisition will expand CVS's footprint in the value-based care market and enhance its connection to consumers in their homes through Signify's tech-enabled home health services. Signify Health CEO Kyle Armbrester will continue to lead the company's 600-person team as part of CVS Health.

title: LG Uplus' K-pop idol platform goes global via smart TVs
summary: LG Uplus is expanding its K-pop content platform, Idol Plus, globally by making it available on smart TVs equipped with LG Electronics' WebOS 22. The platform, which offers live performances and a library of 35,000 K-pop videos, aims to attract a wider international audience and convert local users into paid subscribers. LG Uplus also plans to integrate Idol Plus into the metaverse and export its K-pop XR content to foreign telecom companies.

title: CVS to buy Dallas-based Signify Health in an $8B deal
summary: CVS Health Corp. has agreed to acquire Dallas-based Signify Health Inc. for $8 billion in a cash deal. Signify Health, a technology-enabled home health services provider, will play a critical role in advancing CVS's health care services strategy and growth in value-based care. The acquisition is expected to enhance CVS's connection to consumers at home and expand new product offerings.

title: Small Window Open for Signify Stock Before CVS Acquisition
summary: CVS Health is set to acquire Signify Health (SGFY) in a deal valued at $30.50 per share, totaling $8 billion. The acquisition, expected to close in the first half of 2023, will see Signify retain its structure within CVS, with its CEO remaining in position. Investors interested in SGFY stock should consider buying only if the share price remains below the buyout valuation.

title: CVS takes lead in talks to acquire Signify Health: report
summary: CVS Health Corp. has reportedly taken the lead in talks to acquire home healthcare company Signify Health Inc., with a bid of around $8 billion. This move aligns with CVS's strategy to expand its in-home health services, an area also eyed by competitors like Amazon.com and UnitedHealth Group. A deal could be announced next week, valuing Signify at over $30 per share.

title: Stagnant Sales Are Creating an Inventory Glut
summary: Global retail volatility over the past 18 months has led to an inventory glut due to resolving supply chain issues and declining consumer demand, particularly for non-essential goods. This situation forces retailers to seek additional storage or deeply discount products, benefiting liquidation companies. The article highlights shifting consumer spending habits towards essentials and the impact on major retailers.

title: American Eagle Outfitters (AEO) embraces fulfillment at the edge
summary: American Eagle Outfitters (AEO) is innovating its e-fulfillment strategy to meet increasing customer expectations for speed. The article details AEO's evolution from a traditional distribution center model to a more decentralized "fulfillment at the edge" approach, including the acquisition of Quiet Logistics and AirTerra to position inventory closer to customers and leverage automation and optimization software. This strategy aims to overcome labor challenges and compete with larger retailers by enhancing delivery speed and efficiency.

title: Announcing VMware Cloud on AWS integration with Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP
summary: NetApp announces the integration of VMware Cloud on AWS with Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP, offering an integrated, certified, and supported external NFS datastore. This solution allows for independent scaling of compute and storage in the cloud, leading to significant cost savings (up to 25-50% TCO reduction) and simplified data management for data-intensive VMware workloads. The partnership leverages 20 years of collaboration between NetApp and VMware to reduce barriers to cloud migration.

title: 40 Under 40 in Home Entertainment, Class of 2022
summary: Media Play News announced its fifth annual "40 Under 40 in Home Entertainment" list, recognizing rising stars and young executives navigating the evolving home entertainment landscape. This year's honorees are playing crucial roles in an era dominated by various video-on-demand models and increasing reliance on data analysis. They are tasked with balancing current business needs with future advancements in the industry.

title: Thermo Fisher Opens $105M Nashville-Area Tech Plant
summary: Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. has opened a new 400,000-square-foot bioprocessing production plant in Lebanon, Tenn., near Nashville. This $105 million facility, developed by Panattoni within Speedway Industrial Park, is the company's largest single-use manufacturing site and is expected to create up to 1,400 jobs. The development highlights Nashville's growing prominence as a life science hub, supported by institutions like Vanderbilt University Medical Center.

title: How Royal Caribbean set up a seafaring cloud strategy
summary: Royal Caribbean Group has adopted a multicloud strategy to manage the complex IT needs of its cruise ship fleet, leveraging Google Cloud, AWS, and Microsoft Azure for different workloads. This approach helps address the unique challenges of seafaring operations, such as unreliable satellite connectivity and the need for robust hybrid solutions. The company emphasizes the importance of balancing internal expertise with external partners and carefully considering cost and talent access in its vendor selection process.

title: DXL’s Shift Away from Deep Discounts is Working
summary: Destination XL Group (DXL) is successfully moving away from deep discounting, as evidenced by its Q2 2022 net sales of $144.6 million and increased sales guidance for fiscal 2022. The "big and tall" men’s wear retailer has reduced clearance inventory and lowered maximum discount levels, contributing to improved gross margins and higher dollars per transaction. DXL plans to open up to 50 net new stores in the next three to five years, indicating confidence in its current strategy and market position.

title: Amazon not expected to bid for Electronic Arts, says CNBC
summary: CNBC reported that Amazon.com Inc is not expected to bid for Electronic Arts Inc, refuting an earlier report about a potential takeover. This news caused EA's stock to fluctuate, initially jumping 15% on the acquisition rumor before settling to a 4% gain. Amazon has recently been active in acquisitions, diversifying its business, while analysts see EA as an attractive target due to its strong licenses and metaverse potential, despite a struggling global gaming industry.

title: UnitedHealth CFO is added to class-action lawsuit over 401(k) plan
summary: UnitedHealth Group Inc.'s CFO, John Rex, has been added to a 2021 class-action lawsuit concerning the company's 401(k) plans. This amendment implicates a key financial officer in the ongoing legal challenge against the healthcare giant.

title: Amazon adopts green hydrogen to help decarbonize its operations
summary: Amazon has signed a significant agreement with Plug Power to procure 10,950 tons of green hydrogen annually starting in 2025, aiming to decarbonize its transportation and building operations. This initiative is part of Amazon's commitment to be net-zero carbon by 2040 and will provide enough power for 30,000 forklifts or 800 heavy-duty trucks. The company is also investing in electrolyzer technology through its Climate Pledge Fund to further scale green hydrogen production and adoption.

title: As big-box stores drop prices, how have spending trends changed at Walmart and Target?
summary: This article analyzes spending trends at Target and Walmart in 2022, revealing that Walmart's average transaction values generally increased year-over-year, while Target's slightly decreased. It also highlights the sustained elevation of online sales share for both retailers compared to pre-pandemic levels and notes a shift in consumer spending towards groceries, especially at Walmart, amidst inflationary pressures.

title: Another option for fiber-optic internet launching in Phoenix metro
summary: Lumen Technologies is launching its fiber-optic internet service, Quantum Fiber, in the Phoenix metropolitan area. This subscription-based service will be rolled out to several cities across the Valley, expanding internet options for residents.

title: Tech Moves: Opendoor hires Seattle tech vet as CTO; Vacasa names CEO; ex-Blue Origin comms chief lands at Clorox
summary: Opendoor has appointed Raji Subramanian, a former Yahoo and Amazon engineering leader and co-founder of Pro.com, as its new Chief Technology Officer. Meanwhile, vacation rental company Vacasa named Rob Greyber, previously president of Egencia, as its CEO. Additionally, Linda Mills, a communications veteran from Blue Origin, joined Clorox as Chief Communications Officer.

title: These Wide-Moat Stocks Are Gaining Ground
summary: Quality stocks with wide economic moats, including Microsoft and Amazon, have outperformed since the bear market low in June, despite still being undervalued. While narrow-moat stocks have seen stronger recent gains due to market-cap weighting of companies like Apple and Tesla, wide-moat companies are better positioned to handle inflation due to their pricing power. Overall, Morningstar analysts consider wide-moat stocks to be deeply undervalued compared to overpriced narrow-moat stocks.

title: Signify Health shares jump as Amazon, UnitedHealth reportedly among bidders for takeover deal
summary: Signify Health's shares surged after reports indicated Amazon and UnitedHealth Group are among the bidders for the home health technology and services provider in a deal potentially exceeding $8 billion. This comes as Signify focuses on its home and community services segment and other major players like CVS, Walgreens, and Walmart intensify their efforts in the healthcare market. A potential acquisition by Amazon would mark its second major healthcare deal in 2022, while for UnitedHealth, it aligns with its vertical integration strategy.

title: Aflac virtualizes the customer enrollment experience
summary: Aflac successfully virtualized its customer enrollment experience during the pandemic to support its independent agents, who were facing significant business risks due to social distancing. By combining existing technologies and building a new enrollment platform on AWS, Aflac enabled agents to conduct virtual meetings, co-browse with clients, and process policy purchases more efficiently. This digital transformation, which included the development of microsites and a "bionic" agent approach, earned Aflac a CIO 100 Award and lays the groundwork for a full migration to the cloud and further intelligent automation.

title: Qualcomm planning return to server market with new chip - Bloomberg News
summary: Qualcomm Inc. is reportedly planning a return to the server market with a new chip, aiming to reduce its dependence on smartphones. The company is seeking customers for a product based on its Nuvia Inc. acquisition, with Amazon Web Services (AWS) agreeing to evaluate the offerings. This move comes as Qualcomm faces a slowdown in smartphone demand, impacting its core handset chip business.

title: Amazon (AWS) and Microsoft Data Centers in Virginia
summary: This article details the extensive presence of Amazon Web Services (AWS) and Microsoft data centers across Virginia, highlighting locations in both Northern Virginia and emerging areas like Boydton. It outlines specific data center sites, their sizes, and ongoing development plans for both companies, emphasizing their investments and strategic growth in the region. The report also covers their respective cloud regions, availability zones, and cloud on-ramps to support demand for compute, storage, and database capabilities.

title: R|T: The Retail Times – Groupon to focus on ‘mission critical activities’ following staff cuts
summary: Groupon has cut over 500 staff and plans to focus solely on "mission-critical activities" due to underperforming business. This move is intended to improve its trajectory and generate positive cash flow by the end of 2022, following similar workforce reductions by other tech giants like Alibaba and Amazon. The article also provides updates on various other tech companies, including funding rounds, layoffs, and strategic partnerships.

title: Amazon was Roomba marketer's biggest customer long before $1.7 billion deal
summary: Amazon was the largest customer for Roomba's marketer well in advance of its $1.7 billion acquisition deal. This indicates a pre-existing significant business relationship between the two companies.

title: Worksport Launches All-New E-Commerce Online Platform
summary: Worksport Ltd. has launched a new e-Commerce platform to sell its proprietary truck bed tonneau covers, including the SC3, SC3 Pro, and SC4. The platform, shopworksport.com, will later feature its hard cover TC3 and flagship products SOLIS (solar-integrated tonneau cover) and COR (portable energy storage system). This initiative aims to streamline production and sales, with products also available on Walmart, Amazon, and eBay.

title: Walmart partners with Paramount+ to better compete with Amazon Prime
summary: Walmart announced a deal with Paramount Global to include the Paramount+ streaming service as a perk for its Walmart+ shipping subscription members, aiming to better compete with Amazon Prime. This addition will not change the Walmart+ annual fee of $98 or monthly fee of $12.95, and comes as many other streaming services are increasing prices. The move helps Walmart enhance its membership offering, which also includes free shipping and gasoline discounts.

title: FedEx, Berkshire Grey Expand Robotics Deal
summary: FedEx and Berkshire Grey have expanded their strategic relationship, focusing on AI-enabled robotic solutions to enhance FedEx's package handling operations globally. The agreement includes new development activities and a master system purchase agreement to streamline procurement of Berkshire Grey solutions. Additionally, Berkshire Grey granted FedEx a warrant to purchase common stock, vesting based on FedEx's investment in robotics and services.

title: Walmart Acquires Volt Systems To Advance Omnichannel Capabilities
summary: Walmart has acquired Volt Systems, a technology company specializing in providing suppliers with enhanced on-demand visibility into merchandising resources. This acquisition aims to strengthen Walmart's omnichannel shopping experience by optimizing product assortment and reducing out-of-stocks through store-level data and actionable analytics. The move highlights Walmart's continued investment in technology to anticipate customer demand and integrate various initiatives across its enterprise.

title: Overtime Raises $100 Million in Series D Funding Round Led by Liberty Media Corporation and Counterpoint Global (Morgan Stanley)
summary: Overtime announced it has raised $100 million in Series D funding led by Liberty Media Corporation and Counterpoint Global (Morgan Stanley), bringing its total funding to over $250 million. The investment will fuel the expansion of its disruptive sports leagues, Overtime Elite (OTE) and OT7, and support the creation of new leagues, e-commerce, and web3 initiatives. Notable investors include Bezos Expeditions, Blackstone, and Sapphire Sport, reflecting confidence in Overtime's growth potential and its ability to engage Gen Z and Millennial sports communities.

title: 'Course Correct' This: Discovery Plus Surrenders Its App Experience to Yet Another Wholesale Partner, Sling TV
summary: Discovery Plus has partnered with Sling TV, allowing Sling users to sign up and watch Discovery Plus content directly through the Sling TV app. This move is part of Warner Bros. Discovery's strategy to reverse former WarnerMedia CEO Jason Kilar's approach of limiting wholesale partnerships and regain market share. The partnership is a significant shift back towards broader distribution channels, similar to previous deals with Amazon Prime Video Channels and Roku Channel, indicating a "course correction" by current WBD management.

title: Cummins Inc. opposes Indiana’s near-total abortion ban
summary: Cummins Inc. has publicly opposed Indiana's new near-total abortion ban, stating it will make it difficult to attract talent and influence future growth decisions. The company, which employs over 10,000 people in Indiana, emphasized its commitment to providing employees with access to high-quality, affordable healthcare and reproductive health benefits. This opposition follows a similar stance from Eli Lilly and aligns with criticism from the Biden administration regarding the ban's impact.

title: Amazon is reportedly buying Roomba vaccum maker iRobot Corp.
summary: Amazon announced its acquisition of iRobot Corp., the maker of Roomba vacuums, for $1.65 billion. This move reinforces Amazon's push into internet-connected home devices and robotics, integrating iRobot's technology with its smart home ecosystem like Alexa and Echo speakers. The acquisition comes as iRobot faces waning demand post-pandemic and patent infringement battles, while Amazon continues its strategy of acquiring companies in hot or adjacent markets, following its recent bid for One Medical's parent company.

title: Better Buy: iShares S&P Core 500 Small Cap ETF or Vanguard S&P 500 ETF?
summary: This article compares the iShares S&P Core 500 Small Cap ETF (IJR) and the Vanguard S&P 500 ETF (VOO), discussing their features, risks, and benefits for investors. While VOO offers stability with large-cap companies, IJR provides potential for higher upside with small-cap stocks, albeit with increased volatility. The choice between them depends on an investor's strategy, risk tolerance, and investment goals.

title: Amazon to Buy Maker of the Roomba for $1.7 Billion (Published 2022)
summary: Amazon announced an agreement to acquire iRobot Corp., the maker of the Roomba robotic vacuum, for $1.7 billion. This acquisition adds to Amazon's expanding smart home product portfolio, which already includes Alexa and Ring doorbells. The deal, Amazon's fourth-largest recorded acquisition, highlights an ongoing trend of tech giants expanding their reach into automated home technologies and services.

title: iRobot in Massachusetts: A timeline of the company's 32-year history.
summary: This article provides a timeline of iRobot's 32-year history in Massachusetts, noting Amazon's recent intent to acquire the company. It highlights iRobot (IRBT) as the latest Massachusetts tech firm to be acquired by Amazon, following Kiva Systems and PillPack. The piece serves as an introduction to a detailed history of the company.

title: Veritone Creates AI-Driven Revenue Opportunities for Enterprise Media & Entertainment Companies on AWS
summary: Veritone announced an extension of its collaboration with Amazon and AWS to support its Media & Entertainment (M&E) customers, leveraging its aiWARE platform to create AI-driven revenue opportunities. By integrating with AWS, Veritone's solutions help M&E companies modernize content production, management, and monetization, including processing vast amounts of media, creating metadata, and enabling Web3 activations. The collaboration aims to provide IP owners and content creators with tools to maximize revenue and engage audiences in increasingly immersive digital environments, as evidenced by clients like the San Francisco Giants and CBS News.

title: Microstrategy Outperforms Every Asset Class and Big Tech Stock Since Adopting Bitcoin Strategy, Says CEO
summary: Microstrategy CEO Michael Saylor highlights that the company's bitcoin strategy has led to significant outperformance against all asset classes and major tech stocks since its adoption. Saylor attributes this success to bitcoin's digital property characteristics and its appeal as a safe haven asset. The company's unique approach involved acquiring substantial bitcoin holdings and integrating it into their corporate strategy.

title: Here’s Why the Geovax Labs (GOVX) Stock Price Soared 63.4%
summary: Geovax Labs (GOVX) stock price surged 63.4% premarket after the company announced positive efficacy study results for its modified Ankara (MVA) vaccine against the Sudan ebolavirus (SUDV). This rally extended a 37% gain from the previous Friday, driven by a peer-reviewed animal study published in NPJ Vaccines. While the news is positive, the author warns against chasing the stock after such a significant rally, suggesting pullbacks often follow.

title: Delimex Brings Fresh, Authentic Mexican Street Flavors to the Frozen Aisle
summary: Delimex, a Kraft Heinz Company brand, is relaunching its frozen taquito line with refreshed packaging, enhanced flavor, and nearly double the filling, inspired by consumer insights into the $6 billion frozen snack category. To celebrate its Mexican heritage, Delimex has partnered with muralists Ale Ballesteros and Raul Urias to create murals in Dallas and Baltimore. The new products and branding are rolling out nationwide at major retailers.

title: Walmart Hawks Refurbished Goods to Inflation-Squeezed Shoppers
summary: Walmart is launching a "Walmart Restored" program to sell refurbished goods from brands like Apple, Samsung, and KitchenAid, both online and in some stores this fall. This initiative aims to attract cost-conscious shoppers amidst high inflation by offering inspected, tested, and cleaned products with 90-day free returns. The move comes after Walmart cut its profit forecast, noting that rising food and fuel prices are causing customers to reduce spending on general merchandise.

title: RYU’s Wholesale Strategy an Unprecedented Success with Addition of Former Saks Fifth Ave SVP, National Expansion, and New Partnerships with Wholesale Icons such as Zappos, Urban Outfitters, Nordstroms, and Others
summary: RYU Apparel Inc. is experiencing dramatic growth in its Q2 2022 wholesale strategy, exceeding expectations due to the addition of Thomas Ott, former Saks Fifth Avenue SVP, to lead its wholesale push. The company announced new partnerships with major retailers like Nordstroms, Urban Outfitters, and Zappos, complementing existing relationships with Altitude Sports and Winners. RYU plans to expand its wholesale channels through traditional stockholding retailers, drop-shipping partnerships, and premium clearance accounts, with strategic goals for its Impact and Rebel collections through 2024.

title: Rumors of Oracle Layoffs Highlight Company's Position in Cloud Race
summary: Rumors are circulating about potential Oracle layoffs affecting thousands of workers across multiple divisions, following reports from The Information and CRN. This comes as Oracle intensifies its efforts to compete in the cloud market against giants like AWS, Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud, despite facing an uphill battle in developer preference. While Oracle has secured wins like TikTok as a cloud client and offers competitive salaries for in-demand tech roles, its broad transformation to keep pace in the rapidly evolving cloud landscape is under scrutiny amid tech industry hiring slowdowns.

title: Manufacturing Titan 3M Is Spinning Off Its Healthcare Business Into A Separate Company
summary: 3M announced its plan to spin off its healthcare division into a separate, publicly traded company. This new healthcare entity, with approximately $8.6 billion in sales in 2021, will focus on innovation in areas like wound care, oral care, healthcare IT, and biopharma filtration. The move aims to create two well-capitalized companies better positioned to pursue their respective growth strategies.

title: Healthcare Triangle launches regional HQ in Singapore to bolster medical innovation in APAC
summary: Healthcare Triangle Inc. has inaugurated its regional headquarters in Singapore, planning to invest $25 million to advance digital healthcare across the Asia Pacific region. This expansion aims to foster medical innovation, create over 500 jobs, and support the digital transformation of healthcare and pharmaceutical sectors by leveraging cloud-based platforms. The company's focus includes strategic partnerships and collaborations to build a more resilient healthcare ecosystem in the APAC region.

title: Target to Open Hubs in Chicago, Denver
summary: Target Corp. announced plans to open three new package-sorting centers, two in greater Chicago and one in the Denver area, to enhance its strategy of using stores to fulfill online orders. This expansion will bring their total mini-warehouses to nine across the U.S., with more planned, aiming to accelerate local deliveries and reduce shipping costs by fulfilling orders from stores. The retailer is leveraging its acquisitions of Shipt, Grand Junction, and Deliv to optimize last-mile delivery, increase efficiency, and lower costs amid surging digital sales.

title: Tuya Announces Matter-compatible Solutions in Close Collaboration with Amazon Alexa
summary: Tuya Smart announced its collaboration with Amazon Alexa to implement Frustration-Free Setup (FFS) based on the Matter connectivity protocol, aiming to enhance the IoT device setup experience and allow direct Wi-Fi connections to Amazon Echo devices. Tuya, an initial FFS partner for Matter, is participating in interoperability tests with Amazon, Google, and Apple and plans to launch Matter-compatible devices by the end of 2022. The company is committed to promoting universal open standards in IoT and supporting its ecosystem partners in adopting Matter, enabling a wider variety of smart home solutions for consumers.

title: Walmart partnership expands The Honest Company’s reach
summary: The Honest Company is expanding its distribution network by partnering with Walmart, making its products available on Walmart's website and in physical stores this fall. This move aims to increase accessibility for customers and generate capital to support the company's growth, which has historically relied significantly on retail partnerships, including Target, Amazon, and Costco. The expansion is part of Honest Company's omni-channel retail strategy and Walmart's effort to offer trustworthy products.

title: Johnson & Johnson leans on beauty trends to create Vivvi & Bloom baby care brand
summary: Johnson & Johnson launched a new baby care brand, Vivvi & Bloom, inspired by beauty industry trends and designed to appeal to millennial and Gen-Z parents with natural formulas and a community-led development approach.
