This premium brand aims to capture a larger share of the baby care market, despite a recent decline in J&J's consumer health sales attributed to supply chain constraints. Vivvi & Bloom's strategy involves co-creation with parents and a digital-first marketing approach to differentiate itself from existing J&J baby lines like Johnson's Baby and Aveeno Baby.

title: GM’s OnStar Unveils New Brand Identity, Expands Services as Company Ushers in New Era of Safety
summary: OnStar has announced a new brand identity and expanded its safety and security services, introducing OnStar Guardian for motorcycle riders and integrating with Amazon Alexa for in-home emergency assistance. These developments reflect OnStar's commitment to making safety accessible to more people, both in and outside of vehicles, and GM's push into software innovation and subscription services. The OnStar Guardian app is now available to anyone with a compatible smartphone, even those without a GM vehicle.

title: Morgan Stanley, NEF Commit $250M for Affordable Housing
summary: Morgan Stanley and National Equity Fund have committed $250 million in funding to BRIDGE Housing Corp. for affordable and workforce housing initiatives. This investment will benefit low- and middle-income residents nationally and is expected to leverage up to an additional $1 billion in capital. The funds will be used for property acquisitions, land purchases, refinancing, capital improvements, and acquiring general partner interests.

title: Local Bounti Debuts New Production Facility in Georgia
summary: Local Bounti, an indoor leafy greens grower, announced the commencement of farming operations at its new controlled-environment agriculture facility in Byron, GA. This new facility establishes a bi-coastal presence for the company, expanding its distribution capabilities to 19 retail distribution centers within a 400-mile radius and servicing approximately 10,000 retail locations. Local Bounti also plans to expand the facility's capacity and introduce its Stack & Flow Technology to meet growing demand and broaden its product offerings.

title: Yelp's departure is a blow for city's office market
summary: Yelp's decision to close its New York City offices and embrace a fully remote workforce is a significant blow to the city's office market, particularly for landlords in downtown Manhattan. The departure of Yelp from its 200,000 square feet at 11 Madison Square, along with other tech company retrenchments, highlights a trend of vacated spaces not being refilled, impacting the commercial real estate sector. This move reflects a broader shift by tech firms towards remote work models, leaving landlords concerned about the future of office occupancy.

title: SkyWater unveils plans to build $1.8 bln chip facility in Indiana
summary: U.S. semiconductor manufacturer SkyWater Technology Inc announced plans to invest $1.8 billion in a chip research and production facility in Indiana, in partnership with the state and Purdue University. The project is contingent on the passage of the CHIPS Act, which aims to provide billions in subsidies and tax credits to the semiconductor industry. This move is seen as crucial for reshoring semiconductor manufacturing and will benefit from collaboration with Purdue University's talent pipeline.

title: 3 Reasons Why Investing in the Nasdaq-100 Is Effective
summary: This article highlights three core reasons why investing in the Nasdaq-100 is effective for long-term asset management. It explains how index investing, particularly in the Nasdaq-100, offers exposure to rapidly growing, innovative global companies with strong brand power and historically high growth rates. The article details various investment products available, such as mutual funds and ETFs, and discusses strategies like currency hedging and leverage.

title: The Critiques Against the American Innovation and Choice Online Act Miss the Mark
summary: Yelp's General Counsel, Aaron Schur, argues that criticisms against the American Innovation and Choice Online Act (AICOA) are unfounded and focus on highly unlikely hypothetical abuses. He contends that concerns about the bill hindering content moderation are misguided, as existing antitrust laws and judicial precedent would prevent such misapplications. Schur asserts that the proposed edits to AICOA are unnecessary, politically unfeasible, and would weaken antitrust enforcement, urging legislators to pass the bill as is to combat real anticompetitive harms.

title: What Does GameStop’s Stock Split Mean for Investors?
summary: GameStop (GME) is undergoing a 4-for-1 stock split, its first in 15 years, which will increase the number of shares and decrease the price per share without affecting market capitalization. Morningstar gives GME a 3-star quantitative rating, indicating it is fairly valued, but with extreme uncertainty due to high volatility. This split follows similar actions by other tech and consumer companies like Amazon, Shopify, and Alphabet.

title: Medtronic expands Health Equity Assistance Program for colon cancer screening with support from Amazon Web Services; Completes first installation of donated GI Genius™ intelligent endoscopy modules
summary: Medtronic announced the expansion of its Health Equity Assistance Program for colon cancer screening, supported by Amazon Web Services, increasing the number of donated GI Genius™ intelligent endoscopy modules from 50 to 133 across 62 facilities. Grady Memorial Hospital in Atlanta received the first installation of these modules, which use AI to detect colorectal polyps, addressing disparities in communities with low screening rates. This initiative aims to improve early detection and outcomes for colon cancer, particularly among vulnerable populations that disproportionately experience higher rates of the disease.

title: What Does Google’s Stock Split Mean for Investors?
summary: Google's parent company, Alphabet, is undergoing a 20-for-1 stock split, which will adjust Morningstar's fair value estimate per share to $180, though its competitive advantage and 4-star "undervalued" rating remain unchanged. Analyst Ali Mogharabi identifies YouTube monetization, Maps monetization, and the cloud business as key growth drivers, with strong confidence in Google's continued dominance in the online search market. The article also notes other companies like Amazon, Shopify, and Tesla undertaking similar stock splits.

title: Florida man charged with selling fake Cisco equipment in $1 billion scheme
summary: A Florida man, Onur Aksoy, has been charged with importing and reselling counterfeit Cisco networking equipment worth over $1 billion if authentic. Aksoy allegedly operated a scheme from 2013 to 2022, netting $100 million in revenue by selling fake devices through Amazon.com, eBay, and other platforms after acquiring them from suppliers in China and Hong Kong. Cisco Systems Inc. sent multiple cease-and-desist letters, and both Amazon and eBay blocked numerous storefronts related to the counterfeiting.

title: What the Shopify stock split means for investors
summary: This article discusses the implications of Shopify Inc.'s 10-to-1 stock split on June 29, 2022, following a significant drop in its share price. It explores the strategic benefits of such a split, including making shares more attractive to retail investors, improving liquidity, and potentially boosting the share price. The article also examines the initial impact on Shopify's stock performance and trading activity.

title: Global Industrial Continues Sales Structure Diversification
summary: Global Industrial is diversifying its sales structure, moving from a historically inside sales-based model to incorporating a direct sales channel and emphasizing vertical alignment. CSO Claudia Hughes discusses the company's hybrid digital-inside-outside sales model, its focus on strategic account managers, new business development, and the impact of remote work on sales team engagement and customer interaction while maintaining differentiation against competitors.

title: FMET Makes It Simple to Take Long View of Metaverse
summary: The Fidelity Metaverse ETF (FMET) offers investors a way to engage with the growing metaverse theme, which is projected to be worth over $800 million by 2028. Despite a retrenchment in growth stocks, the long-term outlook for the metaverse remains compelling, especially with established companies like Meta Platforms, Alphabet, Apple, and Nvidia investing heavily in its development. FMET provides a diversified basket approach to this theme, including exposure to gaming and numerous mega-cap growth companies, with an affordable annual fee.

title: Uber expanding business to Israel
summary: Uber is launching its ride-hailing app in Israel, five years after a previous attempt failed, by partnering with a network of licensed taxi drivers. The service will be available in Jerusalem and Tel Aviv, competing with existing local services. This expansion is part of Uber's global strategy to integrate taxis into its app, following similar partnerships in several other countries.

title: Kirkland’s launches in-home delivery service
summary: Kirkland's Inc. is launching a new in-home delivery service, partnering with Ryder System Inc. to provide last-mile delivery, light assembly, and packaging disposal for large home decor and furniture products. This nationwide program, initially test-launched in over 25 markets in June 2022, is expected to cover the lower 48 U.S. states by the end of July 2022. The move aims to enhance customer experience, expand the customer base, and make Kirkland's offerings more competitive, following a trend among other retailers offering assembly services.

title: 'A certification that you've made it': How United Natural Foods Inc became the DTC CPG gatekeeper
summary: United Natural Foods, Inc. (UNFI) has established itself as the leading wholesale distributor for health and specialty foods in North America, becoming a crucial gateway for DTC brands aiming for national retail presence. Despite challenges like antiquated processes and margin compromises, working with UNFI is often a necessary "certification" for CPG startups seeking to expand beyond e-commerce into major grocery chains like Whole Foods. The article highlights UNFI's significant influence and role in bridging digitally-native brands with traditional physical retail, as demonstrated by brand experiences and financial figures, including $27.27 billion in revenue in 2021.

title: How Much Worse Can It Get for Growth Stocks?
summary: The second quarter of 2022 saw growth stocks suffer their largest losses since the 2008 financial crisis, with the Morningstar US Growth Index dropping 25.3%. Value stocks significantly outperformed growth, marking the widest margin since the dot-com bubble collapse, as rising interest rates and inflation dampened the appeal of growth companies' future earnings. While many growth stocks are now at their cheapest valuations in years, experts suggest value stocks may continue to outperform in the short term despite growth's long-term lead.

title: Amazon, Disney, AT&T Gave to Abortion Foes Like DeSantis While Vowing to Help Employees
summary: Amazon, Disney, and AT&T, despite pledging to cover travel costs for employees seeking reproductive medical care, have also contributed financially to anti-abortion governors and political figures like Ron DeSantis. State campaign-finance records show these corporate giants supported leaders actively working to reduce access to abortions, creating a contradiction between their public stances and political donations.

title: BP, Shell to cover employee travel for treatment after Roe v. Wade
summary: BP PLC has joined Shell PLC in committing to cover employee travel expenses for healthcare treatment following the Supreme Court's overturning of Roe v. Wade. Both European oil producers updated their healthcare plans to extend benefits for women needing to travel for services, though neither explicitly named abortion. This move comes as other major companies like Amazon, JPMorgan Chase, Tesla, and Walt Disney also updated their policies to cover travel costs for out-of-state abortion services, while U.S. oil majors have largely remained silent.

title: Kroger's automated grocery delivery warehouse opens in Pleasant Prairie
summary: Kroger has opened a new automated grocery delivery warehouse in Pleasant Prairie, Wisconsin, in partnership with Ocado Group PLC. This facility is the fifth of its kind for Kroger and is expected to create approximately 250 jobs, serving customers in Wisconsin, northern Illinois, and northwest Indiana. The warehouse utilizes a robotic system called "The Hive" to efficiently sort and pack groceries for delivery.

title: Federal Realty Pandemic Program Produced Permanent Deals for 50% of Tenants
summary: Don Wood, CEO of Federal Realty Investment Trust, discussed the company's temporary leasing program during the pandemic, which resulted in over half of the tenants transitioning to permanent deals. He also highlighted the acquisition of Kingstowne Towne Center in Virginia and the importance of ESG principles, noting the company's 13 megawatts of solar capacity.

title: CVS, Rite Aid ration contraceptive pills as demand surges
summary: CVS Health Corp. and Rite Aid Corp. are limiting purchases of emergency contraceptive pills like Plan B to three per customer due to a surge in demand following the US Supreme Court decision overturning Roe v. Wade. Other chains, such as Walgreens, have not implemented purchase limits at this time, though some Walmart products have online purchase limits that may change with demand fluctuations. The increased demand for emergency contraception reflects preparations people are making in response to the ruling, which is expected to make abortions largely illegal in many states.

title: Private Prisons Are a Socially Responsible Investment, According to Bizarre Wall Street Measures
summary: This article critiques the Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) investing framework, particularly highlighting how private prison company CoreCivic leveraged a "racial equity audit" to improve its public image and attract investment despite its controversial practices. It argues that ESG funds often engage in "greenwashing" and "socialwashing," allowing companies with questionable core business models to appear socially responsible through superficial metrics like diversity quotas, while critics assert that these measures enrich consultants and fund managers without achieving real social impact. The article further exposes the inconsistencies and lack of regulation in ESG rankings, showing how companies like Exxon Mobil and McDonald's can receive favorable ESG scores despite contributing to environmental or social problems, and how many ESG funds have higher fees than traditional index funds with similar holdings.

title: JPMorgan Chase Joins Companies Paying Employees Who Travel for Abortions
summary: JPMorgan Chase announced it would cover travel expenses for employees needing to travel out of state for abortions, expanding a benefit that covers services unavailable near an employee's home. This decision follows the Supreme Court's overturning of Roe v. Wade and aligns JPMorgan with other companies like Citigroup, Starbucks, Amazon, Tesla, and Yelp making similar pledges. The move addresses the implications of state-level abortion bans, with many states poised to restrict or ban abortions following the ruling.

title: Here’s how much the Jif peanut butter recall could cost parent company JM Smucker
summary: The J.M. Smucker Company could face a $125 million impact from the massive recall of nearly 50 Jif peanut butter products due to a salmonella outbreak. The recall, originating from the company's Lexington plant, led to a 15% drop in stock price. Production has resumed, and products are expected back on shelves shortly, with heightened food safety measures in place.

title: Despite Shopify’s Stock Split, Investors Should Look Elsewhere
summary: Morningstar analyst Sandy Ward advises investors to look beyond Shopify's stock split, suggesting Amazon shares as a better alternative. Shopify's stock has plummeted significantly, and concerns about its financial outlook and a new share class cementing founder control make it a less attractive investment compared to Amazon, which offers greater financial certainty and diversified revenue streams. Despite a potential upside, Shopify is not among Morningstar's top stock picks due to slowing revenue growth and quarterly losses.

title: After much mulling, Office Depot owner rejects both sale and split
summary: ODP Corp., the owner of Office Depot and OfficeMax, has decided to remain a

title: Avnet, and Amazon Web Services enters into a global strategic partnership
summary: Avnet and Amazon Web Services (AWS) have formed a global strategic partnership aimed at helping Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) of IoT solutions accelerate their time to market. This collaboration will enable Avnet’s IoTConnect Platform to leverage AWS's extensive portfolio of services, creating a scalable and secure platform for application-specific usage. The partnership provides OEMs with pre-integrated and abstracted capabilities, such as device provisioning, multi-layer security, and business intelligence, allowing them to focus on differentiating their connected products.

title: Virtual reality and indoor ‘tree houses’: Truist unveils banking tech center in uptown
summary: Truist Bank has opened a new 100,000-square-foot Innovation and Technology Center in uptown Charlotte, aiming to fuse tech and finance for a better banking experience. The center features virtual reality labs, "tree houses," and collaborative spaces, intending to propel Truist into the future of digital banking despite recent low rankings in consumer satisfaction for its digital services. The bank also launched an "Innovators in Residence" program with partners like Verizon and Amazon Web Services to explore new technologies.

title: Build a data pipeline on AWS with Kafka, Kafka connect and DynamoDB
summary: This article provides a step-by-step guide to building a data pipeline on AWS using Kafka, Kafka Connect, and DynamoDB. It covers setting up MSK, MSK Connect, and integrating Datagen source connector with a DynamoDB sink connector. The guide also details infrastructure preparation using CloudFormation and testing the end-to-end pipeline.

title: Corsair Dark Core RGB Pro SE wireless gaming mouse review
summary: The Corsair Dark Core RGB Pro SE is a heavy, feature-rich wireless gaming mouse offering excellent connectivity and ergonomics. While praised for its build quality, customizable RGB, and precise sensor, its significant weight (142g) and mediocre battery life (20 hours with RGB on) are notable drawbacks, especially for competitive FPS players. The review concludes that it's a great option for those who prefer comfortable, heavier mice for productivity and slower-paced games, rather than twitch shooters.

title: Former AWS engineer convicted over hack that cost Capital One $270m
summary: A former AWS engineer, Paige Thompson, has been convicted of seven counts of fraud for stealing personal data from over 100 million people, including Capital One customers, after identifying and exploiting misconfigured AWS accounts. The breach has cost Capital One more than $270 million in compensation and regulatory fines. Thompson, who also used the breached accounts for cryptojacking, is awaiting sentencing in September.

title: Paige Thompson found guilty in 2019 Capital One data breach
summary: Paige Thompson, a former Amazon engineer, has been convicted in the 2019 Capital One data breach that exposed data of over 100 million customers. The hack involved misconfigured AWS accounts and cost Capital One hundreds of millions in fines and settlements. Thompson was found guilty of wire fraud and multiple counts of unauthorized access to a protected computer and damaging a protected computer, though acquitted on other charges.

title: Bluepeak rebrands from Vast Broadband, expanding internet in Sioux Falls
summary: Vast Broadband, a Sioux Falls internet provider, has rebranded as Bluepeak to reflect its expansion efforts in Sioux Falls and other states. The company plans to build fiber-optic cables to improve service reliability and internet speed for both existing and future customers. Bluepeak currently serves about 8,000 people in Sioux Falls and anticipates construction to continue expanding northward through summer 2023.

title: The Big Interview: Expedia Group CTO Rathi Murthy
summary: Expedia Group CTO Rathi Murthy discusses the company's "Expedia Open World" vision, a new API-centric, modular travel platform designed to allow more flexible integration for partners. She details the challenges of this large-scale transformation while the company is actively operating, emphasizing a "people, process, technology" approach and an iterative, accountability-driven methodology. The article highlights Expedia's move to AWS and their focus on hiring diverse talent.

title: The Surprising Case for Stronger E-commerce Growth
summary: Despite a recent slump in e-commerce stocks and slowing economic activity, Morgan Stanley forecasts continued strong growth for e-commerce, projecting an increase from $3.3 trillion today to $5.4 trillion in 2026. This growth is driven by a permanent behavioral shift to online shopping, increasing penetration in both developed and emerging markets, and technological improvements in logistics and digital payments.

title: Newmark Completes Sale of Moffett Green, Fully-Leased Trophy Campus in Silicon Valley
summary: Newmark has successfully completed the sale of Moffett Green, a 719,037 square-foot, fully-leased trophy office campus in Sunnyvale, California, to CommonWealth Partners, LLC. The transaction, which represents the largest single-asset investment office sale in Silicon Valley history, involved Meta Platforms, Inc. as the long-term tenant. Steven Golubchik and his team at Newmark facilitated the deal, highlighting continued investor demand for prime assets in high-barrier-to-entry markets and the strong performance of Moffett Park.

title: Lululemon Goes Back to Work in Style with Massive New Vancouver Office
summary: Lululemon Athletica Inc. is significantly expanding its real estate footprint in its hometown of Vancouver by leasing close to 120,000 sq. ft of office space in the new Burrard Place building. This deal is considered one of the largest office lease transactions in downtown Vancouver since the pandemic, signaling a commitment by large firms to office spaces despite ongoing debates about remote and hybrid work models. The expansion comes as Lululemon also makes headlines for other real estate ventures and new product releases.

title: Edgewell debuts Gen Z-focused skincare brand, Fieldtrip
summary: Edgewell has launched Fieldtrip, a new clean skincare brand aimed at Gen Z consumers. The brand offers unisex products with luxury formulations under $25, initially sold direct-to-consumer and on Amazon, with plans to expand to Nordstrom and Macy's. Fieldtrip emphasizes sustainability and affordability, aligning with Gen Z's values.

title: Judge Dismisses Class Action Lawsuit Filed Against GoodRx
summary: A federal judge has dismissed a class action lawsuit filed against GoodRx Holdings, Inc. The lawsuit alleged that GoodRx made misleading statements and filed a misleading registration statement and prospectus regarding its initial public offering, particularly concerning the competitive threat posed by Amazon. The judge ruled that the plaintiffs failed to sufficiently plead facts establishing falsity, concrete knowledge by GoodRx of Amazon's plans, or scienter.

title: Oracle’s Database Dominance Eroded by Rise of Cloud-First Rivals
summary: Oracle's long-standing dominance in the database market is being challenged by cloud-first rivals offering more flexible and cheaper options. Companies like Shutterfly are migrating their data to cloud providers such as Amazon.com Inc., moving away from Oracle's traditional database products due to ease of use. Despite this trend, Oracle is still projected to report 4% sales growth.

title: Lululemon leases an additional 120K square feet of office space
summary: Lululemon Athletica Inc. has signed one of Vancouver's largest office lease deals since 2018, securing an additional 120,000 square feet across nine floors at Burrard Place. This transaction signals a strong commitment to office space by large firms, challenging the pandemic-driven narrative of reduced office demand. The new space is located near Lululemon's current headquarters and is scheduled for occupancy in late 2022.

title: Fortinet (FTNT) to Split Stock in 5 to Attract More Investors
summary: Fortinet (FTNT) announced a five-for-one forward stock split to make its shares more accessible to employees and retail investors, with stockholder approval scheduled for June 17. If approved, the stock price will drop from approximately $300 to $60 per share. This move follows similar stock splits by other major tech companies like Alphabet, Amazon, and NVIDIA, aiming to boost demand and potentially increase share prices.

title: Kroger is now delivering in South Florida
summary: Kroger has launched online grocery delivery services in South Florida through a new 60,000-square-foot spoke facility in Miami, which supports its automated customer fulfillment center in Groveland, Florida. This expansion is part of Kroger's aggressive growth strategy in Florida, utilizing a hub-and-spoke network to deliver groceries to areas hundreds of miles from its CFCs. The company aims to compete with rivals like Amazon and Walmart by focusing on next-day delivery, a wide assortment, competitive pricing, and its partnership with Ocado, particularly in markets where it lacks physical stores.

title: Ex-Amazon worker accused of stealing personal data of 100M Capital One customers goes on trial
summary: A former Amazon software engineer, Paige Thompson, is on trial for allegedly stealing personal data from over 100 million Capital One customers in one of the largest data breaches in US history. Prosecutors claim she intended to commit identity theft and profit, while her defense argues she was acting as a "white-hat hacker" trying to expose vulnerabilities in the bank's system. Thompson faces 10 counts of computer fraud, wire fraud, and identity theft, and if convicted, could face up to 30 years in prison.

title: Kohl’s Corp. negotiating company sale to owner of The Vitamin Shoppe
summary: Kohl’s Corp. has entered into exclusive negotiations with Franchise Group, Inc., owner of The Vitamin Shoppe, regarding a potential acquisition at $60 per share. This development comes amid ongoing shareholder pressure and previous attempts to acquire the company. While the deal’s certainty is unknown, an expert noted the buyer might see an undervalued asset rather than bringing strategic advantages to Kohl's.

title: Oracle closes $28B deal to buy EHR giant Cerner
summary: Oracle has finalized its $28.3 billion acquisition of health IT company Cerner, marking its largest acquisition to date and a significant move to expand into the healthcare market. The deal, which involved Oracle finalizing a stock tender offer with 69.2% of Cerner shares, aims to leverage Cerner as an "anchor asset" to scale Oracle's cloud business in hospitals and health systems. This acquisition positions Oracle to transform healthcare delivery through new information systems and addresses the growing trend of big tech companies investing heavily in the healthcare IT sector.

title: With shares of Kansas City’s Cerner turned over, sale to Oracle will close Wednesday
summary: Oracle's acquisition of Cerner Corporation for $28.3 billion is set to formally close on Wednesday, June 8th, following a successful stock tender offer. This acquisition marks Oracle's largest ever and signifies its entry into the healthcare market, with Cerner continuing as a dedicated subsidiary and Oracle pledging to grow jobs in Kansas City. The deal concludes Cerner's status as the largest private employer under local control in Kansas City, a company founded in 1979.

title: U.S. Supreme Court rules Southwest Airlines cannot force wage suit into arbitration
summary: The U.S. Supreme Court ruled 8-0 that Southwest Airlines cannot force a baggage handler's class action lawsuit over overtime pay into private arbitration, exempting them from a federal law due to their involvement in interstate commerce. This decision has potential implications for other companies like Amazon and Uber, as it suggests that various transportation workers may also be exempt from mandatory arbitration for wage claims, leading to more class actions rather than individual arbitrations.

title: Peloton Appoints Liz Coddington as Chief Financial Officer
summary: Peloton Interactive, Inc. announced the appointment of Liz Coddington as its new Chief Financial Officer, effective June 13, 2022. Ms. Coddington brings over two decades of financial experience from companies like Amazon Web Services, Walmart.com, and Netflix. She succeeds Jill Woodworth, who will transition to a consultant role to ensure a smooth handover and support the reporting of FY2022 financial results.

title: Toxic Products Sold at Dollar Stores
summary: A report by the Campaign for Healthier Solutions reveals that over half of products tested from dollar stores like Family Dollar, Dollar General, and Five Below contain hazardous chemicals. These toxic products, some targeted at children, include substances like lead, phthalates, PVC, BPAs, and PFAS, which are linked to various health issues. The article lists 30 specific toxic products found in dollar stores, ranging from children's headphones and toys to food packaging and cooking pans.

title: Teresa Carlson returns to Microsoft
summary: Teresa Carlson has rejoined Microsoft as a corporate Vice President and executive-in-residence, nearly 12 years after her previous departure. Carlson, a prominent figure in government cloud computing, left Amazon Web Services where she led their public sector growth, and then had a brief stint as chief growth officer at Splunk before her recent move back to Microsoft. Her return marks a significant development in her career trajectory within the technology industry.

title: What Does Amazon's Stock Split Mean for Investors?
summary: Amazon is executing a 20-1 stock split, its first in over two decades, effective June 3. The split will adjust Morningstar's fair value estimate for Amazon to $192 per share from $3,850, but senior analyst Dan Romanoff's long-term view remains unchanged, anticipating continued growth in e-commerce, AWS, and advertising. Other major tech companies like Alphabet and Tesla are also planning stock splits.

title: iRobot Unveils iRobot OS - The Most Thoughtfully Intelligent Operating System for the Home
summary: iRobot has launched iRobot OS, a new operating system that enhances the intelligence of its home robots. This OS integrates advanced computer vision and machine learning to offer features like improved pet-centric cleaning, object avoidance, and enhanced voice command capabilities for Roomba j7 and j7+ robot vacuums. iRobot OS is designed to make robot cleaning more effective and adapt to user preferences and home environments.

title: Moderna CEO Joins List of Billionaires Committed to Philanthropy
summary: Moderna CEO Stéphane Bancel announced his plan to exercise 4.59 million stock options and donate the estimated $355 million in proceeds to charity, a process expected to take about a year. He cited a Jesuit background and the principle of servant leadership as motivations, and his intentions align with other billionaires like MacKenzie Scott, Bill Gates, and Warren Buffett who have pledged significant portions of their fortunes to philanthropy. Bancel emphasized transparency regarding these sales and confirmed he will be using a trading plan to mitigate impact on Moderna's stock price.

title: Five Below opening location in East Setauket this summer
summary: Five Below is set to open a new store in East Setauket on July 1st, located in the Suffolk Plaza shopping center. The store will occupy approximately 20,000 square feet next to a future Amazon Fresh, in a space previously housing a Waldbaum’s grocery store. This new location will bring low-cost products to the community and is also hiring staff.

title: Coty launches first-ever Chloé Fragrances e-commerce store
summary: Coty Inc. has launched the first-ever Chloé Fragrances digital store in partnership with e-commerce platform Lazada. The digital store, hosted on LazMall Prestige, will feature Chloé Signature and Nomade lines, along with exclusive launch sets and will be supported by a digital marketing campaign and a live stream event. This move is part of Coty's strategy to expand its premium digital footprint across Southeast Asia, leveraging the growth in luxury e-commerce.

title: Courts Are Not A Weapon: How Corporations Like Chevron Use The Law To Get Their Way
summary: This article discusses how corporations like Chevron weaponize legal systems against activists and critics, exemplified by the case of Steven Donziger. It highlights the extensive legal battle between Chevron and Donziger, who secured a $9.5 billion settlement for environmental destruction in Ecuador, and details the subsequent corporate retaliation he faced. The piece advocates for shareholders, investors, and governments to promote corporate social responsibility and prevent the misuse of legal processes to suppress dissent, emphasizing a zero-tolerance approach to retaliation against human rights defenders.

title: UGA honors companies that hired the most UGA grads
summary: The University of Georgia recognized the top 25 employers of its Class of 2021 at an event in Sanford Stadium. These companies hired graduates across various industries, from technology and finance to retail and healthcare. UGA's Career Center provides resources for employers to connect with its diverse talent pool.

title: Pitney Bowes Parcel Shipping Index Finds US Parcel Volume Reached Record High of 21.5 Billion in 2021
summary: The Pitney Bowes Parcel Shipping Index revealed that US parcel volume grew by six percent in 2021, reaching a record high of 21.5 billion parcels. Carrier revenues also increased significantly to $188 billion, up 16 percent from 2020. The report highlights the continued impact of the pandemic on shipping and logistics, forecasting further growth to 25-40 billion parcels by 2027.

title: Cleveland-Cliffs and TravelCenters of America return to Fortune 500
summary: Cleveland-Cliffs and TravelCenters of America have rejoined the Fortune 500 list. Walmart topped the overall list, followed by Amazon and Apple. The article also mentions other related business news.

title: Interxion pauses plans for $300 million expansion in Dublin
summary: Interxion has paused a $300 million expansion plan in Dublin due to a de facto moratorium placed on new data center developments in the greater Dublin area by EirGrid, Ireland's national grid operator. This moratorium, which could last until 2028, has led to calls for a nationwide ban and has prompted criticism from various industry bodies, despite local council efforts to prevent further data center construction. The situation highlights the growing pressure on Ireland's energy resources from data centers, which now consume 11 percent of the country's total grid-generated electricity.

title: FedEx expands pilot of self-driving trucks
summary: FedEx is expanding its pilot program for self-driving trucks by adding a new commercial lane in Texas, collaborating with Aurora Innovation Inc. This expansion is part of FedEx's strategy to compete with Amazon in autonomous cargo hauling, following successful earlier pilots that completed 60,000 miles with zero safety incidents. The company is actively integrating autonomous technology into its operations to enhance efficiency and meet growing customer demand.

title: Target Shares Plunge, Drags Down Consumer Sector ETFs
summary: Target Corp. shares plummeted after missing quarterly earnings forecasts and warning of higher costs, dragging down consumer sector exchange-traded funds. The retailer attributed the profit decline to unexpected fuel and freight costs and reiterated its commitment not to pass these costs onto consumers in the long term. This downturn also reflects a broader shift in consumer spending from goods back towards services in a post-Covid-19 world.

title: Starbucks Labor Controversy Sparks Discussion About Unionizing and Company Reputation
summary: Starbucks is facing a labor controversy with Starbucks Workers United, which has filed numerous unfair labor practice charges against the company for allegedly interfering with unionization efforts. This situation has sparked a broader discussion about company reputation and the historical context of labor relations, with experts like Robert Josephson highlighting the importance of companies addressing employee concerns to avoid reputational damage. The article suggests that genuine empathy from leadership and effective communication can bridge the gap between management and employees in such disputes.

title: Netflix lays off 150 employees as the streaming service contends with big subscriber losses
summary: Netflix is laying off approximately 150 employees, less than 2% of its 11,000 staffers, primarily in the U.S., due to slowing revenue growth. This move comes less than a month after the streaming service reported its first subscriber loss in a decade and saw its stock value drop significantly. The company is exploring new strategies like lower-priced, ad-supported tiers and cracking down on password sharing to regain subscribers.

title: Starbucks to cover employees’ travel expenses for abortions; gender surgeries
summary: Starbucks announced an expansion of its health care benefits to cover travel expenses for employees seeking abortions or gender-affirming procedures if these services are not available within 100 miles of their homes. This decision comes in the wake of a leaked draft U.S. Supreme Court opinion potentially overturning Roe v. Wade, with the company affirming its commitment to ensuring employee access to quality healthcare. Starbucks joins other major companies in offering this benefit, consistent with its history of advocating for liberal causes.

title: The PG 100: Ranking Top Food Retailers in North America
summary: The "PG 100" report ranks the top 100 food retailers in North America, highlighting an 11% increase in combined sales to $2.275 trillion in 2021. The report discusses challenges and benefits faced by retailers due to COVID-19 and rising fuel prices, as well as significant merger and acquisition activity in the industry. It provides a detailed table with sales, store counts, and top executives for each of the ranked companies.

title: Starbucks to add abortion travel coverage to U.S. health benefits
summary: Starbucks Corp announced it will reimburse U.S. employees for travel expenses if they need to go more than 100 miles from home to obtain an abortion. This decision follows a leaked Supreme Court draft opinion that suggests Roe v. Wade could be overturned, leading to tighter abortion restrictions in some states. Starbucks joins other major companies like Amazon and Microsoft in offering similar benefits.

title: QVC in the digital age: Tech giants like YouTube embrace livestream shopping
summary: Tech giants like YouTube are embracing livestream shopping, reimagining the QVC model from the 1990s. YouTube aims to streamline the existing organic behavior of users seeking product reviews on its platform by integrating live video shopping experiences with influencers. This move comes as livestream shopping has become a multi-billion dollar industry, particularly significant in China, and presents a win-win opportunity for creators and viewers by making the process easier and more interactive.

title: Andy Burke Joins Tishman Speyer to Lead Industrial Platform
summary: Tishman Speyer has appointed Andy Burke as Managing Director, Head of Industrial, to lead its global industrial sector efforts, initially focusing on U.S. acquisition and development opportunities. Burke brings extensive experience from Terreno Realty Corporation, where he managed over 100 industrial transactions valued at over $1.5 billion. This hiring follows Tishman Speyer's recent launch of its industrial property platform and aims to accelerate the firm's growth in this sector.

title: Realogy rebranding as Anywhere Real Estate
summary: Realogy Holdings Corp. announced at an Investors Day event that it is changing its name to Anywhere Real Estate Inc. The rebranding, which will be complete by the end of the quarter, is part of a larger strategy to invest in advances for consumers demanding a more seamless transaction, without directly affecting its brokerage brands' structure or daily operations. This move follows a strong 2021 and a solid first quarter for Realogy, despite a profit decline, and continued expansion of its iBuying arm.

title: USC ISI works with D-Wave to house one of the first U.S-Based Advantage™ Quantum Computers
summary: USC and D-Wave Systems Inc. have launched the first U.S.-based 5,000+ qubit D-Wave quantum computing system at the USC Viterbi School of Engineering’s Information Sciences Institute (ISI). This Advantage™ quantum system, located at the USC-Lockheed Martin Quantum Computing Center, offers academic, government, and business clients access to advanced quantum annealing and hybrid solver services. The system provides a four-fold increase in qubits and enhanced performance, furthering research in quantum simulation, optimization, and machine learning.

title: Global 2000: Berkshire Hathaway Takes Down JPMorgan As America’s Largest Company
summary: Berkshire Hathaway has surpassed JPMorgan Chase to become America's largest public company in the Forbes Global 2000 list, driven by nearly $90 billion in profits. Despite global volatility, U.S. companies like Amazon and ExxonMobil showed significant growth, with Amazon rising to third in the U.S. and ExxonMobil rebounding strongly due to surging energy prices. The article highlights the resilience of top U.S. companies amid inflation and geopolitical challenges.

title: ReNew Appoints New CFO Also Brings in New General Counsel and Chief Growth Officer
summary: ReNew Power, India’s largest renewable energy company, has announced the appointment of a new Group Chief Financial Officer, Chief Growth Officer, and General Counsel to lead its expansion, including into green hydrogen and other clean energy segments. Kedar Upadhye joins as Group CFO, Vikash Jain as Global General Counsel, and Vikram Kapur as Chief Growth Officer, all bringing extensive experience from various top-tier companies. These strategic hires come as ReNew’s gross portfolio has surged by nearly 20% to 12.1 GW, solidifying its position as India's largest utility-scale solar developer.

title: Duke Realty Rejects Nearly $24 Billion Buyout Offer From Prologis
summary: Duke Realty Corp. has rejected a nearly $24 billion buyout offer from warehousing giant Prologis Inc., deeming the unsolicited proposal insufficient. Prologis made its all-stock offer public after more than five months of private overtures. The acquisition would have significantly expanded Prologis's industrial real estate footprint, which already includes over 1 billion square feet used by major e-commerce companies.

title: Summer’s Eve Intimate Skin Care Spa Collection Takes Serum to New Places
summary: Summer's Eve has launched a new "Spa" collection, including an intimate skin serum and a luxurious wash, to elevate daily intimate care routines. The products are formulated with ingredients like vitamin E, aloe, and coconut oil, are pH balanced, gynecologist-tested, and free from dyes, alcohol, and parabens. This launch by Prestige Consumer Healthcare aims to tap into wellness and luxury trends within the intimate care market.
source: Happi | Household And Personal Products Industry
source_domain: Happi | Household And Personal Products Industry

title: Intel engineer, running for Congress, mounts union drive at Oregon chip factory
summary: An Intel engineer and congressional candidate, Matt West, is leading a unionization effort for hundreds of his colleagues at Intel's Hillsboro semiconductor factories in Oregon. The drive aims to address issues like long hours, pay disparities, and job security, particularly for engineers working on temporary visas. This initiative comes amidst a broader resurgence of organized labor in the US and during Intel's push for increased domestic chip manufacturing.

title: Prologis offers to buy Duke Realty in $23.7 billion deal as warehouse demand soars
summary: Prologis Inc has offered to acquire Duke Realty Corp in an all-stock deal valued at $23.7 billion to capitalize on the surging demand for industrial warehouse space. The offer values Duke at $61.68 per share, representing a 29% premium, as Prologis seeks to maintain its growth amid a tight supply chain and increased e-commerce activity from companies like Amazon.

title: Holy-Moly Mortgage Rates Hit 5.64%, 10-Year Treasury Yield 3.12%, Long-Term Treasury Bond Fund Gets Massacred
summary: Mortgage rates have surged to 5.64%, the highest since 2009, as the 10-year Treasury yield rose to 3.12%. This has led to a significant increase in monthly mortgage payments, impacting housing demand. A long-term Treasury bond ETF has plunged, indicating a "bond massacre" for investors who previously viewed bonds as a conservative investment.

title: The Old Tech FAANG Is Dulled, But a New Version Has Promise
summary: Bank of America strategists have introduced "FAANG 2.0," a new grouping of sectors designed for a world facing inflation, war, and geopolitical shifts, replacing the underperforming original tech FAANG stocks. This new version, comprising fuels, aerospace and defense, agriculture, nuclear and renewables, and gold and metals/minerals, has shown significantly better market performance year to date compared to both the S&P 500 and the original tech FAANG stocks. The article highlights the rationale behind this shift, citing energy security, increased military spending, rising food prices, and gold's role as a refuge asset in the current global climate.

title: Tech sell-off pushes Nasdaq to steepest drop since June 2020
summary: A tech sell-off on Thursday, May 5, 2022 pushed the Nasdaq Composite to its steepest drop since June 2020, wiping out hundreds of billions in market value. This downturn was driven by disappointing earnings reports from cloud and e-commerce companies like Shopify, Amazon, and Meta, coupled with investor concerns following the Federal Reserve's interest rate hike to combat inflation. The rotation out of tech began in late 2021 due to inflation fears and escalated with events like Russia's invasion of Ukraine, leading to significant year-to-date losses for many "Covid winner" stocks.

title: Howard Schultz rolls out wage boost for Starbucks workers as union efforts gain steam
summary: Starbucks interim CEO Howard Schultz announced new worker benefits that would be available only at nonunion stores during his first call with investors since returning to the company's helm. This move comes as union efforts among Starbucks workers continue to gain momentum, and the company has faced multiple NLRB complaints alleging anti-union activities. The announcement is seen as a strategic response to the growing unionization movement within Starbucks.

title: Amazon Announces SoCal Expansion, Including 700 Jobs in San Diego
summary: Amazon.com Inc. is expanding its operations in Southern California, creating 2,500 new corporate and technical jobs, with over 700 of those located in San Diego. To accommodate this growth, Amazon has signed a lease for a 123,000-square-foot office space in University Town Center, expected to open in early 2023. The new roles include positions in cloud infrastructure, Alexa development, video game design, software engineering, human resources, finance, and IT.

title: Stock Splits Lead to Split Results in Trading
summary: This article analyzes the impact of stock splits on market structure, liquidity, retail investor participation, notional exposure, trade size, odd lots, and volatility in both equities and options markets. Using data from 61 stock splits since 2020, including a case study on Apple (AAPL), the Cboe team found that stock splits do not necessarily increase liquidity proportionally to the split ratio and can lead to a decrease in overall investor capital exposure, though they do increase retail investor participation. The study suggests while splits enhance accessibility, they may not always benefit existing shareholders.

title: Seritage Growth Properties Signs 123,000 Square Foot Lease with Amazon at The Collection at UTC
summary: Seritage Growth Properties and Invesco Real Estate announced that Amazon has signed a lease for 123,000 square feet at The Collection at UTC in La Jolla, California. This agreement is expected to create over 700 corporate and tech jobs, marking Seritage's largest office lease to date. The Collection at UTC is now 93% leased and will house Amazon on its top two floors, joining other world-class tenants.

title: With interest rates rising, it's time to focus on MANG stocks instead of FAANG, according to Jefferies
summary: Jefferies analysts recommend focusing on "MANG" stocks (Microsoft, Apple, Nvidia, and Alphabet) instead of the traditional "FAANG + Microsoft" group as interest rates rise. They suggest that MANG stocks present a safer investment strategy during the Federal Reserve's monetary policy tightening. This advice was issued prior to a Federal Open Market Committee meeting.

title: With interest rates rising, it's time to focus on MANG stocks instead of FAANG, according to Jefferies
summary: Jefferies analysts recommend focusing on "MANG" stocks (Microsoft, Apple, Nvidia, and Alphabet) over "FAANG + Microsoft" as interest rates rise and the Federal Reserve tightens monetary policy. This shift is presented as a safer investment strategy during an environment of increasing rates. The article highlights the rationale behind prioritizing this particular group of tech giants.

title: Top 10 Growth Stocks by Market Capitalization
summary: This article defines growth stocks and explains how they differ from other investment types, highlighting their potential for capital appreciation and typical reinvestment strategies. It then presents a list of the top 10 large-cap growth stocks as of April 2022, detailing their market capitalization, forward P/E ratio, dividend status, and specific growth drivers for each company. The article also touches on general market performance of growth stocks and factors influencing their volatility.

title: Nasdaq 100 Index: Tech Stocks Lose $1.8 Trillion in a Month Thanks to Fed
summary: Tech investors have experienced the worst start to the year in two decades, with the Nasdaq 100 Index losing over $1.8 trillion in value in April alone. This decline is attributed to a tumultuous earnings season, fears of an economic slowdown, and aggressive expectations regarding the Federal Reserve's rate-hike trajectory, with another hike anticipated next week. Investors are bracing for continued volatility in the market.

title: Why AWS, Microsoft, Google, Visa Are Setting Base In Kenya
summary: Major tech companies like Amazon Web Services, Microsoft, Google, and Visa are establishing operations in Kenya due to its growing economy and increasing client demand for cloud computing services. Kenya's strategic location as East Africa's largest economy and a hub for Fortune 500 companies makes it an attractive market for expansion. This move is driven by the need to meet local data residency requirements and capitalize on the burgeoning African cloud computing industry.

title: Does a Musk-owned Twitter dim Tesla’s star?
summary: Elon Musk's bid to buy Twitter has raised concerns about its potential impact on Tesla's reputation and future. Observers question whether this acquisition distracts Musk from Tesla's core mission and if the controversies surrounding Twitter could negatively affect the automaker's brand and stock performance. While some see potential for new alliances and free speech advocacy, others worry about conflicts of interest and potential harm to customer perception and privacy.

title: Marcelo Affonso and Rebecca Weekly: why we joined Cloudflare
summary: This article features Marcelo Affonso (VP of Infrastructure Operations) and Rebecca Weekly (VP of Hardware Systems) discussing their reasons for joining Cloudflare. They share their professional journeys, highlight Cloudflare's mission to build a better Internet through security, speed, and privacy, and express excitement about expanding Cloudflare's global infrastructure and hardware innovation in a "new golden age of computer architecture."

title: Tax Breaks Cushion Tesla’s Texas Landing
summary: Tesla received approximately $64 million in state and local tax breaks to build its Giga Texas factory in Austin, sparking debate over the efficacy of such incentives in generating promised economic benefits and jobs. The article highlights concerns that communities often give up more than they gain from these deals, drawing parallels to Tesla's Buffalo factory where job creation targets were not met. Community groups and local residents have raised issues regarding the deal's lack of oversight, potential for wage theft and unsafe conditions, and the challenge of local hiring due to language barriers, leading some local lawmakers to question the wisdom of future incentive deals.

title: EEOC: Employer rescinded job offer based on ADHD meds, violated ADA
summary: The U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC) filed a lawsuit against International Paper Co., alleging a violation of the Americans with Disabilities Act. The company rescinded a job offer to an applicant with ADHD because he tested positive for amphetamines due to prescribed Adderall, despite being informed of the medication. This case highlights the EEOC's stance against discriminating based on legal prescription drug use, even in permissible drug tests, when the medication treats a disability and doesn't affect job performance.

title: Walmart expanding its India sourcing to $10 billion by 2027
summary: Walmart plans to expand its sourcing from India to $10 billion annually by 2027. The company is encouraging Indian manufacturers and trading companies to become cross-border sellers on Walmart Marketplace to reach over 120 million US consumers. Walmart is also providing support and resources to Indian sellers, including dedicated account managers, Walmart Fulfillment Services, and advertising opportunities.

title: Procter & Gamble on scaling AI for enterprise
summary: Procter & Gamble's CIO, Vittorio Cretella, highlights four key pillars for scaling AI in enterprise: data, talent, platforms, and trust. P&G utilizes AI across its operations, from inventory monitoring (saving $60m annually) to product innovation and preventative maintenance. The company emphasizes consolidating data into a 10 Petabyte data lake, a balanced internal/external talent strategy, automated platforms for diverse use cases, and fostering trust in AI among middle management.

title: State of Rhode Island
summary: In response to the COVID-19 pandemic, the State of Rhode Island partnered with IBM Consulting to improve its data processing and analytical capabilities. IBM helped the state build a cloud-based data lake, automate processes, and generate timely, data-driven insights to guide public health policies and communications, especially regarding health equity and vaccine distribution. This collaboration significantly enhanced Rhode Island's ability to respond effectively to the crisis and inform its citizens.

title: AT&T: HBO Max has built-in features to mitigate password sharing
summary: AT&T's CEO John Stankey stated that HBO Max includes built-in features to mitigate password sharing, which he termed "rampant abuse," while still being customer-sensitive. This announcement came during the company's Q1 earnings call, where AT&T reported 76.8 million global HBO and HBO Max subscribers. Despite growth in HBO Max usage, AT&T's overall year-over-year earnings declines were attributed to WarnerMedia investments and divestitures.

title: Netflix shares slide after it loses 200,000 subscribers
summary: Netflix shares plummeted after the company reported losing 200,000 subscribers in the first quarter of 2022, its first subscriber loss in over a decade. The decline was attributed to increased competition, economic headwinds, market saturation, and the withdrawal from Russia, leading to a significant drop in stock price and concerns about future growth. Netflix plans to address the issue by cracking down on password sharing and exploring new revenue streams like video games.

title: 17 Power Players Building Blackstone's $280 Billion Real-Estate Empire
summary: This article profiles 17 influential leaders who are instrumental in building Blackstone's massive $280 billion real-estate empire. It highlights their roles in managing various real estate divisions, overseeing significant deals in logistics, residential, and life sciences, and adapting to a volatile market environment. The piece also details their contributions to major acquisitions and the firm's strategic investments in diverse property sectors.

title: A Magic Scanning Pen That is Revolutionizing Language Learning: Youdao Dictionary Pen 3 Global Version
summary: Youdao, a leading AI-learning company, has launched its Dictionary Pen 3 Global Version, an innovative device designed to revolutionize language learning, assist individuals with reading difficulties, and help children learn to read. The pen offers instant multi-line translation, supports various languages including bidirectional English-Chinese and English-Spanish, and features Text-to-Speech technology for dyslexic users. It is available worldwide on Amazon and Youdao's official store.

title: Latest Oracle Exadata servers ascend to the cloud
summary: Oracle has announced the availability of its latest Exadata Cloud Infrastructure X9M appliance in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, marking the rollout of its newest generation of Exadata processors. This new service, based on AMD microprocessors, offers significant improvements in performance, throughput, and capacity without increased costs, allowing organizations to consolidate various database workloads. Oracle claims superior performance compared to AWS RDS and Azure SQL, with the service designed for scalable deployment both on-premises and across Oracle's expanding global cloud footprint.

title: Netflix Reports Loss of Subscribers for the First Time in a Decade
summary: Netflix reported a loss of 200,000 subscribers in Q1 2022, marking its first subscriber decline in a decade, and anticipates losing 2 million more in the next quarter. This decline is attributed to rising inflation, increased competition from rivals like Amazon and Disney, and account sharing among users. The news led to a significant drop in Netflix's share price and negatively impacted other entertainment stocks.

title: IBM Revenue Up 8% on Continued Momentum in Hybrid Cloud Business
summary: International Business Machines Corp. reported an 8% revenue increase in the first quarter, surpassing analysts' expectations, driven primarily by strong performance in its hybrid cloud platform. Revenue rose to $14.2 billion from $13.19 billion a year earlier, beating the anticipated $13.78 billion. This growth reflects the continued momentum in IBM's hybrid cloud business, which saw a 14% revenue increase, highlighting its importance in the company's transformation strategy.

title: Makers of America's No. 1 Selling Chili Brand Launch HORMEL® Plant-Based Chili with Beans
summary: Hormel Foods has launched HORMEL® Plant-Based Chili with Beans, offering a dairy-free, egg-free, gluten-free, and BPA-free option with 22 grams of plant protein per can. This new product aims to cater to plant-curious and plant-committed consumers, expanding the reach of America's No. 1 selling chili brand into the rapidly growing plant-based market. Initially available on Amazon, more retailers are expected to follow, providing a convenient and delicious solution for those seeking plant-based chili.

title: Why Etsy's latest fee increase has inspired thousands of sellers, including its most marginalized, to strike
summary: Etsy's recent fee increase, raising transaction fees from 5% to 6.5%, has prompted over 17,000 sellers, many of whom are marginalized individuals relying on the platform for income, to go on strike. Sellers argue that the increased fees, combined with incentives for fast shipping and customer response rates, disproportionately affect small businesses and contradict Etsy's mission of accessibility. The strike highlights broader concerns about the business model of e-commerce platforms and their impact on vulnerable creators.

title: Netflix Loses 200,000 Subscribers in Q1, Predicts Loss of 2 Million More in Q2
summary: Netflix lost 200,000 subscribers in Q1 2022, marking its first subscriber loss in 10 years, and forecasts an additional loss of 2 million in Q2. The company attributes this decline to increased competition, password sharing, and macro factors, leading to a significant drop in its stock price and a reevaluation of future strategies including ad-supported plans and content spending adjustments. Despite beating earnings per share expectations, revenue fell short of analyst forecasts.

title: How an Etsy founder turned ice cream maker feels about the e-commerce giant today
summary: Etsy co-founder Chris Maguire reflects on the e-commerce giant's evolution from its DIY roots, noting a shift towards maximizing sales over its original playful aesthetic. His comments come amidst a sellers' strike triggered by a 30% fee hike, highlighting the tension between Etsy's growth as a public company and its founding ethos. The article also touches on how other sellers and former executives view the company's changes and its position in the modern e-commerce landscape.

title: Lands’ End is doubling down on third-party relationships
summary: Lands' End is significantly expanding its third-party partnerships, including an on-air promotion with QVC for women's swimwear and a broader presence in Kohl's stores. This strategy aims to boost brand awareness and sales by attracting new customers with similar demographics to Lands' End's existing base, building on the success seen since its spin-off from Sears. The company plans to add one or two new partnerships in 2022, alongside its existing presence on Amazon.com.

title: Anti-aging technology is coming. Here’s how you can be ready for it
summary: Billionaires like Jeff Bezos are heavily investing in anti-aging technologies, driven by a belief that aging is a treatable disease. Companies like Altos Labs, Calico Labs, and Lineage Cell Therapeutics are pursuing biological reprogramming to reverse cellular aging. The anti-aging industry is projected to grow significantly, reaching over $64 billion by 2026.

title: Stagwell (STGW) Enters Next Chapter of International Expansion with Launch of Stagwell Brazil
summary: Stagwell (NASDAQ: STGW) has launched Stagwell Brazil, a new global office aimed at accelerating the company's growth in Latin America and fostering collaboration among its local agencies and partners. This marks Stagwell's second international office opening in 2022, following Singapore, emphasizing its global expansion strategy. Led by Vinicius Reis, the new office will connect best-in-class services in the region and serve global clients seeking to reach consumers in the Latin American market.

title: Walmart Hires PayPal’s John Rainey as CFO
summary: Walmart Inc. has named John Rainey, PayPal Holdings Inc.'s Chief Financial Officer, as its new finance chief, effective June 6. Rainey will replace Brett Biggs and his appointment comes as Walmart focuses on developing a financial-technology venture and expanding its paid membership program, Walmart+. He will also address challenges such as inflation, supply chain issues, and rising labor costs.

title: The Biggest Reveals from Bitcoin 2022
summary: The Bitcoin 2022 conference in Miami highlighted the early stage of Bitcoin adoption, with comparisons drawn to the internet in 1995. Key announcements included Robinhood rolling out crypto wallets and Lightning Network integration, new jurisdictions like Prospera (Honduras) and Madeira adopting Bitcoin as legal tender, and Strike partnering with major point-of-sale systems like Shopify and McDonald's to facilitate Bitcoin payments. The article emphasizes Bitcoin's potential for mass adoption and its disruptive impact on payment processing.

title: LIVEONE RECOGNIZED AS ONE OF 'THE BEST ANDROID MUSIC APPS FOR 2022' BY PC MAG
summary: LiveOne (Nasdaq: LVO) has been recognized by PC Mag as one of "The Best Android Music Apps for 2022," placing it alongside major streaming services like Amazon Music and Spotify. This marks a continued validation for LiveOne, which PC Mag previously called one of the "most complete streaming music services" and awarded its Editors' Choice. The recognition highlights LiveOne's curated channels, smart DJ hosts, and overall slick design as key factors in its appeal.

title: Piper Sandler Completes 43rd Semi-Annual Generation Z Survey of 7,100 U.S. Teens
summary: Piper Sandler's 43rd semi-annual "Taking Stock With Teens" survey reveals a 9% increase in overall teen spending, with females leading in fashion and digital shopping. The survey, which gathered insights from 7,100 U.S. teens, highlights shifting brand preferences, social media usage with TikTok surpassing Snapchat, and evolving social/political concerns including Russia's invasion of Ukraine. It also details trends in beauty spending, payment methods, and interest in plant-based meats.

title: Global Video Streaming Market to Boost in Coming Years –
authors: BlueWeave Consulting and Research Pvt Ltd
summary: The global video streaming market is projected to reach USD 213.1 Billion by 2028, growing from USD 60.1 Billion in 2021 at a CAGR of 19.9%. This growth is driven by technological advancements like AI and blockchain, widespread smartphone adoption, and the increasing popularity of streaming platforms, especially exacerbated by the COVID-19 pandemic. North America currently dominates the market, but the Asia-Pacific region is expected to show the highest growth rate during the forecast period.

title: WarnerMedia’s CEO departs in advance of Discovery merger
summary: Jason Kilar is stepping down as CEO of WarnerMedia just days before its merger with Discovery Inc. to form a new media company. His departure paves the way for Discovery CEO David Zaslav to build his own management team at the combined entity. Kilar, who oversaw the launch of HBO Max and made controversial decisions regarding film distribution during the pandemic, expressed pride in his achievements in transforming WarnerMedia into a direct-to-consumer global company.

title: Investing in esports in the context of recent events
summary: This article discusses the growth of esports, significant investment it has received, and current challenges due to global events like the COVID-19 pandemic and the Russia-Ukraine conflict. It identifies investment opportunities in publicly traded tech companies, specialized esports firms, and esports-focused ETFs, while also raising questions about future growth amidst potential new pandemics and the integration of NFTs.

title: Internet of Things Market Size [2022-2029] Worth USD 2465.26 Billion | Exhibiting a CAGR of 26.4%
summary: The global Internet of Things (IoT) market is projected to reach USD 2,465.26 billion by 2029, growing at a CAGR of 26.4% from USD 384.70 billion in 2021. This growth is driven by the increasing penetration of smart cities, deployment of vehicle solutions, and strong demand from the healthcare sector. Key players like Amazon Web Services, Intel, and Microsoft are focusing on product rollouts and technological advancements.

title: GameStop Soars on Plans to Extend Rebound With Stock Split
summary: GameStop (GME) shares soared by as much as 22% in extended trading following the announcement of plans to propose a stock split to shareholders in the form of a dividend. The company intends to ask for approval to increase its Class A shares from 300 million to 1 billion at its upcoming annual meeting. This move led to a significant jump in the stock price, reaching $203.98 after closing at $166.58.

title: Why you need a total experience strategy to drive CX and EX
summary: This article discusses the growing importance of a "total experience" strategy, which integrates customer experience (CX), employee experience (EX), user experience (UX), and multiexperience (MX). Companies like Lumen Technologies and Fidelity Investments are adopting this approach to enhance both customer satisfaction and employee productivity, recognizing that these aspects are deeply intertwined. The strategy aims to create exponential business value by addressing experiences holistically rather than in silos, despite the current lack of a single, all-encompassing platform.

title: TForce Logistics Expands in Greater Toronto Area, Opens Fourth Distribution Centre in Hamilton
summary: TForce Logistics has expanded its presence in the Greater Toronto Area by opening its fourth distribution center in Hamilton, Ontario. This new 8,140 square foot facility aims to increase capacity for eCommerce volumes and meet the rising demand for expedited final-mile delivery services, providing next-day delivery along the Highway 401 corridor from Hamilton to Niagara Falls. The expansion supports both business-to-business and eCommerce consumer deliveries, enhancing TForce Logistics' integrated network in North America.

title: Fruit + Fiber + probiotics: General Mills unveils Doolies snacks for kids
summary: General Mills has launched Doolies, a new line of fruit and fiber-packed snacks formulated with probiotics for young children, aimed at addressing occasional constipation. Developed by General Mills’ G-Works venture studio, Doolies bars and bites contain psyllium husk fiber, inulin, and Kerry’s BC30 probiotic, designed to balance taste appeal and functional benefits for picky eaters. The products are launching on Amazon, with extensive testing conducted to ensure efficacy and palatability for kids.

title: McDonald’s Linked to Amazon Deforestation in New Report
summary: A new report by Repórter Brasil links McDonald’s to deforestation and labor abuses in Brazil's Amazon rainforest and Pantanal wetlands. The report alleges that beef from illegally cleared ranches was channeled through farms to hide its origin before reaching slaughterhouses that supply McDonald's. European unions are using this report to pressure McDonald's into disclosing detailed risks in its supply chain under a French vigilance law.

title: IonQ Named As One Of TIME’s 100 Most Influential Companies
summary: IonQ (NYSE: IONQ), a leader in trapped-ion quantum computing, has been recognized on TIME’s annual TIME100 Most Influential Companies list for its leadership in commercializing quantum computing. The company was included in the "New Frontiers" category, acknowledging its extraordinary impact and recent achievements, including the introduction of IonQ Aria, the world's most powerful quantum computer. This recognition follows a year of significant business momentum and technical breakthroughs for IonQ.

title: Global Paper and Paperboard Packaging Market is estimated
summary: The Global Paper and Paperboard Packaging Market is projected to reach US$ 298.3 billion by 2030, growing at a CAGR of 3.3% from its 2020 valuation of US$ 215.34 billion. This growth is driven by the increasing demand for eco-friendly packaging solutions and the rise of online shopping. Key market players include DS Smith Plc., Amcor Ltd., and International Paper Company.

title: Consumers Will Increase Gift Card Purchases in 2022, a Fiserv Study Says
summary: A Fiserv Inc. study indicates that consumers will increase gift card purchases in 2022, primarily due to inflation, supply-chain shortages, and their perception of gift cards as an appropriate alternative to tangible gifts. The study highlights interest in both physical and digital gift cards, with birthdays being the most popular occasion for giving, and Visa Inc. and American Express Co. cards being the most popular brands. Promotions are also expected to drive gift card sales.

title: CEO interview: Silicon Labs’ Matt Johnson on balancing breadth and focus
summary: Matt Johnson, CEO of Silicon Labs, discusses the company's strategic shift to focus entirely on the IoT market after divesting its infrastructure and automotive businesses. He highlights the importance of offering complete, application- and software-led solutions for diverse wireless technologies in IoT, emphasizing security and continuous integration for cost, performance, and power reduction. Johnson also touches on the company's approach to manufacturing and capital deployment, including M&A and share repurchases.

title: FedEx Corp. founder Fred Smith will step down as CEO in June
summary: Fred Smith, founder of FedEx Corp., announced he will step down as CEO on June 1, transitioning to executive chairman. Raj Subramaniam, current president and chief operating officer, will succeed him as CEO and president. Smith founded FedEx in 1973 and oversaw its growth into a global package-delivery giant, while Subramaniam has been with the company since 1991.

title: Instacart’s new tech platform lets retailers sell ads on their sites
summary: Instacart has launched Instacart Platform, a new suite of digital services for grocers and retailers that includes fulfillment, insights, and advertising options through Carrot Ads. This platform allows retailers to leverage Instacart's ad tech and data insights to monetize their e-commerce properties, with a revenue-sharing model. The move aims to strengthen relationships with retailers and integrate Instacart further into their operations, particularly for mid-sized and smaller grocery retailers.

title: After nearly a decade in the red, Destination XL posts record profit and sales
summary: Destination XL reported record sales and profits for fiscal 2021, achieving its first positive annual profit since 2012 with net income of $56.7 million and sales exceeding half a billion dollars for the first time. The company also eliminated its long-term debt and revolver, a significant turnaround after nearly a decade of losses and pandemic-induced challenges. This success is attributed to cost-cutting, lease negotiations, and a "transformative digital strategy" focused on consumer research and fit expertise.

title: The Impact of Design on the Employee Experience
summary: Workday's Chief Design Officer, Jeff Gelfuso, emphasizes the importance of delivering seamless and engaging end-to-end experiences for employees within enterprise software, mirroring consumer software expectations. He discusses how Workday is achieving this through simplification, personalization, connectedness, and data-driven insights. The article highlights key design principles and Workday's initiatives like Engage, Everywhere, and Empower to improve the employee experience.

title: Target embraces solar panels, with California store its first 'net zero' building
summary: Target Corp. has announced its first "net zero" store in Vista, California, designed to produce more energy than it consumes. The refurbished store features thousands of solar panels and a carbon dioxide refrigeration system, serving as a model for future sustainability efforts. This initiative is part of Target's broader goal to achieve net zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2040 and source all its electricity from renewable sources by 2030.

title: Starbucks plans to phase out its single-use coffee cups
summary: Starbucks is aiming to phase out its single-use coffee cups as part of a larger goal to cut its overall waste in half by 2030. The company is exploring cup-sharing programs as a primary method to achieve this environmental objective.

title: Electronic Arts Launches MLB Tap Sports™ Baseball 2022
summary: Electronic Arts (NASDAQ: EA) has released MLB Tap Sports Baseball 2022, the latest installment of its free-to-play mobile baseball franchise, featuring Philadelphia Phillies right fielder Bryce Harper as the cover athlete. This release marks the first game from Electronic Arts following its acquisition of Glu Mobile and introduces new features like Champions Tier, Avatar Gear, improved visuals, and a revamped UI. The game is available as a free download worldwide on the App Store, Google Play, and Amazon Appstore, building on the franchise's over 56 million global downloads.

title: e-commerce logistics market grew by 19.9% in 2021 | Ti-insight
summary: The global e-commerce logistics market experienced significant growth of 19.9% in 2021, reaching a value of €441.47bn, despite a slowdown from its 2020 peak. The market is projected to grow at an 11.8% CAGR from 2021-2026, with cross-border e-commerce growing at 10.65%. While Asia Pacific currently leads, North America is forecasted to become the largest e-commerce logistics market by 2026.

title: eBay Ventures Offers Venture Capital To Innovative Founders
summary: eBay Ventures, the venture capital arm of eBay Inc., offers funding and strategic expertise to innovative founders in areas adjacent to eBay's core business. The firm has made its first investment in Norwegian second-hand marketplace Tise, backing it in a $20 million funding round. eBay Ventures aims to support startups that can bring new value, expand business, and provide a competitive advantage, reflecting eBay's "build, buy, or partner" strategy.

title: IonQ to Present Research at American Physical Society (APS) Annual Meeting 2022
summary: IonQ announced its participation in the American Physical Society (APS) March Meeting 2022, where co-founder and CTO Jungsang Kim will be honored for his pioneering contributions to quantum computing. IonQ researchers will present new advances in quantum chemistry simulations, risk aggregation using quantum generative modeling, and general quantum learning of joint probability distribution functions. The company will also discuss application-oriented performance benchmarks for quantum computing, including its new #AQ single-number benchmark.

title: The Importance of Ink Cartridge Recycling
summary: This article discusses the environmental benefits of recycling ink cartridges, highlighting HP's closed-loop recycling program, Planet Partners. It explains how recycling helps reduce plastic waste, supports communities, and ensures the use of quality OEM products. The article also provides multiple convenient methods for consumers to recycle their used HP ink cartridges.

title: Hayward Introduces Advanced AquaRite S3 Salt Sanitization System
