summary: Hayward Holdings, Inc. has launched its advanced AquaRite S3 Salt Chlorination System, which offers enhanced pool control and integrates with Hayward’s Omni automation platform for intuitive management. This new system provides an eco-friendly and cost-effective alternative to traditional chlorine sanitization, featuring broad salt concentration compatibility and Hayward TurboCell® technology for easy maintenance. The AquaRite S3 aims to address chlorine shortages and cater to environmentally conscious consumers through pool professionals.

title: Amazon announces 20-for-1 stock split
summary: Amazon announced a 20-for-1 stock split, following similar moves by other major tech companies like Alphabet, Apple, and Tesla. The article explains that a stock split divides existing shares into multiple, smaller-priced shares without changing the overall value of an investor's holdings or the company's market capitalization. Stock splits are often done to increase a stock's liquidity and make it more accessible to a wider range of investors, though in an era of fractional shares, some of the practical impact is diminished.

title: Rivian is sued for allegedly misleading investors about electric vehicle prices
summary: Rivian Automotive Inc is facing a class-action lawsuit from a shareholder who claims the company misled investors by initially underpricing its electric vehicles, leading to unpopular price hikes that were later rolled back. The lawsuit alleges Rivian concealed that its R1S SUV and R1T pickup trucks were so underpriced they would require rapid price increases after its November IPO, damaging the company's reputation and risking pre-order cancellations. The plaintiff, Charles Larry Crews, cites the swift rollback of price increases and an apology from CEO R.J. Scaringe as "futile attempts at damage control."

title: How A Failed Experiment Led To Bubble Wrap
summary: Bubble Wrap, a ubiquitous packaging material, was created accidentally in 1957 by Alfred Fielding and Marc Chavannes. Their initial attempt to create textured wallpaper resulted in air bubbles trapped between plastic sheets. After failing to market it as insulation, they founded Sealed Air Corp. in 1960, and their product found its true purpose protecting delicate equipment for IBM, leading to its widespread adoption and the company's success.

title: Grupo México de Larrea y Telesites de Slim impulsan cierre ganador de la BMV
summary: The Mexican Stock Exchange (BMV) closed with gains, driven by companies like Grupo México and Telesites, as oil prices receded. In contrast, Wall Street indices ended lower, and oil prices also fell due to investor concerns about inflation, Federal Reserve policy, and the impact of the Russia-Ukraine conflict on commodity markets. The article also details the performance of various companies on both the BMV and Wall Street, as well as the impact on global markets and bond yields.

title: Wide Moat Stock Outlook Remains Compelling
summary: The article discusses the compelling outlook for wide moat stocks, highlighting their historical outperformance, especially in rising interest rate and high inflation environments. It notes that while the VanEck Vectors Morningstar Wide Moat ETF (MOAT) is outperforming the S&P 500 year-to-date, its performance is impacted by highly valued mega-cap growth stocks, which now present opportunities to buy quality at a discount. The analysis emphasizes that wide economic moats protect companies for extended periods, contributing to long-term outperformance with less volatility.

title: Colgate launches $10 ‘premium’ toothpaste
summary: Colgate-Palmolive is launching a new "premium" Optic White Pro Series toothpaste that costs $10 for a 3-ounce tube, featuring 5% hydrogen peroxide to whiten teeth and remove 15 years of stains. This move comes as the company seeks to raise prices amidst rising inflation, following similar price hikes by other major companies like Amazon and Dollar Tree. The introduction of this high-priced product highlights a trend towards premiumization in consumer goods during a period when many Americans are facing financial strain due to inflation.

title: At Snap Inc., Making Augmented Reality Work for Fashion
summary: Snap Inc. is making significant strides in augmented reality (AR) for the fashion industry, with over 200 million Snapchat users engaging with AR daily. Peter Sellis, VP of Product at Snap Inc., discusses how AR technologies, including virtual try-ons and spatial technology, are evolving to enhance shopping experiences, reduce returns, and increase conversions for brands like Prada, Farfetch, and Gucci. The commercial benefits and future product innovations, such as cloth simulation and 3D asset management, are highlighted as key drivers for investment in AR within fashion.

title: Federal Realty Announces Major Overhaul of Huntington Shopping Center in Long Island
summary: Federal Realty Investment Trust is undertaking a $75 million redevelopment of the Huntington Shopping Center in Dix Hills, Long Island. The overhaul includes building a new Whole Foods Market, enhancing parking, installing public seating, and adding new entrances. Construction is expected to finish by the end of 2024, with other tenants remaining open during the process.

title: Target Positions Itself as Benefits Leader With Up to $24 Starting Wage
summary: Target is investing $300 million in 2022 to enhance employee benefits, including raising its starting wage range to $15-$24 an hour and expanding access to health care for its team members. This initiative will make about 20% of Target's team newly eligible for comprehensive health care benefits, with reduced waiting periods and expanded wellness offerings. These changes are part of Target's ongoing strategy to create equity and opportunity, building on previous enhancements like debt-free college programs and permanent Thanksgiving Day store closings.

title: Velodyne Lidar Reports Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2021 Financial Results
summary: Velodyne Lidar announced its financial results for the fourth quarter and full year ended December 31, 2021, reporting significant sensor unit shipments and revenue growth. The company sold over 4,900 sensor units in Q4 and shipped more than 15,000 sensors in 2021, achieving revenues of $17.5 million and $61.9 million for the respective periods. Velodyne's CEO, Dr. Ted Tewksbury, highlighted strategic pillars for 2022, focusing on market expansion, technological development, and operational excellence, expecting lidar to revolutionize various industries with an estimated total available market of $5.7 billion by 2026.

title: KYNDRYL REPORTS FOURTH QUARTER AND FULL-YEAR 2021 RESULTS
summary: Kyndryl Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: KD) reported its fourth-quarter and full-year 2021 financial results, with full-year revenues totaling $18.7 billion and a net loss of $2.3 billion. The company is strategically positioning itself for growth through new partnerships with cloud hyperscalers and key initiatives focused on increasing signings, transforming service delivery, and addressing substandard margins. Kyndryl also announced significant strategic partnerships with major cloud providers and an expanded customer base following its spin-off from IBM.

title: Teladoc to partner with Amazon on Alexa-enabled virtual visits
summary: Teladoc Health announced a partnership with Amazon to launch voice-activated virtual care on Alexa-supported Echo devices, allowing U.S. customers to connect with a Teladoc provider via audio for general medical needs. Users can initiate a visit by saying "Alexa, I want to talk to a doctor," with video visits planned for the future. This collaboration expands Amazon's healthcare initiatives and aims to improve access to care.

title: Amazon, Teladoc Health Makes Basic Healthcare More Convenient And Accessible With New Alexa-Powered Telehealth Calling Feature
summary: Amazon and Teladoc Health have partnered to integrate telehealth services into select Alexa-powered devices, allowing users to access basic healthcare consultations 24/7. This new feature enables individuals to connect with a doctor for non-emergency medical needs, making healthcare more accessible, especially for disabled and immunocompromised individuals. It expands Alexa's utility beyond trivia, demonstrating the potential of virtual assistants in providing practical, life-saving services.

title: Amazon’s India Partner Samara Capital Plans $500 Million Fund
summary: Samara Capital, an India-focused private equity firm and local partner of Amazon.com Inc., is planning to raise up to $500 million for a new fund. The fund will target companies in retail, health care, technology, and finance sectors in India, with plans to close in the second half of 2022. This initiative highlights Samara Capital's continued investment strategy in Asia's third-biggest economy.

title: For Many Consumers Gift Cards Remain Their Preferred Gift, a Fiserv Survey Says
summary: A Fiserv survey indicates that gift card sales remained steady in 2021, with 73% of consumers purchasing the same or more cards than the previous year. Online merchants, particularly Amazon, were the primary beneficiaries. The study also highlights popular reasons for buying gift cards, consumer preferences for digital versus physical cards, and desired future innovations.

title: E-commerce: EBay forecasts bleak quarter as pandemic-driven online demand wanes
summary: EBay Inc. forecasts a challenging first quarter with lower-than-expected profits and revenue due to waning online demand, increased competition, and supply chain issues. The company's shares fell significantly as the pandemic-driven e-commerce boom subsides and consumers return to in-person shopping, mirroring a trend also seen by Amazon. Despite this, eBay's fourth-quarter results exceeded analyst estimates for profit and revenue, though gross merchandise volume and active buyers declined.

title: Warner Music and BlackRock Invest $750 Million in Influence Media, Female-Led Music-Rights Firm
summary: Warner Music Group and BlackRock have jointly invested $750 million in Influence Media, a female-led music-rights firm. This partnership aims to acquire music-rights catalogs from female and diverse artists, focusing on newer, active catalogs rather than established older artists. Influence Media, founded by Lylette Pizarro and Lynn Hazan, plans to work with artists who will retain a stake in their work, and has already invested $300 million in 20 catalogs, including that of songwriter-producer Tainy and hitmaking team The Stereotypes.

title: Target to accept drive-up returns in Twin Cities, other test markets
summary: Target will begin piloting a drive-up return service and allow customers to order Starbucks drinks via drive-up in the Twin Cities and other test markets this fall. This move is part of a broader trend among retailers to innovate their returns processes and enhance the omnichannel shopping experience. The company has also removed its mask mandate for employees and customers in stores unless local rules require otherwise.

title: Yeti to stop selling at Lowe's, part of a wholesale pullback to focus on corporate giving, digital and stores
summary: Yeti Holdings Inc. announced it will cease selling its products at Lowe's Cos. Inc. as part of a broader strategy to reduce its wholesale presence. The company plans to reallocate resources to channels that offer greater business opportunities, including corporate gift-giving, its retail stores, and an enhanced focus on its mobile digital platform. This shift aims to leverage the popularity of Yeti products for corporate gifts and holidays, as well as optimize its burgeoning digital traffic.

title: Inside the $644 billion business of reselling returned items, from electronics to bizarre finds
summary: The liquidation market, which resells returned goods, has grown into a $644 billion industry due to the increasing volume of returns, particularly from online shopping. This sector offers a solution for retailers facing significant costs and environmental impact from returns, with companies like Liquidity Services and B-Stock Solutions specializing in reselling everything from electronics to unusual items. The boom in liquidation is also fueled by growing consumer demand for sustainable and secondhand goods, leading to the rise of direct-to-consumer liquidation stores and refurbished item marketplaces.

title: Thermo Fisher Scientific and Accenture team on their XR journey and delivering 3D content at scale (podcast)
summary: This article discusses a collaboration between Thermo Fisher Scientific, Accenture, and Amazon Web Services (AWS) to develop a 3D management system for Extended Reality (XR) content. The initiative aims to showcase how 3D content can solve problems and impact XR, addressing common pitfalls in metaverse strategies. The core of the article highlights a podcast featuring key figures from Thermo Fisher Scientific and Accenture discussing their journey in delivering 3D content at scale.

title: After delaying over crime concerns, Weyerhaeuser says workers will return to downtown Seattle office
summary: Weyerhaeuser is set to reopen its Pioneer Square headquarters in April 2022, after delaying reopening efforts last fall due to concerns about street crime in downtown Seattle. The timber company will implement a hybrid work schedule for employees. This move follows similar announcements from Microsoft and Expedia, signaling a broader return to office for Seattle-based companies.

title: 3 Lidar Stocks to Buy as Amazon Bet Shines Light on Autonomous Vehicles
summary: The lidar market is poised for significant growth, with the global automotive lidar sensor market projected to reach $2.5 billion by 2026. This article highlights three lidar stocks—Innoviz Technologies (INVZ), Luminar Technologies (LAZR), and Ouster (OUST)—as attractive long-term opportunities due to their innovative technologies, strategic partnerships, and current valuation pullbacks. These companies are actively working to establish themselves as key players in the expanding autonomous vehicle and industrial automation sectors.

title: Radware Acquiring SecurityDAM for $30 Million to Accelerate Cloud Security Services
summary: Radware is acquiring SecurityDAM for $30 million, with potential contingent payments up to $12.5 million, to boost its cloud security services. This acquisition will allow Radware to expand its cloud network footprint, capacity, and service divisions, creating new opportunities for partners and enhancing its competitive product offerings. The initiative includes opening and expanding cloud security centers globally and innovating its cloud security data center architecture to meet growing demand for cloud security services.

title: Oracle gets go-ahead to host top secret Air Force data
summary: Oracle has received authorization to host top-secret U.S. Air Force data on its National Security Regions cloud platforms. This expands Oracle's role in the military sector, allowing it to handle highly sensitive information for the Department of Defense. The company has a history of government contracts, including involvement with the Air Force's Advanced Battle Management System and the CIA's Commercial Cloud Enterprise.

title: Omnicom Scores Big in USA TODAY's 34th Annual Ad Meter Competition for Super Bowl LVI Ads
summary: Omnicom Group Inc. announced that three commercials created by its agencies ranked in the top ten of USA TODAY's 34th annual Ad Meter competition for Super Bowl LVI. Lucky Generals for Amazon and Goodby Silverstein & Partners for Doritos/Cheetos Flamin' Hot secured the #2 and #3 spots respectively, with BMW's "Zeus & Hera" by GS&P ranking #7. This marks a significant achievement for Omnicom agencies, highlighting their creativity and effectiveness in capturing consumer attention during the Super Bowl.

title: Rivian stock surges after George Soros' fund disclosed $2 billion investment
summary: Rivian stock saw a significant surge after news broke that George Soros' fund had disclosed a roughly $2 billion investment in the electric vehicle manufacturer. The investment, revealed via a December 2021 report, contributed to a 12% jump in Rivian shares, although the exact timing and purchase price of the shares remain unknown. This positive sentiment was further bolstered by Amazon's previous investment and contractual agreement with Rivian for 100,000 electric vehicles.

title: Billionaire George Soros reveals stake in Rivian, sells some tech shares
summary: Billionaire George Soros' investment fund, Soros Fund Management, acquired a significant stake in electric-pickup maker Rivian Automotive Inc., purchasing nearly 20 million shares worth approximately $2 billion in Q4. This move was disclosed in a recent SEC filing. At the same time, Soros' fund also trimmed positions in major tech companies like Amazon and Alphabet.

title: Train Robberies in Los Angeles lead to thousands of missing packages
summary: Thousands of undelivered packages are littering Union Pacific railroad tracks in East Los Angeles due to a surge in train robberies, with a 160 percent increase in criminal rail theft since December 2020. This issue highlights a dispute between Union Pacific, which claims lenient prosecution is to blame, and Los Angeles officials, who cite a decrease in reported cases and an understaffed police force. The widespread thefts have led to calls for increased law enforcement budgets and have focused attention on the vulnerability of the supply chain in Southern California.

title: Soros Cut Stake in Big Tech Stocks Before Selloff, Added Peloton
summary: Soros Fund Management significantly reduced its holdings in big tech stocks, including the Invesco QQQ Trust Series 1, Amazon.com Inc., and Alphabet Inc., before the market downturn in January. Concurrently, the investment firm disclosed a new $2 billion stake in electric truck maker Rivian Automotive Inc. and added Peloton.

title: Knowles Celebrates 75 Years Of Industry Firsts And Leadership In The Audio Industry
summary: Knowles Corporation celebrates 75 years of innovation and leadership in the audio industry, from its founding in 1946 to its current status as a market leader in audio components. The article highlights key milestones such as the development of miniature microphones for hearing aids, the groundbreaking SiSonic MEMS microphones, and balanced armature drivers that have revolutionized both medical and consumer audio. Knowles continues to drive advancements in areas like TWS earphones, voice control, and space exploration, shaping the future of how we interact with sound.

title: Two Austin shopping centers with major anchors sell for $189.3 million
summary: InvenTrust Properties Corp. of Illinois has acquired two major shopping centers in South Austin, The Shops at Arbor Trails and Escarpment Village, for a total of $189.3 million. These properties are anchored by significant retailers like Costco, Whole Foods, and H-E-B, highlighting the continued desirability and robust retail market in Austin. The acquisition underscores a strong recovery in the local retail sector, which has seen occupancy rates return to pre-pandemic levels despite challenges in 2020.

title: Can A Vintage T. Rowe Price Fund Ride Rivian, Microsoft And Snap To The Moon?
summary: Portfolio manager Joe Fath is revitalizing the T. Rowe Price Growth Stock Fund, founded in 1950, by investing heavily in new tech companies and focusing on "disruptive change," contrasting with the fund's historical picks like IBM. Despite facing outflows to passive management, Fath's strategy involves concentrated bets in private companies like Rivian, and public tech giants such as Microsoft, achieving significant returns. He remains confident in these high-growth, high-volatility investments, believing their long-term growth profiles will ultimately reward shareholders.

title: Amazon in Pact for Potential Stake in Sensor Maker Velodyne
summary: Amazon.com Inc. has acquired warrants that could lead to a significant stake in Velodyne Lidar Inc., an auto-sensor maker, causing Velodyne's shares to more than double. This move follows Amazon's pattern of investing in business partners, previously seen with Air Transport Services Group Inc. and Rivian Automotive Inc. Velodyne, a key player in autonomous vehicle technology, previously went public via a SPAC merger but had seen its stock decline significantly.

title: MySize Acquires Orgad, an Omnichannel E-Commerce Platform with a Presence on Amazon.com
summary: MySize, Inc. has acquired Orgad, an omnichannel e-commerce platform with global operations, including on Amazon.com. This strategic acquisition expands MySize's business into direct e-commerce selling and is expected to leverage MySizeID technology to increase profitability by reducing returns. Orgad generated approximately $2.5 million in revenue in 2021 and manages over 1,000 SKUs, primarily in fashion and apparel.

title: Velodyne Stock Soars After Issuing Warrant to Amazon to Purchase Shares
summary: Velodyne Lidar shares surged after Amazon.com announced it was taking a stake in the company. Investors are now questioning Amazon's interest in the lidar maker.

title: Sensor Maker Velodyne Lidar’s Shares Surge After Amazon Investment
summary: Velodyne Lidar Inc.'s stock surged over 50% in after-hours trading following an investment announcement from Amazon. Amazon.com Inc. was issued a warrant to purchase nearly 40 million shares of Velodyne, a maker of sensors for autonomous vehicles. As part of the agreement, Amazon will also gain a board observer position as long as its stake remains above approximately 12.3 million shares.

title: Aussie funds exposed to the Meta rout: Charts of the Week
summary: Australian managed funds and popular index-tracking ETFs, including those from Magellan, Hyperion, and Lakehouse, were significantly impacted by Meta Platforms' sharp 26% stock drop, the largest one-day market capitalization loss in US history. This "Meta rout" contributed to new year woes for growth investors, although some losses were mitigated by strong performance from Amazon.com positions within several of these funds. Sustainable funds generally avoided the Meta selloff due to ESG-related exclusions stemming from privacy concerns.

title: Fiserv Acquiring Finxact for Digital Banking Acceleration
summary: Fiserv, a payments and financial services platform, has agreed to acquire cloud-native banking solution Finxact Inc. for approximately $650 million. This acquisition aims to accelerate the delivery of digital banking experiences for Fiserv's clients by integrating Finxact's API-first capabilities with Fiserv's existing digital financial solutions. The deal will enable Fiserv to provide a streamlined path for clients to offer advanced digital solutions to their customers.

title: Weis joins crowded supermarket space in Warminster area. How grocers survive with so many options
summary: Weis Markets recently opened a new 46,000-square-foot store in Warminster, Pennsylvania, entering a highly competitive grocery market. The area already hosts numerous large retailers, and the new store faces challenges common to the industry, such as labor shortages and supply chain disruptions exacerbated by the pandemic. Despite these hurdles, Weis aims to differentiate itself with convenience, value, and community involvement in its expansion efforts in the Philadelphia area.

title: International Funds Stop Fresh Transactions. Is It a Worrying Sign?
summary: Mutual fund investors were surprised when fund houses stopped fresh transactions in schemes offering exposure to offshore equities. This industry-wide decision was prompted by the Indian mutual fund industry reaching its overall investment limit of USD 7 billion in offshore securities, set by the RBI in 2008. While many funds have temporarily suspended inflows into schemes with overseas exposure, certain overseas ETFs may still accept investments as they fall under a separate, unbreached limit.

title: Alphabet brings big stock splits back to market
authors: Jeran Wittenstein and Vivianne Rodrigues and Bloomberg
summary: Alphabet Inc. announced a 20-for-1 stock split, aiming to make its shares more accessible to small investors by reducing the per-share price. This move is also seen as a step towards potential inclusion in the Dow Jones Industrial Average, which has historically been a barrier due to Alphabet's high stock price. The announcement led to a 10% jump in shares during premarket trading.

title: The Warm Florida Sun Is Not Helping Dan Loeb
summary: Dan Loeb's Third Point hedge funds experienced significant losses in January, with the Offshore fund declining 7.6% and the Ultra fund slumping 10%, erasing a portion of their previous year's gains. These losses are partly attributed to the poor performance of some top holdings like SentinelOne Inc, Danaher Corp., and Amazon.com Inc. Despite the setback, Third Point and other activist hedge funds, including Elliott Management and Trian Fund Management, are actively engaging in campaigns in the U.K. market, which is seen as ripe for activism due to its size and relatively cheap valuations.

title: Income Is The Outcome
summary: The article discusses the JPMorgan Equity Premium Income Fund, an income-oriented fund that uses equity-linked notes (ELNs) and options premiums to generate substantial income for investors. Despite underperforming market benchmarks in total return, its strategy prioritizes income generation and aims to reduce volatility, allowing investors to stay invested in equities in a more defensive manner. The fund's co-portfolio manager, Hamilton Reiner, explains how the use of ELNs converts options premiums into bona fide income and how market volatility influences the income generated.

title: At Clean Energy Summit, EVs and SCE Take Center Stage
summary: At the Bloomberg NEF Summit, Edison International outlined ambitious efforts to accelerate transportation electrification, particularly focusing on electric vehicles (EVs) and their supporting infrastructure. Southern California Edison (SCE) is investing nearly $800 million in programs like Charge Ready to deploy EV chargers and offers rebates for pre-owned EVs, with a significant emphasis on deploying infrastructure in underserved communities. Leaders from the industry, including those from ABB and EVgo, concur that EV adoption, especially by fleet customers, is growing rapidly and requires substantial grid investments to meet future power demands.

title: Amazon and Microsoft led the world in corporate purchases of clean energy in 2021
summary: Amazon and Microsoft were global leaders in corporate clean energy power purchase agreements in 2021, with Amazon holding the top spot for the second consecutive year. Combined, the two tech giants procured 12.4 GW of wind and solar power, contributing significantly to a record-setting year for corporate carbon-free energy deals. Both companies are committed to achieving 100% renewable energy for their operations by 2025, with Microsoft aiming for 24/7 clean energy by 2030.

title: Reed Hasting Bought $20M Worth Of Netflix Stock On Dip Last Week
summary: Netflix Co-CEO Reed Hastings purchased $20 million worth of Netflix shares last week following a significant stock price drop after disappointing subscriber growth forecasts. This move mirrors billionaire investor Bill Ackman's recent acquisition of over $1 billion in NFLX stock, both viewing the dip as a buying opportunity. The article highlights the increased volatility, investor concerns over competition, and the company's recent strategic moves like a gaming business acquisition, amidst a broader market correction.

title: 11 Undervalued Mega-Cap Stocks to Consider
summary: This article identifies 11 undervalued mega-cap stocks that investors should consider, defining mega-caps as companies with market capitalizations over $200 billion. It highlights that the recent market downturn has brought many such stocks into buying range, including detailed analysis for Alphabet, Amazon.com, and AT&T.

title: DISH Sets Data in Motion with Confluent, Unlocking the Power of the First 5G Smart Network™
summary: DISH Network Corporation is partnering with Confluent to leverage cloud-native data streaming with Apache Kafka for real-time analytics on its new smart 5G network. This collaboration, using AWS infrastructure, aims to create a central network nervous system, enabling DISH to deploy a scalable and elastic data architecture that enhances performance, streamlines dynamic behaviors, and provides game-changing real-time intelligence for DISH and its enterprise customers.

title: Kornit Digital inaugurates Kiryat Gat ink factory
summary: Kornit Digital has opened a new $25 million ink manufacturing factory in Kiryat Gat, Israel, after three years of construction. This facility, spanning 11 dunams, aims to increase production capacity, meet growing global demand, and improve productivity for the next decade. The company views this as a crucial step towards becoming a $1 billion company by 2026 and supporting the textile industry's shift towards sustainability.

title: Warehouse Giant Prologis to Offer More Peripheral Services, CFO Says
summary: Prologis Inc., a warehouse giant, plans to expand its revenue streams by offering more peripheral services beyond its core rental income. The company, which currently derives 84% of its revenue from warehouse rentals, aims to provide additional services like solar power, forklifts, and logistics technology. This strategy comes amid strong demand driven by ongoing supply-chain strains and a desire to prepare for future crises.

title: Webull to Offer Cboe’s Nanos S&P 500 Index Options to Its Retail Traders
summary: Webull Financial LLC announced it will offer Cboe's new Nanos S&P 500 Index options on its trading platform in Q1 2022, expanding its existing offerings of S&P 500 Index (SPX), Mini-S&P 500 Index (XSP), and Cboe Volatility Index (VIX) options. This initiative aims to serve retail traders with more cost-effective and simpler options trading, tailored to varying investment objectives and experience levels. Webull will also provide free subscriptions to Cboe Streaming Market Indices for real-time tracking of SPX, XSP, and VIX index values.

title: Is chip giant Nvidia going to scrap its $40BN bid for Arm?
authors: Giles Turner and Peter Elstrom and Bloomberg
summary: Nvidia is reportedly preparing to abandon its $40 billion acquisition of Arm Ltd. due to fierce regulatory backlash and little progress in securing approvals. Regulators and customers, including the U.S. FTC, have expressed concerns that the deal would make Nvidia too powerful. SoftBank, Arm's current owner, is stepping up preparations for an Arm initial public offering as an alternative.

title: FedEx and Microsoft announce new cross-platform logistics solution for e-commerce
summary: FedEx and Microsoft are expanding their collaboration to introduce a new cross-platform "logistics as a service" solution for retailers, merchants, and brands. This offering will integrate FedEx network intelligence with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Intelligent Order Management to improve customer engagement, shipping options, and supply chain visibility. The initiative aims to help businesses better fulfill, ship, and service customer orders by leveraging AI and machine learning from the vast data generated by FedEx's daily operations.

title: Plastics produce underground success of Advanced Drainage Systems in Hilliard
summary: Advanced Drainage Systems (ADS), based in Hilliard, has achieved significant success with its plastic drainage systems, generating $1.9 billion in annual revenue last year. The company specializes in stormwater management systems for commercial, residential, and agricultural purposes, and is a major plastic recycler in the U.S., diverting over 510 million pounds of plastic from landfills annually. ADS actively collaborates with organizations like The Recycling Partnership and contributes to local Hilliard initiatives for environmental stewardship and sustainable stormwater solutions.

title: As talent war wages on, Hilton adds continuing education for thousands of employees to its benefits arsenal
summary: Hilton is expanding its employee benefits by adding continuing education opportunities for thousands of its workers. This move follows a trend set by other large corporations like Amazon, as companies continue to compete for talent. Hilton, headquartered in McLean, aims to enhance its benefits arsenal amidst an ongoing talent war.

title: Securities Litigation Team Secures Dismissal of Shareholder Class Action Against GoodRx
summary: Latham & Watkins LLP successfully secured the dismissal of a shareholder class action against GoodRx. The court's decision, issued on January 6, 2022, dismissed all claims, establishing a precedent that damages in Section 11 cases are calculated based on stock price rather than alleged value. The case centered on allegations that GoodRx made misleading statements about Amazon's entry into the prescription discount market.

title: Federal Realty Maps Out Huntington Retail Redevelopment
summary: Federal Realty Investment Trust is undertaking a $75-million redevelopment of the Huntington Shopping Center in Huntington Station, NY. The project will include significant aesthetic and structural updates, such as new facades, reconstructed parking, landscaping, and outdoor seating. A key part of the redevelopment is the addition of a Whole Foods, aiming to reinvigorate the center and provide essential retail services to the community.

title: Costco named MMR Retailer of the Year
summary: Costco Wholesale Corp. has been named MMR’s Retailer of the Year for its efficient business model, strong financial performance, and ability to provide an enjoyable shopping experience despite challenges. The company reported significant sales and net income increases in fiscal 2021 and the first quarter of fiscal 2022, driven by its limited product selection, operating efficiencies, and expansion efforts. Costco's Kirkland Signature brand and growing e-commerce presence also contributed to its strong growth and profitability.

title: Renovations to Give Shopping Center New Stores, New Look
summary: The Huntington Shopping Center is undergoing a $75 million renovation by Federal Realty, which will bring new stores, including a Whole Foods Market, outdoor seating, and new entrances. The project, expected to be completed in 2024, will update facades, reconstruct parking lots, and add new landscaping. Long-standing tenants like PetSmart and ULTA will remain, while BuyBuy Baby, Five Guys, and Applebee’s are departing.

title: Netflix raises monthly subscription prices in U.S., Canada
summary: Netflix has increased its monthly subscription prices in the U.S. and Canada by $1 to $2, depending on the plan, to fund new programming and maintain competitiveness in the streaming market. The standard U.S. plan now costs $15.49, up from $13.99, while the Canadian standard plan rose to C$16.49 from C$14.99. These increases, the first since October 2020 in these markets, reflect Netflix's pricing power as it faces growing competition from other major streaming services.

title: How retailers can meet consumers’ growing demand for sustainability and hybrid shopping experiences
summary: A new global study from IBM IBV and NRF reveals that consumer preferences have shifted significantly, with a growing demand for hybrid shopping experiences and sustainability. Retailers must adapt by offering personalized experiences, transparent supply chains, and agile operations, leveraging technologies like AI and hybrid cloud. While consumers express a willingness to pay more for sustainable products, there's still a gap between their intentions and actual purchasing behavior, which can be addressed through greater transparency.

title: Behind the Scenes With Cigna Ventures: Giving Great Ideas the Momentum To Make an Impact
summary: Cigna Ventures, the strategic venture fund of Cigna Corporation, focuses on improving health care affordability, simplicity, and predictability by partnering with innovative entrepreneurs. The fund invests across three key areas: Health Care Insights and Analytics, Digital Health and Experiences, and Care Delivery and Enablement. Through these investments, Cigna Ventures aims to accelerate Cigna's strategy, bring innovation into the organization, and bring differentiated value to Cigna customers and the healthcare system.

title: Tuvalu: Strikes deal with GoDaddy to manage .tv - ABC Pacific
summary: Tuvalu has signed a new deal with US internet giant GoDaddy to manage its valuable .tv domain name, expecting a significant increase in revenue from the previous US$5 million per year received from Verisign. The .tv domain's value has surged due to its association with streaming platforms like Twitch, ensuring a key revenue source for the Pacific Island nation. The Tuvalu Telecommunications Corporation aims for greater benefits for its people and economy from this new agreement.

title: Tech Moves: Adaptive CFO to resign; Meta comms exec departs; AI vet joins Absci board; new Zymeworks CEO
summary: This article details several significant personnel changes in the tech and biotech sectors, including Chad Cohen's resignation as CFO of Adaptive Biotechnologies, Joseph Sirosh's appointment to the Absci board, John Pinette's departure from Meta, and Kenneth Galbraith becoming the new CEO of Zymeworks. It highlights the impact of these moves on the respective companies and their financial performance or strategic direction.

title: Lululemon Hires Amazon Exec to Lead Mirror as Nike Lawsuit Looms
summary: Lululemon has hired Amazon veteran Michael Aragon to lead its interactive home gym business, Mirror, amidst a patent infringement lawsuit filed by Nike. Aragon, formerly chief content officer at Twitch, will oversee Mirror's development and expansion, reporting directly to Lululemon's CEO Calvin McDonald. This move signifies Lululemon's commitment to Mirror, despite facing headwinds and a legal challenge from Nike concerning its digital fitness technology.

title: Machine Customers Will Decide Who Gets Their Trillion-Dollar Business. Is It You?
summary: The article explores the rise of "machine customers" and their potential to drive a trillion-dollar business opportunity. It outlines how these nonhuman entities, ranging from bound to autonomous customers, make purchasing decisions differently from humans by being transparent, processing vast amounts of data, and prioritizing efficiency over emotional loyalty. Businesses must adapt their corporate strategy, sales, marketing, and data analytics to cater to this evolving market.

title: Marin Software Announces Amazon DSP Integration to Expand Amazon Advertising Solutions
summary: Marin Software announced an integration with Amazon Ads' demand-side platform (DSP), allowing brands to manage, measure, and optimize their Amazon Advertising campaigns within the MarinOne platform. This integration expands Marin Software's offerings to include display, video, and audio ads, enabling advertisers to reach Amazon audiences at scale across various platforms. The expanded suite of tools helps advertisers drive higher efficiency and transparency in their Amazon advertising programs, connecting upper-funnel ad spend with in-store purchases.

title: Smart Water for a Smarter Home: Moen Leads the Way with Industry's First Whole-Home Connected Water Product Suite
summary: Moen introduces the industry's first whole-home smart water ecosystem, the Moen Smart Water Network, which allows consumers to control, monitor, and conserve water throughout their homes using a single smartphone app. The network includes new and expanded smart products like the Flo Smart Water Monitor and Shutoff, Smart Leak Detector, Smart Sump Pump Monitor, Smart Faucet with Motion Control, and Smart Shower, all designed to provide peace of mind, security, and personalized water experiences. These innovations offer automated water security, water usage education, personalized settings, and voice activation capabilities for a truly connected home water system.

title: Amazon adds four locations, thousands of employees in KC area in 2021
summary: Amazon significantly expanded its presence in the Kansas City area in 2021, opening four new locations. This growth included a 1.08 million-square-foot fulfillment center in Kansas City, Kansas, adding thousands of employees to its local workforce. The expansion positions Amazon as one of the largest employers in the region.

title: Don’t Buy BABA. It’s Not What You Think
summary: This article warns investors against buying Chinese stocks, particularly Alibaba (BABA), due to inherent structural risks. The author explains that US investors buying shares of Chinese companies like BABA are often acquiring shares of Cayman Islands-based holding companies, not direct equity in the Chinese operating entity, which offers minimal shareholder protection. The piece cites examples like DiDi Global Inc. (DIDI) and RLX Technology Inc. (RLX) to illustrate the significant risks involved with these investments.

title: Capital One (COF) Settles Class-Action Cyber Lawsuit for $190 Million
summary: Capital One Financial Corp. has agreed to pay $190 million to settle a class-action lawsuit following a cyberattack that exposed customer personal information. The settlement is intended to cover 98 million Americans whose data was compromised. Capital One stated it has fully reserved for the settlement amount.

title: Capital One to pay $190M settlement in data breach linked to Seattle woman
authors: The Seattle Times Staff & News services
summary: Capital One has agreed to a $190 million settlement for a class-action lawsuit filed by customers affected by a 2019 data breach. The breach involved data from approximately 100 million people and was reportedly carried out by a former Amazon Web Services employee from Seattle. The settlement aims to resolve all claims from the lawsuit, though Capital One and AWS deny liability.

title: Gildan Activewear Acquires Yarn Supplier for $168 Million
summary: Gildan Activewear has acquired Frontier Yarns for $168 million in an all-cash deal, expanding its East Coast U.S. manufacturing operation and further internalizing yarn production. This acquisition strengthens Gildan's vertically integrated supply chain and supports its textile capacity expansion plans in Central America and the Caribbean, leveraging Frontier Yarns' existing role as a key supplier. The deal comes as Gildan generated significant free cash flow and strong sales, demonstrating the success of its "Back to Basics" plan.

title: Amazon warehouse workers in New York City refile union petition
summary: Amazon warehouse workers in New York City have refiled a petition to unionize four facilities on Staten Island after gathering enough signatures. This move follows a previous failed attempt and comes amid a broader U.S. labor movement, including successful unionization efforts at Starbucks. The group is demanding the reinstatement of hazard pay and the permanent ability for employees to keep their phones on the job.

title: BD Announces New Distribution and Retail Partners for BD Veritor™ At-Home COVID-19 Test
summary: BD (Becton, Dickinson and Company) announced new distribution and retail partners for its BD Veritor™ At-Home COVID-19 Test, making it available through Everly Health and Southeastern Grocers (Winn-Dixie, Harveys Supermarket, and Fresco y Más). The test utilizes a smartphone camera and app for result interpretation and is among the few at-home tests to automate reporting to public health agencies. This expansion aims to enhance access to reliable at-home COVID-19 testing.

title: Oracle Cerner Acquisition Opens the Door for Deeper Inroads into the Healthcare Data Business
summary: Oracle has announced its acquisition of Cerner Corp for $28.3 billion, marking its largest deal to date and signifying a major push into the healthcare data business. This strategic move aims to solidify Oracle's presence in the cloud and healthcare sectors, leveraging Cerner's electronic medical records expertise and addressing the rising demand for cloud-based healthcare solutions. The acquisition is viewed as a power move that allows Oracle to compete more effectively with other tech giants in the cloud arena while enabling Cerner to continue its transformation and growth.

title: Amazon.com Inc: Report on Aligning Retirement Plan Options with Company Climate Goals
summary: A shareholder resolution requests Amazon's Board to review its retirement plan options to ensure alignment with the company's climate action goals. The resolution highlights that Amazon's 401(k) plan, including its default option, invests heavily in fossil fuel and deforestation-risk companies, contradicting Amazon's net-zero carbon pledges. It suggests providing more sustainable investment options for employees to mitigate reputational risk and cognitive dissonance.

title: Oracle to buy Cerner for $28.3 bln in healthcare sector push
summary: Oracle announced its acquisition of Cerner for $28.3 billion, marking its largest deal ever and a significant push into the healthcare sector. This acquisition gives Oracle access to a vast amount of healthcare data, which it plans to leverage for its AI-based cloud services and to migrate Cerner's software to its own cloud platform. The deal is expected to close in 2022 and contribute to Oracle's revenue growth and earnings.

title: Radnor-based renewable energy pioneer is sold to Fortune 500 company
summary: Community Energy Inc., a Radnor-based renewable energy pioneer, has sold its solar energy development business, Community Energy Solar LLC, to AES Corp., an international energy company. This acquisition will increase AES's renewable project pipeline by about a third to 40 GW and allow Community Energy to accelerate its growth in response to increasing demand for solar energy. Community Energy's leadership will maintain a presence in Radnor while also exploring new climate technology ventures.

title: Oracle to acquire Cerner in $28.3B deal
summary: Oracle announced its acquisition of medical record technology provider Cerner in an all-cash deal valued at $28.3 billion, or $95 per share. This strategic move aims to expand Oracle's presence in the healthcare sector and boost its cloud business globally, with the transaction expected to close in 2022. Oracle CEO Safra Catz anticipates the deal will be a significant revenue growth engine, while chairman Larry Ellison highlighted the potential to reduce administrative burdens for medical professionals and improve patient care.

title: 5 things to know about Oracle after $28.3 billion acquisition of Kansas City’s Cerner
summary: Oracle has announced a $28.3 billion acquisition of Cerner Corp., Kansas City's largest private employer, marking one of the year's biggest deals. This move signifies Oracle's growing push into the healthcare industry, following similar expansions by other tech giants. The acquisition brings together Oracle, an $280 billion company with 133,000 employees globally, and Cerner, valued at $23 billion with 28,000 employees worldwide, notably 13,000 in Kansas City.

title: Amazon silenced criticism of Xi to do business in China: Report
summary: A Reuters report alleges that Amazon.com Inc. quieted criticism of President Xi Jinping's book on its Chinese platform to maintain business in China. This involved scrubbing negative ratings and reviews for "The Governance of China" following requests from Beijing. This situation mirrors cases of other US companies like Apple and contrasts with others like Yahoo! and LinkedIn that have exited the Chinese market due to a challenging business environment.

title: At Waters, a digital workplace strategy pays off amid crisis
summary: Waters Corp. CIO Brook Colangelo's decision to migrate the company to cloud-based productivity and collaboration software before the coronavirus pandemic proved prescient, enabling its 7,000 employees to stay connected and secure while working from home. This digital workplace strategy, supported by a modified Spotify "squad" model, improved the employee experience and allowed the company to handle an increased volume of online engagements and Microsoft Teams usage during the crisis. Colangelo emphasizes thinking like a platform leader, adopting a growth mindset, and obsessing over user adoption for a successful digital workplace.

title: Apple Should Make a Giant iPad as Its Smart Home Portal
summary: After testing Amazon's new Echo Show 15, the author suggests Apple Inc. (AAPL) should develop a larger iPad to serve as a smart home hub. This move would enhance Apple's presence in the smart home market and diversify the utility of its iPad line. The article also touches on other Apple-related news, including COVID-19 disruptions and internal company changes.

title: You could be a landlord for Amazon, FedEx and Walmart with these REITs that net up to a 4.4% yield — you can even collect on a monthly basis
summary: The article discusses the investment opportunity in Real Estate Investment Trusts (REITs) that act as landlords for major companies like Amazon, FedEx, and Walmart, offering attractive dividend yields. It highlights STAG Industrial, which rents to Amazon and pays monthly dividends, and Realty Income, which has a diverse portfolio including Walmart and FedEx and boasts a long history of monthly dividend increases. The author also suggests looking into alternative assets for diversification beyond the stock market.

title: Oracle in talks to buy Cerner - WSJ
summary: Oracle is reportedly in talks to acquire electronic medical records company Cerner for an estimated $30 billion, according to the Wall Street Journal. This potential acquisition would be Oracle's largest ever, significantly boosting its presence in the healthcare sector and providing valuable health data for its AI-based cloud services. Both companies have yet to comment on the reported deal.

title: Governor Kemp Welcomes Rivian for Single-Largest Economic Development Project in State History
summary: Governor Brian P. Kemp announced that Rivian Inc. will invest $5 billion to build an electric adventure vehicle manufacturing plant in Georgia, creating approximately 7,500 jobs. This project, located at the East Atlanta Megasite, represents the single-largest economic development project in the state's history and aims to produce up to 400,000 vehicles annually. The facility, set to begin production in 2024, will also support Rivian's research and development programs and contribute to the expansion of the U.S. electric vehicle industry.

title: Nike, Etsy’s mobile apps were ‘climbers’ this holiday season: report
summary: A new report by Digital Turbine indicates that while Amazon, Walmart, and Target continue to dominate app downloads, Nike, Etsy, Poshmark, and Fetch Rewards were identified as "climbers" with above-average install intent this holiday season. This trend reflects consumers' increasing reliance on mobile apps for shopping, a behavior further accelerated by the COVID-19 pandemic. Retailers are responding by enhancing mobile app features to streamline the shopping experience.

title: Ryder grows warehouse presence near ports with $480M Whiplash deal
summary: Ryder is acquiring e-commerce and omnichannel fulfillment provider Whiplash for $480 million, a move that will significantly expand Ryder's warehouse footprint near key port and gateway markets. The acquisition will add 19 distribution centers totaling nearly 7 million square feet and is expected to improve Ryder's transit times, enabling deliveries to 100% of the U.S. within two days and 60% within one day. This deal follows Ryder's recent acquisition of Midwest Warehouse & Distribution System, further solidifying its presence in strategic logistics hubs.

title: U.S. opens probe into Amazon warehouse fatal collapse in Illinois
summary: The U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) has launched an investigation into the collapse of an Amazon.com Inc warehouse in Edwardsville, Illinois, which resulted in six worker fatalities after a devastating tornado. OSHA has six months to complete its probe, issue citations, and propose penalties if workplace safety violations are found. Amazon has pledged full cooperation with the investigation, as officials also examine the building's structural integrity prior to the disaster.

title: Mesa Airlines adding freighter for DHL service as cargo ambitions grow
summary: Mesa Airlines is expanding its cargo operations for DHL Express by adding another narrowbody freighter to its fleet in early 2022, following a fiscal fourth-quarter loss of $7.5 million. The regional passenger airline aims to grow its cargo fleet to eight to ten jets to improve efficiency and profitability, leveraging the increasing demand for e-commerce shipping. Mesa is also venturing into European cargo service and drone delivery to further diversify its business.

title: Opting for a gift with a personal touch this holiday Christmas? Make sure to order now
summary: Personalized and handmade gifts are popular choices for the holidays, but shoppers need to order them well in advance due to longer creation and shipping times. Companies like Etsy and Framebridge recommend early shopping, though they also offer options for last-minute gift-givers such as "Ready to Ship" items or quick-ship frames. Delivery times can vary significantly depending on the customization required for the item.

title: Healthcare Triangle (HCTI) Acquires DevCool, an Electronic
summary: Healthcare Triangle (HCTI) announced the acquisition of DevCool, an EHR-focused healthcare IT and managed services company, a move expected to add approximately $20 million in revenues. This acquisition aims to strengthen HCTI's leadership in healthcare IT by improving patient care, reducing IT costs, and accelerating EHR deployments, especially for cloud hosting. The combined entity plans to leverage cloud technologies to enhance clinical, operational, and financial performance for healthcare providers and integrate DevCool’s client base with HCTI’s SaaS platforms.

title: Six dead, no hope of more survivors after tornadoes destroy Amazon warehouse
summary: Six Amazon workers were confirmed dead after a series of tornadoes caused a warehouse near St. Louis to collapse. Authorities have shifted from rescue to recovery efforts, with little hope of finding more survivors. The company and Illinois' governor have pledged support, while the incident highlights safety concerns during severe weather.

title: Starbucks workers vote to unionize at Buffalo, New York, store
summary: Starbucks employees at one store in Buffalo, New York, have voted to join a union, marking the coffee chain's first unionized company-owned location in the U.S. This outcome, though involving a small number of workers, is seen as symbolically significant and could encourage further unionization efforts across other Starbucks cafes and companies like Amazon. A second store rejected unionization, and a third store's results are still pending review.

title: Kroger and Ocado to build automated e-commerce site in North Carolina
summary: Kroger plans to build a 200,000-square-foot automated customer fulfillment center (CFC) in Concord, North Carolina, in partnership with Ocado. This facility is expected to open within two years, create up to 700 jobs, and use unmanned vehicles to efficiently process grocery orders. The new CFC will enhance Kroger's e-commerce agility and capitalize on incentives from North Carolina, including a potential $2.3 million reimbursement.

title: Tecnoglass stock plummets as short-seller alleges cartel connections
summary: Tecnoglass stock plummeted over 40% after Hindenburg Research, a short-seller, accused the Colombia-based glassmaker of having ties to the infamous Cali cartel and operating on fraudulent figures. The report details past allegations against the company's founders, Jose and Christian Daes, including involvement with weapon smuggling, cocaine trafficking, and money laundering for the cartel, as well as alleged non-disclosure of related-party transactions. Hindenburg Research, which has taken a bet against the stock, suspects a significant portion of Tecnoglass' revenue is faked.

title: Zscaler Extends its Proven Zero Trust Exchange Platform to Deliver Zero Trust for Workloads
summary: Zscaler announced the general availability of its new Workload Communications solution, extending Zero Trust security to workloads and applications in public clouds. This solution aims to simplify multi-cloud workload connectivity, eliminate attack surfaces, and enhance application performance by moving away from traditional VPNs and firewalls. It provides Zero Trust for cloud workloads across cloud-to-internet, cloud-to-cloud, cloud-to-data center, and intra-cloud communications.

title: Ingram Micro Acquires Brlink, Strengthening Its Partner Ecosystem with New Managed Services
summary: Ingram Micro has acquired BRLink, a leading managed services provider in Brazil, to enhance its cloud services portfolio and strengthen its partner ecosystem. This acquisition positions Ingram Micro as the sole distributor in Brazil capable of offering complete cloud migration services, leveraging BRLink's expertise in managed services, data analysis, and artificial intelligence. BRLink will continue to operate as a business unit within Ingram Micro Brazil, led by its founder Rafael Marangoni, supporting Ingram Micro's growth in the rapidly expanding Latin American cloud market.

title: Amazon Cloud Outage Hits Major Websites, Streaming Apps
summary: A major Amazon cloud services outage impacted several prominent websites and streaming apps, including Netflix, Disney+, Robinhood, and Amazon's own e-commerce site, as consumers were shopping for Christmas. Amazon attributed the disruption to network devices and application programming interface issues, with many services beginning to recover later in the day. This incident follows a similar widespread outage earlier in the year that affected numerous major websites.
source: VOA - Voice of America English News
source_domain: VOA - Voice of America English News

title: Amazon’s Prime Video, apps down for thousands of users
summary: Amazon’s Prime Video and other services, including applications using Amazon Web Services (AWS), experienced significant outages for thousands of users in the United States. The company attributed the disruption to network devices and an application programming interface (API), which also affected its ability to provide timely updates. Other services like Ring security cameras, Chime, and iRobot were also impacted, highlighting the widespread dependency on AWS infrastructure.

title: US-Based Equinix Acquires Nigerian Digital Infrastructure Firm MainOne for $320m
summary: US-based Equinix Inc. is acquiring Nigerian digital infrastructure firm MainOne Cable Co Ltd. for $320 million, marking Equinix's first entry into the African market. MainOne, founded by Funke Opeke, operates three data centers with a fourth under construction, alongside plans for a sub-sea cable connecting Portugal to several West African nations. This acquisition positions Equinix to capitalize on the rapidly growing demand for data use and storage capacity in Africa, while providing MainOne with crucial capital and network access for its expansion.

title: The Future Of Energy: Using Digital Twins As A Strategic Asset At GE Digital
summary: GE Digital is leveraging digital twins and machine learning on AWS to help customers in the industrial sector optimize operations, reduce maintenance costs, and achieve sustainability goals. This approach enables remote monitoring, predictive insights, and streamlined workflows, significantly improving efficiency and reducing carbon emissions. The company emphasizes the importance of simplifying complexity, fostering collaboration among digital twins, and securing executive buy-in for successful digital transformation.

title: Great Outdoors Group and Sportsman’s Warehouse Holdings Cancel Merger Plans
summary: Great Outdoors Group, LLC and Sportsman’s Warehouse Holdings, Inc. have canceled their proposed $785 million merger following an 11-month investigation by the Federal Trade Commission (FTC). The FTC's Bureau of Competition Director, Holly Vedova, stated that the merger would have harmed consumers through increased prices, reduced product offerings, and diminished quality and service. Both companies specialize in outdoor sporting goods, and the FTC found that their competition benefited customers in at least two dozen local markets across the U.S.

title: Market Expert: Fall For Quality, Not Just Tech
summary: A market expert suggests investors prioritize high-quality stocks over solely focusing on big tech names. Mark Mahaney of Evercore ISI advocates for investing in "dislocated high-quality" companies with large total addressable markets and strong innovation, rather than just trading tech stocks. The article highlights the FlexShares US Quality Low Volatility Index Fund (QLV) as an example of an ETF that focuses on quality while managing volatility.

title: Deloitte buys Oracle Cloud specialist BIAS Corporation
summary: Deloitte US has acquired BIAS Corporation, an IT consultancy specializing in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI), to enhance its cloud migration capabilities. BIAS, founded in 2000, has over 350 employees and was recognized as an Oracle Global and North American Partner of the Year. This acquisition addresses the increasing demand for cloud services and follows Deloitte's fiscal year 2021 revenue growth to over $50 billion.

title: Is there a new food market opening across South Florida? What to know about Sprouts
summary: Sprouts Farmers Market is rapidly expanding its presence across Florida, with several new stores opening in late 2021 and early 2022, including locations in Dania Beach, Boynton Beach, West Palm Beach, West Kendall, and Oakland Park. The Phoenix-based chain, which focuses on fresh produce and health-conscious products, aims to grow its Florida footprint to 31 stores by January, supported by a new Orlando distribution center and local produce buyers. Sprouts emphasizes unique healthy products, bulk goods, and a distinct shopping experience, and its expansion puts it in direct competition with established Florida grocers like Publix.

title: Market Expert: Fall For Quality, Not Just Tech
summary: An article discussing the importance of balancing tech investments with high-quality stocks. It highlights Mark Mahaney's "dislocated high-quality" (DHQ) investment tenet and introduces the FlexShares US Quality Low Volatility Index Fund (QLV) as a suitable option for investors seeking quality and reduced volatility.

title: Problems at Redwire (RDW)
summary: Redwire (NYSE: RDW), a space equipment manufacturer, went public through a SPAC merger at a $620 million valuation, despite acquiring its underlying companies for approximately $150 million. The author highlights concerns about aggressive SPAC projections, questionable metrics like a largely cancellable backlog, and an inability to file its first 10-Q, suggesting the company is overvalued.

title: Adopt a data-centric approach to cyber security
summary: This article emphasizes the need for organizations to shift from traditional perimeter-based security to a data-centric approach for cybersecurity. It highlights the importance of discovering and classifying data, implementing a layered security framework, and balancing security with usability. The article also discusses the advantages of cloud-native architectures and emerging AI-based tools for enhancing data protection against evolving cyber threats.

title: What Stocks Are in QQQ? Rebound Likely, Good Long-Term Pick
summary: The Invesco QQQ Trust Series 1 ETF, which tracks the Nasdaq 100, is a tech-heavy fund that experienced a nosedive following the omicron variant news and inflation concerns in December 2021. Despite this slump, the article suggests that QQQ is likely to recover due to its diverse holdings and past performance, making it a potentially smart long-term investment. The article details the top 20 holdings and the industry breakdown of the ETF.

title: The FAANG Market Is Fading
summary: The article discusses the fading hyper-concentration of stock market returns from a handful of large technology stocks, particularly the FAANGs, in 2021 compared to 2020. This shift suggests a healthier market dynamic with less risk for index funds and more opportunities for stock-pickers. While large stocks still contribute significantly, their overall impact on market returns has decreased, resembling a more traditional market distribution.

title: Meta Selects AWS as Key, Long-Term Strategic Cloud Provider
summary: Meta has deepened its relationship with Amazon Web Services (AWS) as a strategic cloud provider, leveraging AWS's infrastructure for research and development, third-party collaborations, and operational efficiency. The companies will also work together to optimize PyTorch performance on AWS, facilitating faster and easier development, training, deploying, and operating of AI/ML models for enterprises. This collaboration aims to help organizations bring large-scale deep learning models from research to production more efficiently on AWS.

title: Amazon's cloud unit launches new chips to take on Intel, Nvidia
summary: Amazon Web Services (AWS) has introduced two new custom computing chips, Graviton3 and Trainium, aimed at competing with offerings from Intel, AMD, and Nvidia. AWS claims its new chips offer better performance per dollar and lower costs for machine learning model training compared to its rivals. This move signals AWS's continued drive to develop its own hardware and intensify competition in the cloud computing and chip markets.

title: AIG Selects AWS as Its Preferred Public Cloud Provider
summary: American International Group (AIG) has selected Amazon Web Services (AWS) as its preferred public cloud provider to drive business transformation, increase operational efficiency, and accelerate innovation. This move is part of AIG's "AIG 200" strategy, aiming to improve core business processes, modernize technology, and enhance customer experiences for its 90 million policyholders worldwide. AIG's digital transformation with AWS began in 2017, and the expanded relationship in 2021 and 2022 will further accelerate their adoption of cloud services.

title: Amazon has floated the idea of buying HubSpot, says report
summary: A report indicates that Amazon has considered acquiring HubSpot, one of the largest public companies in Massachusetts. This potential acquisition would involve Amazon, one of the state's largest employers, expanding its presence through a significant M&A deal. The article highlights related news concerning HubSpot's leadership, funding, and real estate.

title: 20-Year Returns: Monster Eats Apple for Breakfast
summary: Over the past 20 years, Monster Beverage Corporation's stock has outperformed major tech companies like Apple and Amazon, increasing by over 100,000 percent. The company, an early entrant in the energy drink market, has grown significantly, recording $1.4 billion in profit on $4.6 billion in sales in 2020. Monster Beverage is now a dominant player in the energy drink market and has recently been in merger talks with Constellation Brands.

title: Amazon and Apple handed $225 million in Italian antitrust fines
summary: Italy's antitrust authority has fined Amazon and Apple a total of more than 200 million euros ($225 million) for alleged anti-competitive cooperation. The fines stem from a 2018 agreement that restricted the sale of Apple and Beats products on Amazon.it to only selected resellers, violating EU rules and impacting price competition. Both companies deny wrongdoing and plan to appeal the decision.

title: Procter & Gamble Buys Farmacy Beauty
summary: Procter & Gamble has acquired Farmacy Beauty, a cult "farm-to-face skincare" brand, to expand its skincare portfolio and attract younger consumers. P&G aims to leverage Farmacy's science-based sustainable products and D2C presence, along with its existing retail channels like Sephora, QVC, and Amazon. The deal is expected to help Farmacy grow beyond its current $80 million net sales, with brand founder David Chung remaining as an advisor and Mina Chae becoming the new President and CEO.

title: Observing Attacks Against Hundreds of Exposed Services in Public Clouds
summary: Unit 42 researchers deployed a global honeypot infrastructure of 320 nodes to study attacks against exposed services in public clouds. They found that 80% of honeypots were compromised within 24 hours and all within a week, highlighting the rapid pace at which attackers exploit misconfigured services. The research emphasizes the ineffectiveness of IP-based firewalls and the critical need for quick vulnerability remediation in cloud environments.

title: New SAFESKIN* Nitrile Gloves in POP-N-GO* Packs Provide On-The-Go Protection
summary: Owens & Minor has launched a new consumer brand, SAFESKIN*, featuring Nitrile Gloves in innovative POP-N-GO* packs. These gloves are designed for convenience and portability, offering task-focused protection for light, medium, and heavy-duty tasks. The product aims to provide individuals with reliable protection against germs, chemicals, dirt, and messes in various settings.

title: Cannabis company High Tide eyes more acquisitions as CEO channels Jeff Bezos for e-commerce inspiration
summary: High Tide CEO Raj Grover is looking to Amazon's Jeff Bezos for inspiration as the cannabis company plans its largest acquisition to date. Grover aims to build up an online cannabis marketplace, focusing on e-commerce for CBD and cannabis products. He stated that Bezos is an idol and his approach to direct-to-consumer business stems from Bezos's success in changing the world.

title: Online retailer Wayfair looks to hire 200 tech employees for new Seattle satellite office
summary: Online retailer Wayfair plans to hire 200 tech employees for a new satellite office in Seattle. The company, which specializes in home goods and furniture, will begin hiring immediately, with employees starting remotely. Seattle is one of four locations, including Toronto, the Bay Area, and Austin, Texas, where Wayfair plans to establish satellite offices.

title: Medtronic partners with Amazon to bring the PillCam to your door
summary: Medtronic has partnered with Amazon to deliver its PillCam SB 3 Capsule Endoscopy System directly to patients' homes, enabling remote endoscopy particularly in rural areas. This collaboration, which accelerated due to the pandemic, allows doctors to order PillCams through a special Amazon portal, marking Amazon's continued expansion into the healthcare sector and leveraging its logistics capabilities. The partnership highlights the growing trend of telehealth and in-home medical device use, with Medtronic planning to expand its at-home gastrointestinal care offerings.

title: FedEx Opens Phoenix-Area Facility
summary: FedEx Ground has opened its sixth facility in the Phoenix area, a 425,000-square-foot regional sortation center in Goodyear, Arizona. This expansion is part of a larger program to add 14.4 million square feet of sortation capacity for the holiday season, including new hubs, automated stations, and regional sortation facilities. The new facility is located in Prologis Commerce Park at Goodyear, a key industrial park contributing to the West Valley's booming distribution scene, driven by the e-commerce surge.

title: FedEx Sees 10% Rise in Holiday Package Volume to Record Levels
summary: FedEx Corp. is forecasting a 10% increase in holiday package deliveries compared to an already record-breaking peak season in 2020, driven by continued consumer reliance on internet shopping. This volume represents 100 million more packages than pre-pandemic levels in 2019, with Cyber Monday alone expected to handle 32 million packages worldwide. Despite significant investments to handle the volume, the company faces challenges from worker shortages and supply chain congestion, which have increased costs by $450 million in its latest quarter.

title: The Amazon lobbyists who kill U.S. consumer privacy protections
summary: This report details how Amazon has successfully lobbied against or weakened consumer privacy protections in over two dozen states, often by drafting its own industry-friendly legislation. Led by former White House aide Jay Carney, Amazon's lobbying efforts aim to preserve its access to vast amounts of consumer data, which fuels its e-commerce growth and advantages in emerging technologies like Alexa. The article uses internal documents and interviews to expose strategies such as "watering the flowers" to cultivate politicians and using job creation as leverage.

title: Why Sabre is betting against multi-cloud
summary: Sabre, a travel technology company, has entered a 10-year, $2 billion partnership with Google Cloud, committing to a single cloud provider despite the prevailing multi-cloud trend among large enterprises. CIO Joe DiFonzo explains that an initial multi-cloud exploration led them to realize the inefficiencies of managing disparate architectures and the benefits of leveraging a single vendor's full capabilities and engineering mindset. This decision allows Sabre to focus on modernizing operations, decomposing applications into microservices, and integrating AI-powered services by leaning on Google's extensive technological advancements.

title: How Constellation Brands built a better ordering system on AWS
Amazon and Starbucks partner on coffee shop with cashierless technology
summary: Amazon and Starbucks have opened the first of three planned Starbucks Pickup with Amazon Go stores in New York City, marking their first collaborative effort. This new format integrates Starbucks' coffee shop experience with Amazon's cashierless technology. It is a partnership between the two Seattle-based companies to introduce a new retail concept.

title: Starbucks teams up with Amazon for new store concept
summary: Starbucks and Amazon have partnered to open a new "Starbucks Pickup with Amazon Go" store concept in mid-town Manhattan, combining Starbucks' mobile pre-order service with Amazon's "Just Walk Out" cashierless technology. This innovative store allows customers to pre-order coffee through the Starbucks app and shop for food items using Amazon Go's frictionless checkout, with plans for at least two more locations in the coming year. The collaboration aims to offer customers convenience and a seamless experience, whether they are quickly picking up an order or staying to enjoy the lounge.

title: Lehigh Valley warehouse offering up to $28 an hour for news hires amid labor shortage
summary: United Natural Foods, Inc. (UNFI) is pushing to hire 160 more workers at its North Whitehall distribution and fulfillment center, offering wages up to $28 an hour and a competitive benefits package. A job fair is scheduled for November 19, and UNFI plans to include a wellness center, company store, café, video game room, and outdoor pavilion on-site. Other companies in the area, such as Uline and Amazon, are also struggling with labor shortages and are offering competitive wages and bonuses to attract workers.

title: Stock of the week - Rivian Automotive (18.11.2021)
summary: Rivian Automotive, the US electric vehicles manufacturer, had its IPO on November 10th, with shares gaining 120% in the first 5 days before dropping 15%. Despite $0 revenue, the company achieved a significant market cap, briefly becoming the third largest automaker. Comparisons are drawn between Rivian's cash burn and early Tesla, with Rivian burning cash at a faster rate but benefiting from a massive order from Amazon.

title: 3 REITs That Could Be the Backbone of Your Portfolio
summary: This article highlights three REITs—Digital Realty Trust (DLR), STAG Industrial Inc (STAG), and Life Storage (LSI)—that could serve as strong core holdings in an investment portfolio. These REITs offer consistent income through dividends and provide exposure to robust real estate sectors like data centers, industrial properties, and self-storage, all benefiting from current market trends and offering reliability.

title: Credit crunch: Visa tumbles on Amazon ban in UK
summary: Visa Inc. experienced a significant decline after Amazon.com Inc. announced it would stop accepting Visa credit cards issued in the U.K., citing high transaction fees. Amazon is also reportedly considering switching its co-branded credit card to Mastercard, further impacting Visa's stock and contributing to a 20% drop from its July record high. This move is part of broader international changes Amazon has made regarding Visa cards and comes amidst waxing investor sentiment towards credit card stocks due to the rise of "buy now, pay later" services.

title: Amazon to stop accepting Visa's UK-issued credit cards over high fees
summary: Amazon announced it will stop accepting UK-issued Visa credit cards from January 19, 2022, citing high transaction fees charged by Visa. While Visa debit cards and other credit card types like Mastercard and Amex will still be accepted, Visa expressed disappointment and hopes for a resolution. This move comes after Brexit removed an EU-enforced cap on card issuer fees in the UK, leading to calls for government intervention in UK-EU trade agreements and scrutiny of credit card fees from regulators.

title: Instacart Business Model
summary: This article details the Instacart business model, covering its history, ownership, mission, revenue streams (commissions, delivery fees, subscriptions, advertising), and a comprehensive Business Model Canvas analysis. It also examines Instacart's customer segments, value propositions, channels, key resources, activities, partners, cost structure, and a SWOT analysis, concluding on its market dominance despite growing competition.

title: Amazon adds 2 last-mile delivery centers in Greater Cincinnati
summary: Amazon.com Inc. is expanding its logistics network in Greater Cincinnati by adding two last-mile distribution centers. One center has already opened in West Chester, and another is slated to open in Florence in 2022. These new facilities will enhance Amazon's delivery capabilities in the region.

title: Cracker Barrel opening in east El Paso next year
summary: Cracker Barrel is expanding its presence in El Paso with a new location planned for the Eastlake Marketplace, near the Amazon fulfillment center. This will be the second Cracker Barrel in El Paso and is expected to open in Spring 2022, creating over 100 full and part-time jobs.

title: Netflix releases weekly list of top shows by viewing hours
summary: Netflix has begun releasing weekly reports of its top shows and movies by viewing hours globally, a move towards greater transparency in streaming viewership data. This new system breaks out top 10 lists for English and non-English titles, with "Squid Game" dominating non-English TV and "Red Notice" leading English-language films recently. The initiative addresses past criticisms of streamers for selectively sharing data and aims to provide a clearer understanding of success in the streaming world.
