title: BP Expanding RNG Venture with Clean Energy Fuels into Iowa, South Dakota
summary: BP plc is expanding its renewable natural gas (RNG) venture with Clean Energy Fuels Corp. to develop new projects on dairy farms in Iowa and South Dakota. These farms, housing over 30,000 cows, have the potential to produce more than 7 million gallons/year of RNG from methane, with the first production facility expected to be operational next year. This expansion aligns with BP's goal for net-zero carbon emissions and addresses the rapidly growing demand for RNG.

title: IonQ Announces Third Quarter 2021 Financial Results
summary: IonQ announced its third-quarter 2021 financial results, highlighting total contract value (TCV) bookings of $15.1 million year-to-date and updated its 2021 TCV bookings guidance to $15.8 million at the midpoint. The company also reported significant technological milestones, including industry-first error correction demonstration and superior quantum computer performance, alongside strategic collaborations and a strong financial position after its business combination. Financial highlights included $223 thousand in revenue for the quarter, $587 million in cash and cash equivalents, and a net loss of $14.8 million.

title: American Tower nears $10 billion deal to buy CoreSite
summary: American Tower Corp. is set to acquire CoreSite Realty Corp. in a deal valued at approximately $10.1 billion, including debt. The acquisition reflects ongoing consolidation in the data center REIT sector, driven by increasing demand for data infrastructure and cloud computing services. CoreSite operates 24 data centers and generates revenue not only from leasing but also from power and interconnection services.

title: Can Build-A-Bear replicate the experience online?
summary: Build-A-Bear Workshop is launching an interactive online platform called "Bear Builder 3D Workshop" to replicate its in-store customization experience. This move comes as the company observed over 20% online market growth during the pandemic, aligning with a broader trend of consumers increasingly shopping for toys and back-to-school items online. Build-A-Bear aims to meet consumers where they are, betting on the continued shift to digital retail.

title: Facebook Is Under Fire, but It's Also Undervalued
summary: Despite ongoing controversies, regulatory scrutiny, and a company name change to Meta Platforms, Morningstar's analysis suggests that the stock is undervalued, trading at a 16% discount to its fair value estimate. The article highlights Meta's two business segments—its legacy apps and the new Reality Labs for metaverse development—and discusses the potential impacts of regulatory and antitrust risks, concluding that the stock remains the most attractive social-media play in Morningstar's coverage. The company's revenue growth is primarily driven by advertising, leveraging its vast user base and the shift towards online spending, while its wide economic moat is based on network effects and intangible data assets.

title: 26-Year-Old Alex Rodrigues Becomes Youngest Current CEO Of A Publicly Traded Company With $5 Billion Embark SPAC Merger
summary: Alex Rodrigues, at 26, has become the youngest current CEO of a publicly traded company after his autonomous trucking software company, Embark, went public via a $5 billion SPAC merger. Rodrigues, who developed a self-driving golf cart at 19, founded Embark to focus on 18-wheelers, aiming to revolutionize the trucking industry. He is estimated to be worth $500 million and lives a minimalist lifestyle, focused on growing Embark, which aims to fulfill over 14,200 reservations for Embark-enabled trucks by 2024.

title: The Children’s Place launches tween brand Sugar & Jade
summary: The Children's Place launched its new tween brand, Sugar & Jade, in response to the growing $8 billion tween apparel market. The direct-to-consumer brand offers sizes 8 to 22 with free shipping and returns, targeting existing Children's Place customers transitioning to their next style stage. This move is part of broader industry changes with other retailers also expanding into the tween category.

title: 3M inks 410K sf lease renewal for DeKalb distribution center
summary: Industrial giant 3M signed a 12-year lease renewal for a 410,000-square-foot distribution center in DeKalb, Illinois, making it one of the largest industrial lease transactions in the state for Q4. The renewal, with landlord Modiv, will commence in August 2022 and highlights the growing demand for warehouse space driven by e-commerce expansion. The facility is crucial for storing and exporting 3M products globally, with two additional 3M warehouses located nearby.

title: 5 Charts on General Electric's Fall From Grace
summary: This article details General Electric's significant decline in value over the past two decades, from once being the most valuable company globally to its current 75th position in the U.S. stock market. It attributes GE's fall to a deterioration of culture, poor capital allocation decisions, and an over-reliance on its financial unit. The article discusses GE's recent decision to split into three companies (aviation, healthcare, and energy), a move applauded by analysts and seen as a potential catalyst for closing the persistent price/value gap for the stock.

title: Check out Hertz Global Holdings Equity Warrant Exp 30th June 2051's stock price (HTZWW) in real time
summary: This CNBC article provides real-time stock price information for Hertz Global Holdings Equity Warrant Exp 30th June 2051 (HTZWW). It includes current trading data, key statistics, financial ratios, and recent news related to Hertz. The article also provides a company profile outlining Hertz's operations and leadership.

title: Amazon And Other Big Winners In Rivian’s Supercharged IPO
summary: Rivian's anticipated IPO is set to be the largest of 2021, showcasing significant investor confidence in the electric vehicle market despite Rivian being largely pre-revenue. Major stakeholders like Amazon, T. Rowe Price, Global Oryx Company Ltd., Ford Motor Co., and Manheim Investments are poised for substantial financial gains from the public offering. Their investments, primarily made in the past few years, reflect a strong bet on the future of electric transportation.

title: Google-owner Alphabet breaches $2 trillion market cap, joins Apple and Microsoft
summary: Google's parent company, Alphabet Inc., reached a $2 trillion market capitalization for the first time, driven by increased digital ad spending and growth in its cloud business. This achievement places Alphabet alongside Apple and Microsoft in the exclusive $2 trillion club. The company reported a record third quarter in 2021 with $65.1 billion in earnings.

title: BD Tops COVID Testing Market With Veritor Rollout, BARDA Contract
summary: Becton Dickinson's smartphone-based rapid antigen test for COVID-19, the Veritor kit, is now commercially available and has seen a significant price drop due to a partnership between the Biden administration and major retailers. The company also secured a $24.7 million contract from BARDA, potentially rising to $40.3 million, to develop combination diagnostic tests for various infectious diseases. This initiative aims to shore up COVID-19 diagnostics for the long term and streamline testing processes.

title: On the heels of going public, DocGo aims to expand mobile medical services in the U.S. and overseas
summary: DocGo, formerly Ambulnz, went public via a SPAC merger with Motion Acquisition Corp., valuing the company at $1.1 billion. The company plans to use the $158 million raised to expand its mobile health services geographically and through M&A opportunities, both domestically and internationally, including a direct-to-consumer pilot program. DocGo differentiates itself by using licensed/certified EMTs, paramedics, and LPNs to provide cost-effective "last-mile" healthcare services.

title: Publix is getting some new competition. And this grocer isn’t even opening a supermarket
summary: Kroger is expanding its online grocery delivery service into Florida, including Central and soon South Florida, without opening traditional brick-and-mortar stores. This move introduces a new form of competition for established Florida grocers like Publix, Winn-Dixie, and Fresco y Más, focusing on a fulfillment center model with robots for delivery. The article details Kroger's strategy, the growth of online grocery shopping fueled by the pandemic, and how local competitors are responding to this new market entry.

title: Monmouth REIT shareholder revolt leads to $4B sale, $600M better than before
summary: Monmouth Real Estate Investment Corp. has agreed to be acquired by Industrial Logistics Properties Trust for $4 billion after shareholders rejected an earlier, lower bid from Sam Zell's Equity Commonwealth. The all-cash deal, valued at $21 per share, is approximately $600 million higher than the previous offer and has been welcomed by activist investor Blackwells Capital. This acquisition will significantly expand Industrial Logistics Property Trust's mainland portfolio, building on Monmouth REIT's success in industrial properties.

title: Resideo Adds Amazon Smart Thermostat to Utility Programs
summary: Resideo announced that the Amazon Smart Thermostat will be integrated into its Connected Savings® portfolio, allowing utility customers to participate in rewards programs. Built with Honeywell Home Thermostat Technology, this integration aims to enhance grid reliability and promote energy savings. Resideo and Amazon are partnering to drive enrollments in energy efficiency programs, supporting green energy initiatives and helping utilities achieve net-zero goals.

title: AMD shares close up 10% after company wins Meta partnership, announces new chips
summary: AMD shares surged 10% after the company announced a partnership with Meta (formerly Facebook) as a chip customer and unveiled a new range of chips at its Accelerated Data Center Premiere event. This move strengthens AMD's position against competitors like Intel, as the company continues to gain market share with its data center chip sales experiencing significant growth. Additional details about the Meta partnership are expected to be revealed later in the week at the Open Compute Project summit.

title: EXPLAINED: What is Metaverse and Why Facebook/ Meta Thinks it's the Future of Internet
summary: This article explains the concept of the metaverse, why Facebook (now Meta) views it as the future of the internet, and what its potential applications are. It details how the metaverse would work, from virtual interactions and business opportunities to the technologies being developed to build it, while also touching on data privacy concerns.

title: ‘Business needs a noble purpose and a human-centric approach — these core principles revived Best Buy’
summary: Hubert Joly, former CEO of Best Buy, discusses how a human-centric approach and noble purpose revived the company, leading its share price to rise 11-fold. He emphasizes that putting people at the center and embracing all stakeholders is crucial for businesses today, especially in navigating challenges like the pandemic and climate change. Joly argues that the "Milton Friedman doctrine" of profit-first is outdated and highlights companies like Microsoft, Ralph Lauren, and Unilever as examples of successful human-centric models.

title: Google invests $1bn into Chicago Mercantile Exchange as part of cloud migration deal
summary: Google Cloud has signed a 10-year deal with CME Group to migrate all of CME's infrastructure and markets to the cloud starting in early 2022. As part of this agreement, Google has also made a $1 billion equity investment in CME Group. The partnership aims to enhance CME's services, introduce new products, and accelerate technological innovation in capital markets while strengthening Google Cloud's position in the financial services sector.

title: Kroger launches Boost membership program
summary: Kroger has introduced "Boost," a new membership program offering two tiers of no-fee delivery services and double fuel points to expand its online grocery business. This program aims to compete with similar offerings from Walmart and Amazon, providing a tiered approach to delivery speed and a welcome kit worth over $100 to offset membership costs. Boost is rolling out in several divisions with plans for further expansion, building on Kroger's growing e-commerce and vertically integrated delivery network.

title: BJ's Wholesale chain plans Middle Tennessee expansion
summary: BJ's Wholesale Club, based in Westborough, MA, has announced its plans for expansion into Tennessee, specifically targeting Middle Tennessee. The retail chain intends to open a new location in La Vergne, marking its entry into the Nashville business journal's coverage area. This expansion signifies the company's growth strategy into new regional markets.

title: Amazon buys Robinson Ranch land, reveals timeline for new warehouse
summary: Amazon has purchased the Robinson Ranch land in Round Rock for a new warehouse and revealed its timeline. The e-commerce giant closed on the land in late October after previously submitting an application to the city to rezone and annex the site. This move contributes to Amazon's growing presence in the Austin metro, where it is nearing 12,000 employees.

title: Focus: Amazon takes another swipe at union as Alabama rematch looms
summary: Amazon is intensifying its anti-union campaign in Bessemer, Alabama, ahead of a potential second union vote after its initial victory was challenged. The company is using mandatory meetings, bathroom stall posters, and flying in staff to discourage unionization, while the RWDSU union is stepping up its organizing efforts, including home visits. Both sides are employing aggressive tactics as the stakes for union representation at Amazon's U.S. facilities remain high.

title: Trii ofrece gratis 1.500 transacciones del fondo bursátil Hcolsel de Global X en la bolsa
summary: Trii is offering 1,500 free transactions for the Hcolsel ETF from Global X on the Colombian Stock Exchange, along with cashbacks and referral codes. This initiative follows the recent authorization for Trii to allow trading of international stocks in Colombia, including major US and Chilean companies. The Hcolsel ETF itself is composed of significant Colombian companies like Ecopetrol and Bancolombia.

title: Kroger is taking on Publix in Florida without opening a single grocery store — and building a blueprint for its future
summary: Kroger is entering the Florida market using a robot-powered warehouse and delivery service, rather than traditional grocery stores, to compete with entrenched rivals like Publix. This strategy aims to make e-commerce a more profitable venture for the country's largest supermarket operator and serve as a blueprint for expansion into other new markets like the Northeast. Despite the high capital investment, Kroger aims to leverage this model to gain market share by offering a distinct delivery-focused service.

title: QVC was ahead of its time
summary: The article argues that QVC was ahead of its time, comparing its transparent selling approach to the "shoppable" videos on platforms like Instagram and TikTok today. It suggests that while social media often blurs the lines between content and commerce, the direct sales pitches of QVC and its modern counterparts offer a refreshing transparency, creating a sense of agency for shoppers. The author highlights the concept of "parasocial relationships" fostered by QVC hosts and influencers as a key to their selling success.

title: Lovesac partners with Amazon Prime Video in launch of Sactionals StealthTech Sound + Charge
summary: The Lovesac Company has launched its Sactionals StealthTech Sound + Charge, an innovative home furnishing that seamlessly integrates immersive surround sound by Harman Kardon and wireless charging into its adaptable Sactionals platform. This system aims to provide a superior audio experience without the clutter of visible speakers and wires, adapting to various configurations and fabric choices. Lovesac founder and CEO Shawn Nelson highlights the system's ability to offer a personalized and high-quality surround sound experience for different lifestyles.

title: Illumina Supports Canada's Nationwide COVID-19 Genome Sequencing Initiative
summary: Illumina announced its world-class sequencing and bioinformatics solutions are being used by HostSeq, part of the Canadian COVID-19 Genomics Network (CanCOGeN), to identify biomarkers and support novel therapeutics for COVID-19. The initiative involves sequencing the genomes of up to 10,000 patients in Canada, utilizing Illumina Connected Analytics (ICA) for secure data sharing among researchers. Illumina also supports VirusSeq, another national initiative sequencing SARS-CoV-2 viral genomes to track transmission trends and identify evolving viral characteristics.

title: Monthly Market Wrap - October 2021
summary: The October 2021 market wrap highlights a month of economic observations including rising inflation, the Federal Reserve's anticipated tapering, and varied performance across domestic and international equities. It also covers positive trends in alternative investments and the increasing integration of ESG factors into investment strategies. The report details specific market indices and economic indicators, providing a comprehensive overview of the financial landscape during the month.

title: Amazon Launches FamilyFlex to Give Front-line Employees Flexibility and Support and to Help Parents Transition Back to the Workplace
summary: Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN) has launched FamilyFlex, a new program designed to provide front-line employees with greater flexibility and comprehensive benefits, particularly to help parents re-enter the workforce. The program includes options like shift swapping, custom schedules, Anytime Shifts, and Anytime Pay, alongside extensive benefits such as parental leave, childcare resources, mental health support, and adoption assistance. This initiative aims to address the challenges faced by working families and support employees in balancing their work and personal lives.

title: Strategy Analytics: Ring, Nest, and Arlo Remain Among the Leaders in the Smart Home Camera Market
summary: Strategy Analytics reports that Ring, Nest, and Arlo continue to lead the smart home camera market, but a shift towards software-centric business models is underway. The report suggests that hardware-first models are becoming unsustainable, with companies like Amazon and Google, who are already investing in software, set to further dominate the market. Future success in this sector will depend on advanced software and services rather than just hardware specifications.

title: Amazon.com Inc. leases new shipping facility short walk from monster Mt. Juliet hub
summary: Amazon.com Inc. has leased a new 610,000-square-foot shipping facility at 23 Athlete's Way in Mt. Juliet, Tennessee. This new facility is located near Amazon's existing large shipping hub that opened recently. The building was constructed speculatively by Panattoni Development Co.

title: Lovett Industrial completes first 3 Houston-area warehouses, including 2 for Amazon
summary: Lovett Industrial has completed its first three warehouses in the Houston area, two of which are occupied by Amazon, including the 99 North Logistics Park in Spring. This development highlights the growth of the industrial real estate market in Houston, with a new company co-owned by Frank Liu capitalizing on this trend.

title: JBG Smith to buy Union Market property as company swings back to profit
summary: JBG Smith announced its intention to acquire a significant property near Union Market, coinciding with the company reporting quarterly net income for the first time in over a year. The acquired property, "The Batley," is an 11-story apartment building with retail space. This move signals a positive financial turnaround for JBG Smith.

title: Amazon wants to open a new office building in Jersey City
summary: Amazon is reportedly close to a deal for a significant office space expansion in Jersey City, New Jersey, seeking roughly 400,000 square feet in the Harborside 1 building. This move indicates Amazon's continued growth within the New York City region, despite the earlier collapse of its second headquarters plan in Queens. The e-commerce giant has also been expanding its presence in Manhattan with recent lease agreements and property purchases.

title: MakeMyTrip and Amazon Pay form strategic tie-up to offer travel services
summary: MakeMyTrip India and Amazon Pay have announced a strategic long-term partnership to offer travel services on Amazon.in, including its mobile apps and websites. This alliance will allow MakeMyTrip to extend its distribution to Amazon Pay's large user base, particularly in smaller towns, and accelerate online booking for travel services. For Amazon Pay, the partnership aims to provide a convenient experience and greater value to its customers by offering access to MakeMyTrip's travel services.

title: Ecobee acquired by generator company Generac for $770 million
summary: Generac Holdings has acquired Toronto-based smart home thermostat company Ecobee for $770 million, with the deal expected to close in the fourth quarter. Ecobee's CEO and founder, Stuart Lombard, will continue in his role, and the company will operate as a subsidiary of Generac, expanding its Toronto office. This acquisition combines Ecobee's smart home technology with Generac's energy management solutions, aiming to create a comprehensive home energy ecosystem.

title: Smart thermostat pioneer ecobee, facing growing threats from Amazon, sells to U.S. generator maker for up to $770-million
summary: Ecobee Inc., a Toronto-based smart thermostat pioneer, has been sold to U.S. generator maker Generac Holdings Inc. for up to US$770-million. This acquisition comes as Amazon, previously an investor and partner, is becoming a direct competitor with its own smart thermostat. Generac aims to integrate ecobee into its strategy of turning buildings into "microgrids" focused on energy management and conservation.

title: Will same-day deliver holiday cheer for Abercrombie & Fitch?
summary: Abercrombie & Fitch Co. has launched same-day delivery across its entire U.S. store fleet, including its Abercrombie & Fitch, Abercrombie Kids, Hollister, and Gilly Hicks banners, through partnerships with Uber, Shipt, Postmates, Roadie, and Delivery Solutions. This initiative aims to diversify its carrier base and enhance its final mile delivery capacity, especially as it positions more inventory in stores to fulfill e-commerce orders amid supply chain constraints. The new service costs $10, making it more affordable than next-day and two-day delivery options and complementing existing omnichannel solutions

title: Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger’s “insane” plan to restore the company’s glory days
summary: Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger is implementing an "insane" and ambitious plan to regain the company's market leadership. This involves massive capital expenditures between $25 billion and $28 billion annually, along with $15 billion in R&D, to improve technology and capacity, especially in foundry business. The strategy aims for performance parity by 2024 and industry leadership by 2025, a bold move given Intel's recent struggles against competitors like Apple and ARM-based chips.

title: Abercrombie & Fitch customers can now get same-day delivery in CT
summary: Abercrombie & Fitch is launching a same-day delivery service across all its U.S. stores, including locations in Connecticut, for a $10 fee. This initiative is a permanent effort to serve customers better and is not a response to current staffing or supply chain issues. The retailer has partnered with several delivery services to offer this option, which is seen as a strategic move to reposition the brand and provide convenience, especially heading into the holiday season.

title: Amazon Stake in Rivian Disclosed as 20%
summary: Amazon.com Inc. has disclosed a 20% ownership stake in electric vehicle maker Rivian Automotive Inc., with a carrying value of $3.8 billion as of September 30. This investment highlights Amazon's significant commitment to Rivian, with an order placed for 100,000 battery-powered delivery vans. Rivian, also backed by Ford Motor Co., is preparing for an IPO with an $80 billion valuation target, despite an anticipated quarterly loss as it ramps up production of its R1T pickup.

title: Amazon reveals 20% stake in electric-vehicle maker Rivian
summary: Amazon disclosed a 20% ownership stake in electric-vehicle maker Rivian Automotive as of September 30, 2021, with a carrying value of $3.8 billion. The disclosure came ahead of Rivian's expected IPO in November, highlighting the close ties between the two companies. Amazon has contracted Rivian to produce 100,000 electric last-mile delivery vehicles by 2030, with 10,000 expected on the road by next year.

title: Apple and Amazon Stock Dives Set to Erase $200 Billion in Value
summary: Apple (AAPL) and Amazon (AMZN) are expected to see their combined market valuation drop by over $200 billion when markets open Friday after both companies reported disappointing earnings. Apple's revenue missed expectations due to supply constraints, while Amazon's revenue forecast was below consensus and it warned of high costs impacting holiday quarter profits.

title: A sea of opportunities in ASEAN’s post-pandemic future
summary: Despite short-term negative investor sentiment due to recurrent COVID-19 waves, ASEAN's long-term fundamentals remain strong. The region is poised for growth through enhanced regional integration, a booming digital economy, and increasing focus on green infrastructure. These factors suggest a promising post-pandemic recovery and new investment opportunities.

title: Verizon + Amazon’s Project Kuiper Now Involved In A Strategic Collaboration
summary: Verizon Communications Inc. and Amazon’s Project Kuiper have formed a strategic collaboration to provide connectivity solutions to unserved and underserved communities globally. This partnership aims to combine Project Kuiper's LEO satellite system with Verizon's wireless technology to expand data networks and offer new connectivity solutions across various industries. Both companies are working together to define technical requirements and accelerate the benefits of wireless connectivity for a wider range of customers.

title: Electrofuels Innovator Infinium Announces $69M in New Funding to Accelerate Production of Groundbreaking Ultra-Low Carbon Fuels for the Transportation Industry
summary: Infinium, a leader in electrofuels production, announced it has closed a $69 million funding round led by Amazon's Climate Pledge Fund and NextEra Energy Resources, LLC. This funding will accelerate the production of ultra-low carbon electrofuels, which can seamlessly replace traditional jet fuel and diesel in existing transportation infrastructure. The investment aims to help decarbonize the transportation sector and meet critical carbon reduction goals for companies like Amazon.

title: Genius Brands Announces Transformational Acquisition of WOW! Unlimited Media Inc., Creating a Global Animation & Digital Media Powerhouse
summary: Genius Brands International, Inc. announced its acquisition of WOW! Unlimited Media Inc. for approximately US$53 million in cash and stock, creating a global animation and digital media powerhouse. This acquisition is expected to grow Genius Brands' pro-forma revenues by over 1100%, add a robust pipeline and over $62 million in secured future revenue from top clients, and expand its audience into teens and young adults through WOW!'s extensive social media footprint, including the Channel Frederator Network. Michael Hirsh, CEO of WOW!, will join the Genius Brands Board of Directors, and the deal is anticipated to generate significant financial benefits and synergies through new IP monetization and cost savings.

title: You can finally buy rapid at-home COVID-19 tests on Amazon
summary: Becton Dickinson and Co. (BD) has started selling its rapid Veritor COVID-19 antigen test on Amazon, joining Intrivo’s On/Go test. Both tests utilize an app for guidance and aim to make at-home testing more accessible and user-friendly. These developments, along with recent FDA approvals and government initiatives, are expected to increase the availability of affordable rapid tests to help control the pandemic.

title: Silicon Valley Battery Veteran Ronnie Tao Joins Amprius Technologies As Vice President Of Business Development
summary: Amprius Technologies, Inc. announced the appointment of Ronnie Tao as Vice President of Business Development. Tao brings extensive experience from companies like Sony Electronics and Amazon, and will focus on expanding Amprius's market reach for its high-energy density lithium-ion batteries. This strategic hire aims to capitalize on increasing commercial opportunities for their Silicon Nanowire anode battery platform.

title: BD Begins Shipments Of First Smartphone Interpreted Over-The-Counter Rapid COVID-19 Test
summary: BD (Becton, Dickinson and Company) has started shipping its first over-the-counter rapid COVID-19 antigen test that uses smartphone computer vision technology to interpret results. The BD Veritor™ At-Home COVID-19 Test is now available on Amazon.com and addresses common at-home testing challenges with definitive digital results, step-by-step app instructions, and automated reporting to public health agencies. This test aims to make COVID-19 testing faster, easier, and more reliable for at-home use.

title: Navitas Semiconductor Goes Public With $1.7B Valuation
summary: Navitas Semiconductor went public on October 20 under the symbol "NVTS" with a market value of roughly $2 billion, having completed a reverse merger with Live Oak Acquisition Corp. II. The company, which develops gallium nitride semiconductors, expects $27 million in revenue for 2021 and anticipates its revenue to more than double next year with an influx of $320 million from going public, allowing expansion into data centers, solar, and electric vehicles. Co-founders Gene Sheridan and Dan Kinzer celebrated the IPO seven years after starting the El Segundo-based company.

title: Amazon.com Inc. opening 16th distribution facility, at building just east of downtown
summary: Amazon.com Inc. is opening its 16th distribution facility, a "last-mile" delivery station, just east of downtown. This new facility on Lebanon Pike is crucial for accelerating deliveries for Amazon's same-day or Prime services.

title: Trump wants his media company to rival Twitter, Netflix and Amazon
summary: Former President Donald Trump announced the launch of Trump Media & Technology Group (TMTG), aiming to create a media network that rivals Big Tech platforms like Twitter, Netflix, and Amazon. The company plans to launch a social media site called TRUTH Social, develop a subscription video-on-demand service (TMTG+), and build internet technology infrastructure. This initiative comes after Trump's bans from major social media platforms and saw TMTG's stock surge over 350% on its debut through a merger with Digital World Acquisition Corp.

title: One Woman’s Rise to Amazon Director Is Model for Board Diversity
summary: Edith Cooper's recent appointments to the boards of PepsiCo Inc. and Amazon.com Inc. highlight progress in board diversity for women and people of color. Her board changes, along with others, contributed to women gaining 13 net seats on S&P 500 boards in September. Cooper emphasizes that while progress has been made, there is still a significant journey towards achieving parity in power.

title: Amazon Staten Island Warehouse Workers Lead Push to Unionize
summary: Over 2,000 workers at four Amazon.com Inc. facilities in Staten Island have signed a petition to federal labor officials to hold an election to form the Amazon Labor Union. This latest effort follows a failed unionization attempt in Bessemer, Alabama, and comes as labor organizers hope to capitalize on growing public support for essential workers. The union aims to secure higher wages, job security, and better working conditions for Amazon employees.

title: Protesters denounce Netflix over Chappelle transgender comments
summary: Around 100 people protested outside Netflix Inc.'s headquarters in Los Angeles against the streaming company's decision to release Dave Chappelle's new comedy special, which they claim ridicules transgender people. Netflix employees, transgender rights advocates, and public officials participated in the demonstration, raising concerns about the content and sparking a discussion about the line between edgy jokes and harmful speech. This protest follows Netflix's Chief Content Officer Ted Sarandos acknowledging missteps in his communication regarding the special.

title: SpaceX could make Elon Musk world’s first trillionaire, says Morgan Stanley
summary: Morgan Stanley analysts predict that Elon Musk's space exploration company, SpaceX, could elevate him to the status of the world's first trillionaire. While much of his current wealth comes from Tesla, analysts believe SpaceX's advancements in rockets and space infrastructure, including its Starship reusable rockets, position it for significant growth and potentially make it the most highly valued company globally. SpaceX is currently valued at an estimated $200 billion and is expected to rise further as it expands into various industries.

title: Judge Dismisses Amazon Class Action Lawsuit Over Video Ownership
summary: A California judge has dismissed a class action lawsuit against Amazon regarding video ownership, ruling that the plaintiff lacked standing to sue. Amanda Caudel alleged that Amazon could revoke access to purchased videos, but her access to all 36 videos she bought remained available. The lawsuit claimed Amazon misled customers about the permanency of "purchased" digital content compared to rented content for a higher price.

title: Economic impact for small businesses, powered by partnership with Amazon
summary: Amazon's 2021 Small Business Empowerment Report highlights the success of its two-decade-old strategy of embracing third-party sellers, which has benefited both customers and small businesses. Products from small and medium-sized businesses now account for over half of everything sold in Amazon's store, with the company investing more than $18 billion in seller success last year. Amazon's investments and programs have helped sellers launch, scale, and build their brands, leading to the creation of an estimated 1.8 million U.S.-based jobs.

title: As it embarks on nationwide hiring spree, Amazon opens huge shipping facility in Austin area
summary: Amazon.com Inc. has officially opened a 3.8-million-square-foot fulfillment center in Pflugerville, expanding its Central Texas presence. This new facility marks the beginning of a significant local and nationwide hiring push, with an additional 3,000 seasonal jobs anticipated in Austin this year. The investment underscores Amazon's continued growth and demand for labor in the region.

title: Amazon plans to hire 150,000 for holiday, 50% more than in 2020
summary: Amazon.com Inc. is set to hire 150,000 seasonal workers for the upcoming holiday shopping period, marking a 50% increase from the previous year. This hiring surge is part of the company's continuous expansion of its logistics operations, with new facilities opening regularly across the U.S. To attract and retain these workers amid intense competition, Amazon is offering an average starting pay of $18 an hour, along with signing bonuses up to $3,000 and additional incentives for overnight or weekend shifts.

The article discusses the growing trend of enormous special stock awards for startup founders, often far exceeding compensation for CEOs of established companies. It highlights examples like Archer Aviation, Palantir Technologies, and GoodRx Holdings, whose founders received nine-figure packages even before their companies were profitable or generated revenue. This practice contrasts with earlier Silicon Valley norms where founders like Mark Zuckerberg and Jeff Bezos relied on the appreciation of their initial equity, and it raises concerns about shareholder dilution and corporate governance.

title: How Stephen Garden took Onica from class assignment to a multi-million dollar acquisition in just 6 years
summary: Stephen Garden transformed Onica from a class assignment at London Business School into a multi-million dollar acquisition by Rackspace in just six years by focusing on Amazon Web Services expertise. Despite Onica's rapid success and global reach, Garden stepped down from his SVP role at Rackspace in 2020 to prioritize personal well-being, taking a year-long sabbatical. The article highlights the intense dedication required for such entrepreneurial success and the importance of finding life balance.

title: NXP selects AWS to host chip design & verification systems
summary: NXP Semiconductors has chosen AWS as its primary cloud provider for electronic design automation (EDA) workloads, migrating the majority of its EDA systems to AWS infrastructure. This move aims to leverage AWS's scalable compute power to accelerate chip design and verification processes, reduce costs, and minimize scheduling risks. The partnership expands on previous collaborations between NXP and AWS, focusing on accelerating semiconductor innovation and bringing new designs to market faster.

title: How ‘Squid Game’ reveals the flaw in Netflix’s products strategy
summary: Netflix's new partnership with Walmart for a digital storefront, the Netflix Hub, is criticized for its delayed inclusion of merchandise from the hugely popular show "Squid Game." While Netflix aims to diversify revenue through licensed products, the article highlights that fans are more interested in "real" items from the show, like Vans sneakers and tracksuits, which are experiencing massive sales spikes independently, revealing a flaw in Netflix's product strategy. The company's own official merchandise for "Squid Game" is described as limited and generic, not capitalizing on the immediate demand for authentic-looking items from the show.

title: GXO seeks to hire 9,000 workers ahead of peak season
summary: GXO Logistics, Inc. plans to hire 9,000 workers in North America and 20,000 globally to prepare for the upcoming holiday peak season. This hiring surge is coupled with a 40% year-over-year increase in investment in warehouse automation technology, including the deployment of 3,100 robots in North America by year-end. The move addresses a challenging labor market with high job openings while aiming to boost productivity and improve employee experience through automation.

title: Amazon Seeks Used Long-Range Cargo Jets
summary: Amazon.com Inc. is reportedly looking to acquire used long-range Boeing 777-300ER and Airbus A330-300 cargo planes, signaling its intent to expand its cross-border shipping capabilities and compete more directly with UPS and FedEx. The move would allow Amazon to directly import products from countries like China and further reduce its reliance on third-party carriers for its rapidly expanding Amazon Air fleet.

title: Amazon, Third-Party Sellers Spur Fake Goods, Group Says
summary: A report commissioned by the Buy Safe America Coalition claims that third-party marketplaces, particularly Amazon.com Inc., are facilitating a flood of imitation goods into the U.S. market. These counterfeit products are estimated to cost U.S. retailers approximately $54 billion annually in lost sales, with the majority originating from China. The findings coincide with a congressional hearing on an online marketplace bill.

title: Amazon copied products and rigged search results to promote its own brands, documents show
authors: ADITYA KALRA in New Delhi and STEVE STECKLOW in London
summary: Internal Amazon documents reportedly reveal that the e-commerce giant created knockoff goods and manipulated search results to boost its own product lines in India, despite denying such practices. This systematic campaign involved exploiting internal data to copy products and rigging search results to promote Amazon's private brands, with at least two top executives reviewing the strategy. The revelations could intensify regulatory scrutiny Amazon faces for alleged anti-competitive practices globally.

title: Architect completes major redevelopment of West Side office tower where Amazon is a tenant
summary: MdeAS, a New York architecture firm, has finished redeveloping 410 10th Ave., a 20-story office tower on Manhattan's West Side, where Amazon is a tenant. The project involved a significant renovation of the building's exterior. This redevelopment contributes to the ongoing commercial real estate activity in Midtown West.

title: GitLab: Another Overpriced Tech Company
summary: This article argues that GitLab (GTLB) is an overpriced tech company ahead of its IPO, with a projected valuation of $8.2 billion being significantly higher than its intrinsic value. The author highlights GitLab's unprofitable freemium model, fierce competition from profitable industry giants like Microsoft, and several red flags for investors including insider control and potentially misleading non-GAAP metrics. The analysis suggests a fair value for GitLab's stock could be as low as $5/share.

title: ClixTV Launches To Help Streamers Find Something To Watch
summary: ClixTV has launched as a new streaming service designed to help viewers find content across various top subscription services, offering its own short- and long-form programming, trailers, and e-commerce opportunities. Founded by industry veterans Edward Sullivan (CEO), Stacy Jolna (CMO), and Patricia Sullivan (CCO), ClixTV aims to simplify the content search experience for consumers and provide benefits for creators, distributors, and advertisers. The platform is available on multiple devices and services including Roku, Apple TV, Amazon Fire TV, and iOS/Android.

title: Shaping the Future of Delivery, Robot Serve Doesn’t Need a Delivery Man to Bring You Food
summary: Serve Robotics, spun off from Uber-acquired Postmates, has developed a semi-autonomous delivery robot aimed at sustainable and accessible deliveries. These all-electric robots navigate sidewalks using cameras and Lidar sensors, with a human remote override for complex situations. The article highlights Serve's features, such as its 50 lb storage capacity and 3 mph top speed, and discusses its potential impact on delivery costs, traffic, and local restaurant sales.

title: Paul Marshall and Ian Wace’s Stock Picks: Biogen Inc (BIIB), Apple Inc (AAPL) and More
summary: This article details the top stock picks of hedge fund managers Paul Marshall and Ian Wace, based on their Q2 2021 holdings. It highlights a selection of companies including Biogen Inc (BIIB), Apple Inc (AAPL), Zoetis Inc. (ZTS), ViacomCBS Inc. (VIAC), and Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (TMO), providing details on their stake value, company background, and recent analyst ratings or news. The piece also explains the investment philosophy and background of Marshall Wace LLP.

title: Target adds buy now, pay later options with Affirm, Sezzle
summary: Target has partnered with Affirm and Sezzle to offer buy now, pay later options to its shoppers, in anticipation of the holiday season. This initiative aims to provide customers with more flexible and personalized payment solutions. While these options are gaining popularity, concerns exist regarding potential risks for both retailers and consumers, including missed payments and accumulating debt.

title: Amazon's Twitch blames configuration error for data breach
summary: Amazon's Twitch has attributed a recent data breach to an error in a server configuration change, which allowed an alleged hacker to leak sensitive information. The platform is still assessing the full impact but has reset all stream keys, while assuring users that login credentials and full credit card details were not exposed. This incident follows a similar "faulty configuration change" that caused a widespread outage for Facebook Inc.

title: Target adds 'buy now pay later' options with Affirm and Sezzle ahead of holiday shopping season
summary: Target is introducing "buy now, pay later" options with Affirm and Sezzle for shoppers ahead of the 2021 holiday season, following a trend among major retailers. These installment plans offer flexible payment options, particularly appealing to younger consumers and those who may not qualify for traditional credit cards. The new services will also qualify for Target's price match guarantee, with Sezzle for smaller purchases and Affirm for purchases over $100.

title: Discover Equal Weight Benefits With RSP
summary: This article discusses the benefits of equal weight ETFs, using the Invesco S&P 500 Equal Weight ETF (RSP) as a prime example. It explains how equal weighting offers diversification beyond cap-weighted funds and benefits from mean-reversion, despite critics associating its outperformance with size and value factors. The article highlights RSP's long-term outperformance potential and its role in true diversification by preventing a few mega-cap stocks from dominating the index.

title: Bank of America raises U.S. minimum hourly wage to $21
summary: Bank of America announced on Wednesday a raise in its U.S. minimum hourly wage to $21, moving towards its promise of increasing pay to $25 an hour by 2025. This increase is part of a broader trend among major companies to boost employee wages, spurred by pandemic-fueled discussions on fair pay and competitive pressures. The bank has also urged its vendors to adopt a $15 an hour minimum wage, setting a higher standard compared to some competitors.

title: Tiger Global backs Favo, which is building an easier way for Latin Americans to order groceries online
summary: Favo, a Brazilian social commerce platform for online grocery orders, raised $26.5 million in Series A funding led by Tiger Global Management, bringing its total funding to $37 million since 2019. The company enables under-employed entrepreneurs to earn commissions by facilitating last-mile grocery deliveries through local social networks. Favo plans to use the new funds for logistics, fulfillment, and expansion in Brazil and Mexico, aiming to democratize e-commerce across Latin America.

title: Once a pioneer, quantum computer developer D-Wave will start making same types of machines as rivals
summary: D-Wave Systems Inc., an early leader in quantum computing with its specialized "quantum annealing" approach, announced it will now also develop general-purpose "gate-model" quantum computers, aligning with rivals like IBM and Google. This strategic shift aims to broaden the types of problems D-Wave's machines can solve, though the company remains committed to its annealing technology. The move comes after a challenging period for D-Wave, including a significant refinancing and increased competition.

title: HomeGoods finally has a home online
summary: HomeGoods has launched its first e-commerce offering, aiming to complement its physical stores and attract new shoppers. The online strategy for HomeGoods differs slightly from TJX's other sites like TJMaxx.com and Marshalls.com by sharing buyers and inventory due to the fast-turning SKUs in the home category, a move designed to support customer buying needs. This launch comes as the home category continues to thrive, with HomeGoods' comparable sales jumping 36 percent in the second quarter compared to 2019, despite the challenges of shipping bulky items and the ongoing debate about the profitability of e-commerce for off-price retailers.

title: U.S. Supreme Court rebuffs Oracle challenge to Pentagon cloud contract
summary: The U.S. Supreme Court declined to hear Oracle Corp's challenge to the Pentagon's now-canceled $10 billion JEDI cloud computing contract. A lower court had ruled that Oracle was not harmed by any errors in the contract award process as the company would not have qualified. The JEDI contract, initially awarded to Microsoft Corp and later scrapped, is being replaced by a new contract expected to include Amazon.com.

title: Amazon Turns Negative for 2021 as Higher Yields Add to Pressure
summary: Amazon's stock turned negative for 2021 after a sharp decline, marking its longest slump since August 2019. The e-commerce giant's shares are being pressured by rising Treasury yields, which are negatively impacting the earnings outlook for companies with high valuations. Amazon is now the only one of Wall Street's five largest companies to be in negative territory for the year.

title: Rivian Details $1 Billion Loss, Amazon Deal in IPO Filing
summary: Rivian Automotive Inc., an electric vehicle manufacturer backed by Amazon.com Inc., disclosed a net loss of almost $1 billion in the first half of the year in its initial public offering filing. The startup also revealed nearly 50,000 pre-orders for its first vehicles and committed to an exclusive four-year van deal with Amazon. The IPO filing listed a placeholder size of $100 million, which will be adjusted when the terms of the share sale are finalized.

title: Friday’s analyst upgrades and downgrades
summary: This article details various analyst upgrades and downgrades on October 1, 2021, covering companies in the fertilizer, real estate, energy infrastructure, gaming, and renewable royalties sectors. Analysts from Citi, JP Morgan, TD Securities, Credit Suisse, RBC Dominion Securities, Raymond James, National Bank Financial, CIBC World Markets, Scotia Capital, and Piper Sandler provided updated ratings, price targets, and rationales for their investment recommendations. Key companies discussed include Nutrien Ltd., various Canadian REITs, Tidewater Midstream and Infrastructure Ltd., Enthusiast Gaming Holdings Inc., Altius Renewable Royalties Corp., and several large-cap internet stocks.

title: Rivian details $1 billion loss, Amazon deal in IPO filing
summary: Rivian Automotive Inc., an electric pickup maker backed by Amazon.com Inc., disclosed a net loss of almost $1 billion in the first half of the year in its initial public offering paperwork. The company is seeking to be valued at about $80 billion and has significant backing from investors like Amazon and Ford Motor Co., alongside strong pre-order interest for its vehicles. The filing also detailed its exclusive four-year deal with Amazon for delivery vehicles, although Amazon isn't bound by minimum purchase requirements.

title: INSIGHTS | Conservative investors are pairing portfolio with principles
summary: Tom Carter, a mutual fund executive, has launched the American Conservative Values ETF to allow conservative investors to align their portfolios with their principles, avoiding "woke" companies. The fund, which began in October and already manages over $28 million, aims to provide an option for individuals who wish to invest in companies that share their conservative values rather than those that engage in social and racial justice advocacy. This initiative reflects a broader movement where conservatives are using economic choices to "fight back" against companies perceived as aligning with liberal politics.

title: General Motors' Commercial EV Unit To Expand Vehicle Lineup, Add Verizon As Customer
summary: General Motors' BrightDrop electric commercial vehicle business is expanding its lineup with a second delivery van, the EV410, and has secured Verizon Communications Inc. as a customer for this new vehicle. The EV410, aimed at segments requiring smaller vehicles like grocery and telecommunications, will begin production in the second half of 2023 at GM's CAMI assembly plant in Canada. This move highlights GM's increased investment in electric and autonomous vehicles, recognizing the growing demand and financial benefits for commercial EV fleets.

title: Jabil expects to hit over $8B in net revenue in Q1 of 2022
summary: Jabil Inc. (NYSE: JBL) reported strong financial results for the fourth quarter and fiscal year, with net revenue of $7.4 billion and $29.3 billion respectively, despite supply chain challenges. Looking ahead to Q1 2022, the company projects net revenue between $8 billion and $8.6 billion, driven by its diversified business model and opportunities in vehicle electrification, connected healthcare, and infrastructure development. Jabil continues to work with major clients such as Amazon, Tesla, Apple, and Johnson & Johnson.

title: Quick on Their Fleet: Kodiak Builds Flexible, High-Performance Self-Driving Trucks on NVIDIA DRIVE
summary: Kodiak Robotics has unveiled its fourth-generation self-driving truck, powered by NVIDIA DRIVE Orin. The trucks feature a lightweight mapping strategy and a discreet, modular hardware design to achieve level 4 self-driving capabilities, focusing on flexibility and live perception rather than detailed pre-constructed maps. This approach addresses the high demand for delivery and the shortage of drivers in the trucking industry.

title: HP’s Smartest Ink Tank Printer For People That Print A Lot
summary: HP Inc. has launched the new low-cost HP Smart Tank 7000 series printer, designed for individuals with high-volume printing needs. This series emphasizes sustainability, being HP's first ink tank printer made from over 25% recycled plastic, and offers smart features like self-healing Wi-Fi, automatic two-sided printing, and a spill-free refill system. The printers are available in the U.S. priced at USD$399 – $499.

title: Best Buy to Test Return-to-Office Plans Over the Holidays
summary: Best Buy will test its return-to-office plans over the holidays by asking a "small number of teams" to work from its Richfield corporate campus starting in November. This initiative will serve as a road test for the company's long-term hybrid work model, with all returning employees required to be vaccinated against Covid-19. Best Buy expects the majority of its corporate employees to return in early 2022, as many other Twin Cities companies have delayed their return-to-office plans.

title: What Is Blockchain?
summary: This article defines blockchain as a decentralized ledger of shared data, explaining how its cryptographic hashes and peer-to-peer network ensure data integrity, security, and immutability. It details the three main types of blockchain—public, private, and federated—and highlights the significant business benefits, including establishing trust, streamlining operations, and improving security, particularly when integrated with technologies like IoT and AI. The article also introduces Hyperledger as a key open-source initiative promoting enterprise blockchain solutions.

title: Astera Labs, a fabless chip startup, nabs $50M at a $950M valuation to remove bottlenecks in high-bandwidth cloud applications
summary: Astera Labs, a fabless semiconductor company, has raised $50 million in a Series C funding round, valuing the company at $950 million post-money. This funding, led by Fidelity Management and Research, will help the company scale operations and launch new product lines to address bottlenecks in high-bandwidth cloud applications, especially for AI and machine learning workloads. Intel, a strategic backer and customer, is collaborating with Astera Labs on developing PCI Express and CXL technology to enhance server and storage infrastructure.

title: Starbucks pushes back against US workers’ cafe-by-cafe union vote
authors: Amelia Pollard and Josh Eidelson and Bloomberg
summary: Starbucks is opposing unionization efforts by workers in Buffalo, New York, arguing that any union vote should encompass all 20 of its Buffalo-area locations rather than individual cafes. The company's stance challenges a labor board precedent that typically favors smaller bargaining units, with a hearing officer noting that single-location units are "presumptively appropriate." This move by Starbucks aligns with employer preferences for larger units to make unionization more difficult, amidst a broader wave of labor activism at nonunion companies.

title: Daxko
summary: Daxko, a SaaS platform for fitness center management, faced significant challenges during the COVID-19 pandemic due to its customers being heavily impacted. To manage rapid changes, integrate nine acquisitions, and provide crucial support to its clients, Daxko implemented IBM Instana Observability. This allowed them to quickly adapt their product roadmap, gain comprehensive visibility into their complex IT environment, and minimize downtime, ultimately helping their customers navigate the unprecedented times.

title: Samsung to make Tesla’s HW 4.0 self-driving auto chip
summary: Samsung Electronics Co. has won the contract to manufacture Tesla Inc.'s next-generation hardware 4 (HW 4.0) chip for its autonomous driving technology, beating out TSMC. Samsung plans to mass-produce the HW 4.0 chip using 7-nanometer processing technology, ensuring higher production yields and stable functions for Tesla's upcoming vehicles like the Cybertruck. This partnership strengthens Samsung's position in the global foundry market as it competes with TSMC and expands its collaborations with other tech giants like Google and Amazon.

title: Autonomous pilot program tests Paccar-built FedEx trucks in Texas
summary: A new pilot program is testing autonomous Paccar-built FedEx trucks in Texas, utilizing self-driving technology from an Amazon-backed startup. These trucks will operate with a safety driver, autonomously hauling FedEx loads on a 500-mile round trip between Dallas and Houston. The initiative highlights ongoing advancements and investments in autonomous vehicle technology for commercial logistics.

title: Cisco Named a Leader in 2021 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for WAN Edge Infrastructure
summary: Cisco has announced its recognition as a Leader in the 2021 Gartner Magic Quadrant for WAN Edge Infrastructure, highlighting its SD-WAN solutions. These solutions focus on enabling secure, predictable digital experiences for hybrid workforces, building dynamic workspaces, and securing multi-cloud environments, accelerating the transition to a SASE-enabled architecture. Cisco emphasizes its comprehensive capabilities in seamless multicloud access, integrated security, and optimized insights through ThousandEyes integration.

title: Iconix Brand Group Steps Into The Footwear Market With New Licensee for Starter
summary: Iconix Brand Group has signed a three-year licensing agreement with Genesco Inc. to make them the exclusive US and Canadian footwear licensee for STARTER. This deal marks Starter’s return to footwear in the U.S. and Canada after a five-year absence, with a collection of approximately 30 SKUs planned to launch in Spring 2022. The partnership aims to capitalize on the growing consumer demand for heritage brands and expand STARTER's presence in the athletic footwear market.

title: BSX publishes market data to Pyth Network
summary: The Bermuda Stock Exchange (BSX) has started publishing MIAX Pearl Equities market data for ten US companies to the Pyth Network, a decentralized financial market data distribution platform. This initiative marks BSX's first step in providing high-fidelity data to the blockchain industry via the Solana network, with plans to expand the data breadth. The included companies are major US firms like Apple, Amazon, and Tesla, marking a significant development for DeFi markets.

title: BSX Begins Publishing MIAX Pearl Equities
summary: The Bermuda Stock Exchange (BSX), a subsidiary of Miami International Holdings, Inc., has started publishing MIAX Pearl Equities market data for 10 actively traded U.S. companies to the Pyth Network. This marks BSX's first initiative to provide high-fidelity data to the Pyth Network, contributing U.S. equities exchange market data to support DeFi markets. The initial companies include Apple, Amazon, Google, Netflix, and Tesla.

title: Kilroy Pays $490M for Amazon-Anchored Tower
summary: Kilroy Realty Corp. acquired West 8th, a 539,000-square-foot, LEED Platinum certified office tower in Seattle, for $490 million. The building is fully leased, with Amazon occupying approximately 70 percent of the space, and was previously purchased by DWS Group in 2016 for $370 million. This acquisition expands Kilroy's Seattle footprint and follows other significant investments and a disposition by the REIT in Texas and San Francisco.

title: The Climate Pledge Announces 86 New Signatories, Including Procter & Gamble, HP, and Salesforce, Signaling Their Commitment to Achieving Net-Zero Carbon by 2040 or Sooner.
summary: The Climate Pledge has announced 86 new signatories, including major companies like Procter & Gamble, HP, and Salesforce, bringing the total to over 200 global organizations. These companies commit to achieving net-zero carbon by 2040, a decade ahead of the Paris Agreement, and are collectively expected to mitigate 1.98 billion metric tons of carbon emissions annually by 2040. The announcement emphasizes the urgency of collective action by businesses to address climate change based on recent IPCC findings.

title: Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP – The easiest storage decision you’ll ever make
summary: This article argues that Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP is the easiest storage decision for businesses, highlighting its simplicity, built-in technology, and security. The author contrasts FSx for ONTAP's quick setup and transparent pricing with the complexity, high costs, and longer commitment periods associated with Dell's Cloud Storage Services and Pure Storage's Cloud Block Store. The piece emphasizes FSx for ONTAP's native AWS integration and comprehensive features, positioning it as a superior and more cost-effective solution for hybrid cloud storage.

title: 39 Billion by 2026: America’s Carriers Will Nearly Double Their Package Hauls, Data Shows
summary: A Pitney Bowes report indicates U.S. parcel volume surged 37% in 2020 to 20 billion, driven by e-commerce due to the pandemic. The study forecasts a near doubling of parcel volume to 32-39 billion by 2026, with a 10% CAGR. Major carriers like UPS, FedEx, and USPS saw significant revenue growth, while Amazon Logistics rapidly increased its market share.

title: Is a stock market correction on the horizon?
summary: The S&P 500 has seen a recent dip, leading analysts to narrow predictions for the U.S. equity market. While tech stocks may face challenges due to Fed policy and rising interest rates, other sectors like energy and small-caps are showing potential. Despite concerns, corrections are normal, and many analysts remain bullish on long-term market growth, suggesting current dips could be buying opportunities.

title: WSJ News Exclusive | CEO’s Father Gets a $3.6 Billion Stock Windfall at Carvana
summary: Ernie Garcia II, father of Carvana Co.'s CEO, has sold over $3.6 billion in Carvana stock since October, representing 16% of his holdings. This windfall is attributed to a corporate ownership structure that benefits the family and allows them to maintain control, though it may be at the expense of other shareholders. The article highlights how his stock sales rank him among the top individuals for earnings from company stock sales in the past year, excluding prominent tech and retail magnates.

title: Salesforce values and culture driven innovation
summary: This article explores how Salesforce has evolved from a CRM company to a leading cloud and productivity organization, driven by its core values and culture. Field CTO Adam Spearing discusses how the company's focus has shifted towards digital transformation, accelerated by the pandemic, and highlights key acquisitions like Tableau and Slack. The piece emphasizes the importance of culture, customer-centric innovation, and collaborative ecosystems in Salesforce's strategy for future growth.

title: Corsair Sabre RGB Pro Wireless gaming mouse review
summary: The Corsair Sabre RGB Pro Wireless gaming mouse offers an ultra-light build, strong performance, and freedom of movement, despite being slightly less fast than its wired counterpart. It features 2K polling, 26K DPI, and customizable settings through the robust iCue software, making it an affordable and versatile option for most gamers.

title: Calavo Growers appoints Amazon executive as CFO
summary: Calavo Growers, Inc. announced the appointment of Mariela Matute as Chief Financial Officer, effective October 11, 2021. Matute previously served as Director and CFO for Amazon Business, bringing extensive financial expertise and relevant industry background to Calavo. The company expects her leadership to help execute its strategic plan, accelerate profitable growth, and enhance shareholder value.

title: After Brazil, Shopee tops rankings in Mexico, Colombia and Chile - now available to 1B people
summary: Shopee has expanded its dominance in Latin America, becoming the most downloaded shopping app in Mexico, Colombia, and Chile, mirroring its success in Brazil. Parent company Sea Ltd. secured an additional US$6 billion in funding to fuel aggressive market expansion. Shopee is also planning to enter the European market, starting with Poland, seeking to replicate its developing-world success in more established economies.

title: SAP and Amazon Business Partner to Expand Buyer Choice
summary: SAP and Amazon Business have partnered to integrate Amazon Business into SAP Ariba solutions, allowing employees to purchase from Amazon Business directly within SAP Ariba. This collaboration aims to expand buyer choice and simplify procurement for general business goods, leveraging a real-time search API and extending to the Concur Expense solution. The integration is set to roll out globally, beginning with early adopters in the United States.

title: Procore Appoints Sandra Benson as Global Head of Industry Transformation
summary: Procore Technologies, Inc. has appointed construction technology expert Sandra Benson as its Global Head of Industry Transformation. In this new role, Benson will advise Procore’s product and sales engineering teams on customer and partner requirements, leveraging her extensive experience in the building and construction technology industry. She is also a presidential appointee to the Board of Directors of the National Institute of Building Sciences (NIBS).

title: Apple can’t force developers to use its in-app payment system, federal judge rules
summary: A federal judge ruled that Apple Inc. can no longer compel developers to use its in-app payment system, allowing them to bypass commission fees of 15% to 30%. This decision, stemming from the Epic Games Inc. case, could significantly alter how apps are distributed by dominant online platforms like Apple, Alphabet Inc. (Google), and Amazon.com Inc. However, the ruling stopped short of declaring Apple an antitrust monopolist.

title: Ulta Beauty Inc. stock outperforms competitors on strong trading day
summary: Ulta Beauty Inc. (ULTA) stock rose 1.54% to $382.08 on a generally down day for the market, outperforming the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average. The stock closed $32.90 below its 52-week high and also outperformed key competitors like CVS Health Corp., Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc., and Amazon.com Inc. Trading volume was slightly below its 50-day average.

title: Amazon to open warehouse in Delta Township, bringing 500 jobs
summary: Amazon.com, Inc. announced plans to open a 1-million-square-foot fulfillment center in Delta Township, Michigan, which will create over 500 full-time jobs. This will be Amazon's eighth fulfillment center in the state and its first in mid-Michigan, focusing on larger items. The facility is expected to be operational next year, with employees earning an average of $17 an hour plus healthcare benefits.

title: PayPal Buys Paidy in A $2.7 Billion Deal to Expand Buy Now Pay Later Service
summary: PayPal Holdings Inc. announced its acquisition of Japanese buy now, pay later (BNPL) firm Paidy for 300 billion yen ($2.7 billion) to expand its presence in Japan, the world's third-largest e-commerce market. This cash deal, expected to close in Q4 2021, aims to leverage Paidy's established BNPL solutions and 6 million users to boost PayPal's position in this strategically important market. The acquisition is part of a larger trend in the payment industry, with other major players like Square and Amazon also investing heavily in BNPL services.

title: Lennox announces new integration of its iComfort thermostat
summary: Lennox has expanded the compatibility of its iComfort thermostats to integrate with various smart home automation platforms, including premium systems like Control4 and popular virtual assistants such as Amazon Alexa, Apple HomeKit, Google Assistant, and IFTTT. This integration allows users to manage their Lennox heating and cooling systems through a wider range of smart home devices, offering enhanced convenience and control over their indoor environment. Control4 customers with Lennox HVAC systems and iComfort S30, E30, or M30 thermostats can request integration through their dealer, enabling centralized control from their smart home system.

title: Kroger eyes potential entry into Southwest Florida marketplace
summary: Kroger is planning to expand its online-only grocery delivery service into Southwest Florida, eyeing Naples and Fort Myers for a new distribution "spoke" facility within the next year. This expansion would create up to 180 new jobs and intensify competition with existing grocery delivery services from Publix, Walmart, Target, and Amazon, all without building any physical stores. Kroger's strategy relies on highly automated fulfillment centers and "spoke" facilities to extend delivery reach.

title: Alphabet, Tesla and Amazon are among the most favourite stocks held by US-focused mutual funds. Here are top 10 stocks
summary: This article identifies Alphabet, Tesla, and Amazon as top stock holdings among U.S.-focused mutual funds available to Indian investors. It details 10 such mutual funds, highlighting their investment strategies, underlying assets, and historical performance. The funds provide Indian investors exposure to leading US companies and geographical diversification.

title: Thinking outside the box: AWS signals a new era for storage
summary: Amazon Web Services is projected to generate $9 billion in storage revenue in 2021, becoming the second-largest enterprise storage supplier behind Dell Technologies, and is expected to surpass $11 billion in 2022. At its third annual Storage Day, AWS announced a significant partnership with NetApp Inc. to run its full ONTAP stack natively in the cloud as a managed service, alongside other storage service enhancements. This move signals AWS's continued drive to innovate in data storage, challenging traditional on-premises models and expanding into hybrid cloud and data mesh conversations.

title: Amazon to open 200,000-square-foot delivery station on Northern Virginia's outskirts
summary: Amazon.com Inc. is set to open a new 200,000-square-foot delivery station in Fredericksburg, Virginia, later this month. This move is part of the e-commerce giant's strategy to locate larger fulfillment centers just outside major metropolitan areas.

title: WWD: American Eagle Outfitters Logs $121 Million Profit; Acquires Logistics Company
summary: American Eagle Outfitters reported a $121 million profit and acquired logistics firm Airterra to enhance its supply chain and offer faster delivery services, including same-day delivery. This strategic acquisition positions AEO to compete with major retailers like Amazon, Walmart, and Target in last-mile delivery. The company also saw strong revenue growth across its brands, particularly Aerie, and updated its operating income outlook.

title: 7 Robotics Stocks to Buy for Elon Musk’s Big ‘Tesla Bot’ Bet
summary: This article highlights seven robotics stocks that are poised for lucrative returns, driven by the increasing demand for robotics across various industries and tech giants like Tesla and Amazon. It discusses the market growth projections for industrial robotics and provides detailed analysis, financial data, and future outlook for each recommended stock, including ABB, AeroVironment, Global X Robotics & Artificial Intelligence ETF, Intuitive Surgical, iRobot, Oceaneering International, and Raytheon Technologies. The author emphasizes that these companies leverage automation and AI to enhance efficiency and address evolving market needs.

title: 13 Undervalued Wide-Moat Companies With Exceptional Leadership
summary: This article identifies 13 undervalued wide-moat companies with exceptional leadership, as determined by Morningstar's Capital Allocation ratings. The companies listed earn an "Exemplary" capital allocation rating and are trading in the 4- and 5-star range. The article highlights Amazon, Compass Minerals, and Roche Holding ADR with detailed analyst commentary on their capital allocation strategies.

title: Amazon Web Services works with Adobe Experience Cloud as it reimagines B2B marketing
summary: This article details how Amazon Web Services (AWS) leveraged Adobe Experience Cloud to transform its B2B marketing strategy, particularly in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. It highlights AWS's successful pivot to virtual events, such as re:Invent, and how Adobe's analytics, personalization, and marketing automation tools enabled a seamless and personalized digital customer journey. The collaboration aims to further enhance personalization and optimize customer engagement in future hybrid events.

title: Arlo Offers Comprehensive Third-Party Compatibility With Amazon, Apple, Google, Samsung, And Others For Seamless Smart Home Security Experience
summary: Arlo Technologies announced enhanced compatibility for its smart home security systems with major platforms like Amazon Alexa, Apple HomeKit, Google Home Assistant, IFTTT, and Samsung SmartThings. These integrations provide users with seamless control over their Arlo devices through voice commands, notifications, and live video feeds on various smart home devices, reflecting Arlo's commitment to a robust and integrated security experience. The updates aim to offer peace of mind regardless of the user's preferred smart home ecosystem.

title: Kroger is delivering groceries around Florida now. What to know and should Publix worry?
summary: Kroger has launched an e-commerce grocery delivery service in Florida using an e-commerce hub in Groveland, covering a 90-mile radius. This marks Kroger's first e-commerce venture in Florida without brick-and-mortar stores, utilizing automated warehouses and Kroger-trained employees for delivery. The move is expected to introduce competition to the Florida grocery market, particularly for established retailers like Publix.

title: Electric vehicle company Rivian has confidentially filed for an IPO
summary: Electric vehicle startup Rivian has confidentially filed paperwork with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission to go public. The company, backed by investors like Ford and Amazon, has raised approximately $10.5 billion to date and was valued at $27.6 billion in January. Rivian plans to deliver its first R1T pickup truck in September.

title: SK Telecom Introduces New Subscription Service
summary: SK Telecom launched T Universe, a new subscription platform, aiming for 36 million subscribers and 8 trillion won in annual gross merchandise value by 2025. This service partners with major companies like Amazon, E-Mart, Starbucks, Google One, and Xbox Game Pass to offer a wide array of products and digital services. The company plans to leverage AI and a network of offline stores to provide personalized subscription offerings, anticipating significant growth in the global subscription market.

title: Amazon Announces Two New Cybersecurity Initiatives Aimed To Protect Organizations and Individuals
summary: Amazon announced two new cybersecurity initiatives to protect organizations and individuals: making its Security Awareness training available to the public and offering free Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) devices to qualified AWS customers. The Security Awareness training aims to educate against cyberattacks like social engineering, while MFA devices provide a stronger security posture for sensitive information. These initiatives are designed to help combat increasing cybersecurity threats by enhancing education and providing stronger security tools.

title: Target's stock buybacks represent a bet it will be more valuable in the future
summary: Target's recent authorization of a $15 billion stock repurchase program is examined in the context of capital allocation. The article argues that while buybacks are often seen as short-term thinking, they can be a disciplined use of capital when other investment opportunities don't meet ROI criteria. This strategy reflects a long-term belief in the company's future value, as demonstrated by past buybacks at significantly lower prices.

title: Like the QQQ ETF? Don't Forget About 'QQQM'
summary: This article highlights the Invesco NASDAQ 100 ETF (QQQM) as an alternative to the popular Invesco QQQ Trust (QQQ) for long-term investors. While QQQ is favored by traders, QQQM offers a lower expense ratio and a more accessible share price, making it suitable for buy-and-hold strategies aiming to capitalize on the growth of Nasdaq's largest non-financial companies.

title: He built an $8.9 billion fortune. Then the controversies began.
summary: Bom Kim, founder of South Korean e-commerce giant Coupang, amassed an $8.9 billion fortune and was initially seen as a new kind of self-made billionaire. However, months after Coupang's blockbuster IPO, a series of controversies have emerged, causing some South Koreans to re-evaluate their perception of Kim and his company. The article highlights the shift from initial praise for his wealth generation to current scrutiny over business practices.

title: Cybersecurity Experts Worried by Chinese Firm’s Control of Smart Devices
summary: Cybersecurity experts are concerned about Chinese firm Tuya Inc.'s control over smart devices given China's law requiring companies to share data with the government. This raises significant privacy and security issues for consumer data collected through IoT devices in U.S. households and other sectors. Experts are urging U.S. lawmakers to implement regulations or bans on Tuya and other Chinese tech companies to mitigate these potential national security and privacy risks.
source: VOA - Voice of America English News
source_domain: VOA - Voice of America English News

title: Big retailers book pricey private cargo ships in holiday scramble
summary: Major retailers like Walmart, Home Depot, and Ikea are chartering private cargo ships and buying their own containers to bypass supply chain disruptions ahead of the holiday season. These unprecedented and costly measures are being taken to ensure shelves remain stocked amid surging consumer demand and port congestion. This strategy gives larger retailers a competitive advantage over smaller businesses facing inventory shortages.

title: For Long-Term Investors, a QQQ-to-QQQM Switch May Make Sense
summary: The article discusses how long-term investors might benefit from switching from the Invesco QQQ Trust (QQQ) to the Invesco NASDAQ 100 ETF (QQQM) due to QQQM's lower expense ratio.
